title: Reimagining Gender in Technology - Designing Safer Digital Futures and Advancing Ethical AI for Inclusive Platforms
description: Grounded in evidence and lived realities, this initiative shares research and practice-based insights on approaches to improve the safety, inclusivity, and accessibility of digital spaces for women and marginalised groups. It outlines pathways towards ethical and inclusive digital futures, including actionable steps to strengthen transparency and protection. The session will also examine cross-sector collaboration across government, the private sector, academia, civil society, and international stakeholders.
speakers: Andrea Wojnar, UNFPA; Her Excellency May-Elin Stener, Ambassador of Norway to India, Sri Lanka, Bhutan and the Maldives; Kalpana Yadav, UNFPA India; Mr. Rajiv Makhani, Tech Guru; Ms. Arpita Kanjilal, Digital Empowerment Foundation; Ms. Carolyn Florey, Asian Development Bank; Ms. Uthara Ganesh, Snapchat; Nehaa Chaudhari, Ikigai Law; Soha Ali Khan, UNFPA
summary_one_liner: Urgent call to make AI safer for women and girls
icebreaker: Ask Andrea Wojnar about designing safety features that center women's lived experiences in digital spaces.
networking_tip: Connect with speakers working on digital safety—they value cross-sector partnerships for impact.

title: AI and the Future of Skilling: Strengthening Human Capital and Transforming Higher Education Institutions
description: As AI transforms economies, developing strong human capital is increasingly important for workforce readiness. This session on "AI and the Future of Skilling" at the India AI Impact Summit 2026 will convene stakeholders from government, industry, and academia to discuss approaches to building an AI-ready workforce. The discussion will explore policy pathways, industry–academia collaboration, institutional AI readiness, future-focused skilling frameworks, and capacity-building across higher education to support employability, innovation, and broader adoption.
speakers: Ashish Kulkarni, Indian Institute of Creative Technologies and National Chairman - AVGC-XR Forum | Pioneer of India's Creative Technology Ecosystem; Dr. Manish Kumar, NSDC, Championing AI First Solution for Skilling; Narayanan Ramaswamy, KPMG; Professor MS Vijay Kumar, MIT's Education Innovation Movement; Shankar Maruwada, EkStep Foundation
summary_one_liner: KPMG-led blueprint for building India's AI-ready workforce
icebreaker: Professor Vijay Kumar on industry-academia gaps—what's blocking your org's campus hiring?
networking_tip: University admins here—propose a quick coffee to discuss how your L&D aligns with their curricula.

title: Harnessing AI to Transform India's Judicial Ecosystem
description: AI has the potential to revolutionise India's judicial system by enhancing efficiency, transparency, and accessibility. It can enable predictive analytics for informed decision-making, automate case management, facilitate legal research, and support virtual courts, leading to faster dispute resolution, reduced backlog, and improved access to justice. This session will examine the transformative potential of AI, assess implementation challenges, and explore strategies for leveraging technology to create an efficient, transparent, and inclusive judicial system.
speakers: Arya Tripathy, Cyril Amarchand Mangaldas; Dr. Aparajita Bhatt, National Law University Delhi; Hon'ble Mr Justice Dinesh Maheshwari, Chairman law retired; Mr. Vikas Mahendra, TERES; Prof(Dr) G S Bajpai, NLU Delhi; Sh. Rajnish Kumar, NeGD; Sh. Shardul Shroff, Shardul Amarchand Mangaldas
summary_one_liner: AI could slash India's massive judicial backlog dramatically
icebreaker: Shardul, how are you seeing AI reshape case backlogs in Indian courts right now?
networking_tip: Judges and court officials attend rarely—find them in Q&A. Policy makers cluster near the stage. Hit the reception early for 1-on-1s.

title: Inside India's Frontier Lab and Its Global South Impact
description: This flagship session presents a first look at frontier AI developments, including a foundation model initiative. The showcase features applied systems, illustrating how frontier research translates into real-world impact. Joined by leaders across industry, infrastructure, and policy, the session highlights efforts to build end-to-end AI capabilities aligned with national priorities and broader relevance across emerging markets.
speakers: Abhishek Upperwal, Soket AI; Dr. Mayank Singh, IIT Gandhinagar; Mr. Joseph Joshy, International Financial Services Centres Authority (IFSCA); Mr. Rangarajan V, Adani Defence & Aerospace; Mr. Sahil Arora, Qualcomm; Mr. Sunil Gupta, Yotta Data Services
knowledge_partners: Soket Labs Technology and Research Private Limited
summary_one_liner: India's frontier AI lab unveils its foundation model ambitions
icebreaker: Which application from Mayank Singh's lab excites you most for your next venture?
networking_tip: Deep Tech Investors attending—sit in the front row, approach speakers immediately after for follow-ups.

title: Embedding Trust in Innovation: AI Governance and Quality Infrastructure for Growth
description: This roundtable convenes policymakers, regulators, industry leaders, and global experts to shape trusted pathways for AI adoption. It examines how AI-enabled Quality Infrastructure can strengthen governance, accountability, and global acceptance. Through applied use cases and international perspectives, it highlights interoperable assurance frameworks that reduce compliance friction, boost MSME competitiveness, enable cross-border trade, and position India as a leader in responsible, innovation-driven AI growth for inclusive, secure, and scalable digital transformation.
speakers: Amanda Craig, Microsoft; Ashutosh Bahuguna, CERT-In; Chakravathy T Kannan, Quality Council of India; Jagdheesh Manian, Bureau Veritas; Richard Skalt, AIQI Consortium
summary_one_liner: Governance frameworks that make AI trustworthy for global trade
icebreaker: How is your org approaching AI compliance—Ashutosh's framework or building your own?
networking_tip: This roundtable is smaller and intimate—arrive early to secure seat near a regulator or policy maker.

title:
Culturally - Grounded AI: How Social Norms Can Inform AI 
Systems
description: AI systems deployed across diverse cultural contexts often fail not because of technical limitations, but because they overlook social norms—the unwritten rules that shape human behaviour and decision-making. A recommendation system that succeeds in the United States may not resonate in India. A health chatbot that effectively engages American users may alienate Indian communities if it does not reflect local expectations and communication styles. This research-focused session convenes leading scholarship and applied work examining how culturally grounded design, local data partnerships, and participatory methods can improve AI performance across contexts. The emphasis is on embedding social understanding into model development to ensure effectiveness, legitimacy, and equitable impact across geographies.
speakers: Amita Yadav, Karya; Mohit Jain, PhD, Microsoft Research India, Bangalore; Philipp Zimmer, World Bank Group, Washington DC; Sharath Chandra Guntuku, PhD, University of Pennsylvania, School of Engineering and Applied Science; Sunny Rai, PhD, University of Pennsylvania, School of Engineering and Applied Science
summary_one_liner: Cultural norms are key to building AI people actually trust
icebreaker: Sharath Guntuku's research on social norms—how does that apply to your specific cultural context?
networking_tip: Chat with anthropologists during breaks—they bridge research and real-world deployment challenges.

title: AI for Smart and Resilient Agriculture: From Research to Solutions
description: This session will bring together diverse perspectives to explore how artificial intelligence can support sustainable, efficient, and climate-resilient agriculture. It will examine farmers' needs, the scientific and data challenges shaping AI-driven innovation, and the conditions required for impartial adoption and sovereignty. The discussion will bridge research and on-ground experience, highlighting practical applications, policy considerations, and future pathways to ensure AI solutions are inclusive, scalable, and relevant across different agricultural contexts
speakers: Dr. Bharat KAKADE, BAIF Research Development Fondation NGO; Dr. Carole CARANTA, INRAE Research institution; Dr. Thierry CAQUET, INRAE Research institution; Dr. Vincent MARTIN, FAO Intergovernmental institution; Henri VERDIER, Inria Foundation CEO; Henry VAN BURGSTEDEN, Senior Innovation Officer
summary_one_liner: French-Indian alliance brings AI to climate-resilient farming
icebreaker: Dr. Kakade, what's the biggest gap you see between AI research and what farmers actually need on the ground?
networking_tip: Target the agritech founders early—they'll cluster around Dr. Carole Caranta. High decision-maker density means real partnerships form here.

title: AI for Road Safety: Data-Driven Solutions for Enhancing Road Safety in India
description: This session explores how artificial intelligence can drive measurable impact in improving road safety across India. It highlights data-driven approaches for understanding crash patterns, predicting risks and enabling proactive interventions. The discussion focuses on scalable AI applications that support safer mobility, training drivers and building data driven hyperlocal models, aligning with Vikshit Bharat 2047 vision of technology-led impact for public good.
speakers: Atul Singh, Centre of Excellence for Road Safety, IIT Madras; Col Sanjiv Kumar Sharma, Centre of Excellence for Road Safety, IIT Madras; Dr Pushkar Patwardhan, LightMetrics Technologies pvt Ltd; Prof. Venkatesh Balasubramanian, Centre of Excellence for Road Safety, IIT Madras; Shri Dheepan Raja Jayabalan, Volvo Group; Shri Pankaj Aggarwal, Ministry of Road Transport and Highways; Shri Pankaj Mehra, Centre of Excellence for Road Safety, IIT Madras; Shri Ramendra Pratap Shukla, Ministry of Road Transport and Highways; Shri Vivek Panchal, Ministry of Road Transport and Highways
knowledge_partners: Centre of Excellence for Road Safety, IIT Madras
summary_one_liner: IIT Madras shows how AI can save lives on Indian roads
icebreaker: Prof. Venkatesh's crash prediction models—are you considering AI for your city's safety initiatives?
networking_tip: Policy makers and urban planners are concentrated—pitch data-driven ideas during the networking break.

title: Multilingual AI in Universities - Advancing Inclusion Through UA and Stakeholder Insights
description: As digital technologies become central to education, linguistic accessibility emerges as a critical equity issue. This study examines how universities enable multilingual participation through UA. Drawing on Diffusion Innovation Theory (DIT) and Technology Acceptance Model (TAM), this investigation reviews stakeholder experiences across universities in Asia and Europe using an innovative AI-assisted interview methodology. The findings also revealed critical gaps in universities' capacity to advance UN SDG 4/9/10/17 through inclusive digital infrastructure while presenting billions of dollars opportunity.
speakers: Sameer Gahlot, National Internet Exchange of India
summary_one_liner: How universities can use AI for true multilingual inclusion
icebreaker: Sameer's multilingual AI research—how's your platform handling non-English learners?
networking_tip: Smaller speaker count means more intimate Q&A—ask about pilot programs for your institution.

title: The Future of Employability in the Age of AI
description: AI will create more job opportunities but also make many existing jobs redundant. This will also require skilling and re-skilling of workers across the spectrum. The Panel Discussion will focus on short-term and long-term impact of AI on employment, both at the industry level (e.g., manufacturing, healthcare, automobile) and function level (e.g., HR, sales, supply chain). Moreover, the panel will identify steps to be taken to mitigate the risks by enhancing opportunities.
speakers: Dr. V Anantha Nageswaran, GoI; Mr. Alok Agrawal, AI4India; Mr. Sanjeev Bhikchandani, InfoEdge; Mr. Sateesh Seetharamiah, EdgeVerve; Mr. Vineet Nayar, Sampark Foundation; Ms. Smita Prakash, ANI; Prof. Anurag Mairal, Stanford University of Medicine; Shashi Shekhar Vempati, AI4India
summary_one_liner: India's top economists and CEOs debate AI's jobs impact
icebreaker: Sanjeev Bhikchandani's hiring platform view—what reskilling gaps is your org tackling?
networking_tip: CHROs and CEOs dominate—attend the pre-panel mixer or stay post-discussion for director-level conversations.

title: From Vision to Action: Scaling Equitable AI Advisory Systems Through AGX AI
description: This interactive session convenes leaders advancing AI advisory systems in agriculture to explore AGX AI as a growing community of practice focused on responsibly scaling AI for small-scale producers. Drawing on work in benchmarking, data corpus development, and model approaches, the session highlights emerging learning priorities, key collaboration needs, and opportunities for participants to help shape the next phase of shared learning across regions and sectors.
speakers: Mr. David Bergvinson, DevGlobal; Mr. Michael Minkoff, Athena Infonomics; Ms. Julianna Drinan, Gates Foundation; Ms. Sophie Barrowman, DevGlobal
summary_one_liner: Scaling trusted AI farm advisors for small-scale producers globally
icebreaker: David Bergvinson's AGX AI—are you scaling advisory systems for smallholders too?
networking_tip: Agritech founders outnumber others here—organize a quick coffee chat during the interactive session.

title: Leadership Talk: Harnessing AI for the Future of Learning and Work
description: This leadership talk explores how AI is reshaping global employment and redefining future skills. It highlights the need for continuous, skills-based learning to build resilient, future-ready talent, and examines how education systems, workforce strategies, and policy frameworks must align. Through real-world examples, it showcases practical, collaborative approaches to accelerating AI readiness and closing critical skills gaps.
speakers: Dr. Matteo Zallio, University of Cambridge; Mustafa Furniturewala, Coursera; Rajiv Tandon, BITS Pilani - Digital; Sanjay Jain, Google; Tapish Bhatt, Coursera
summary_one_liner: AI is redefining skills—education and workforce must adapt now
icebreaker: Dr. Zallio mentioned skills-based hiring—what gaps are you seeing in your talent pipeline?
networking_tip: L&D Directors cluster together—position yourself near them for concrete upskilling partnership talks.

title: Her First Algorithm, India's Next Breakthrough
description: This session will feature student-led AI innovations addressing agriculture, livelihoods, and healthcare challenges. It will also include a rapid pitch by Cognitii, an AI startup advancing inclusive education.
speakers:
Deepali Upadhyay, Program Lead, Atal Innovation Mission



; Intelligent Grain Storage System (Delhi Public School, Haryana); Desh Kee Hath (Nagarjuna model school, Andhra Pradesh); EnerVision - A Comprehensive Platform for Chronic Fatigue Syndrome Management (Adarsh Public School, Delhi)
summary_one_liner: Student-led AI solving agriculture, health, and education challenges
icebreaker: Ask Deepali about the most unexpected innovation from student teams this year.
networking_tip: Connect with student founders—they're pre-fundraising and hungry for mentorship.

title: Safe & Trusted AI at Scale
description: As AI adoption accelerates from isolated pilots to enterprise-wide integration, attention is shifting toward the creation of safe, trusted, and scalable ecosystems. This high-impact session examines practical implementation frameworks, governance architectures, and leadership strategies that reconcile rapid innovation with accountability and risk management. The emphasis is on operationalising responsible AI in ways that deliver measurable outcomes while safeguarding security, regulatory compliance, and long-term resilience. By convening policymakers, industry leaders, and technology experts, the session advances a systems-level understanding of how AI can be deployed at scale to drive productivity, institutional trust, and inclusive growth in an increasingly AI-driven global economy.
speakers: Arvind Kumar, STPI; Ashok Meena, Ministry of Jal Shakti; Dr . Piyush Singla, Govt of J&K; Dr Rajiv KN, BWSSB; Dr. Ravi Gupta, Elets Technomedia; Mohammed Safirulla, India AI Mission; Sid Sheth, d-MATRIX
summary_one_liner: Enterprise AI governance and safe-scale implementation frameworks
icebreaker: Ask Arvind Kumar how STPI is bridging trusted AI policy with enterprise adoption.
networking_tip: Government attendees here—position solutions as policy-aligned, not disruptive.

title: GTM Clinic: Answers for AI Founders
description: This session will feature practical insights for AI founders navigating go-to-market challenges, followed by a rapid pitch spotlighting an innovative startup working on AI-validated 3D bio-printed disease models for Oral Submucous Fibrosis.
speakers:
Anurag Deb, India AI Mission
; Rimjhim Ray, Partner & Co-founder, Goa Angels & Spotle AI
summary_one_liner: Practical go-to-market playbook for AI founders seeking early traction
icebreaker: Ask Rimjhim what GTM mistake she sees most in biotech AI startups.
networking_tip: Goa Angels partner present—prepare a 60-second pitch if healthcare AI is your space.

title: Startup Spotlight 1: Cognitii: Democratizing access to special needs education using technology
description: A rapid pitch by an exceptional AI startup, selected for its innovation and impact
speakers: Falguni Shrivastava
summary_one_liner: EdTech AI enabling special needs education access and outcomes
icebreaker: Ask Falguni how Cognitii's tech handles diverse learning disabilities.
networking_tip: Impact investors often attend EdTech demos—have your BLIP metrics ready.

title: From AI User to Creator: The Next Leap of India's AI Innovation
description:
India has emerged as one of the world's largest adopters of AI, driven by scale of data, digital public infrastructure, and enterprise digitisation. However, the next strategic leap lies in transitioning from being predominantly an AI user to becoming a creator of indigenous AI systems. 
This session will examine what it takes for India to move decisively up the AI value chain: from deploying models to building home-grown AI solutions.
speakers: Ankush Sabharwal, CoRover.ai; Amlan Mohanty, NITI Aayog and Carnegie India; Navrina Singh, Credo AI; Pratyush Kumar, Sarvam AI; Santhosh Viswanathan, Intel; Shri Jitin Prasada, GoI; Suresh Yadav, The Commonwealth ; Vishal Dhupar, Nvidia
summary_one_liner: India's strategic leap from AI consumer to indigenous AI creator
icebreaker: Shri Jitin Prasada's focus on digital sovereignty—how's that reshaping your AI strategy for India?
networking_tip: VCs and startup founders will jam at breaks. Have your indigenous AI angle ready in 30 seconds.

title: Roundtable on AI for Decarbonisation and Circularity: Building India's Low-Carbon Infrastructure
description: As India advances its climate and circularity ambitions, artificial intelligence is emerging as a critical enabler of low-carbon transformation. This panel will explore how AI can support decarbonisation across supply chains, infrastructure, and waste systems, while addressing challenges related to data, scale, and governance. Bringing together voices from civil society, industry, and the innovation ecosystem, the discussion will focus on practical pathways, policy enablers, and collaborative models to accelerate sustainable, system-level impact.
speakers: Bishakha Bhattacharya, Wipro; Debajit Palit, Chintan Research Foundation; Lena Robra, Swissnex, India; Mr. Abhishek Gupta, WeVOIS; Mr. Anand Sri Ganesh, NSRCEL, IIM Bangalore; Mr. Vedant Taneja, Beyond Renewables; Ms. Sapna Bhawnani, Alstom; Rohan Chhatwal, Maruti Suzuki
knowledge_partners: NSRCEL, The Indian Institute of Management Bangalore (IIMB)
summary_one_liner: IIM Bangalore roundtable on AI-driven decarbonization pathways
icebreaker: Abhishek, which decarbonization use cases are ESG investors actually funding right now?
networking_tip: Roundtable format = intimate. Sit next to an ESG investor or climate tech founder. Ask follow-up questions during discussion—shows domain knowledge.

title: Information Integrity as an Infrastructure for Trust: Empowering Youth and Future Generations
description: The proliferation of generative AI and algorithmic content systems has created a new kind of risk for young users globally: Increasing exposure to manipulative design, hyper-personalized content, and AI-generated information at an overwhelming scale. Age-Appropriate Design (AAD) is a policy and design framework that helps develop safer, more accountable digital environments with the best interests of children in mind.
speakers: Alpesh Shah, IEEE Standards Association (IEEE SA); Amir Banifatemi, AI Commons; Gabriela Ramos, IEEE; Karine Perset, OECD; Mariagrazia Squicciarini, Unesco; Mohammed Misbahuddin, C-DAC Bangalore; Moira Patterson, IEEE SA; Tanya Perelmuter, Fondation Abeona; Uyi Stewart, Inclusive Innovation & Analytics at Mastercard; Yuko Harayama, IEEE; Yuko Harayama, RIKEN in charge of international affairs
summary_one_liner: Protecting youth from AI manipulation with age-appropriate design
icebreaker: With Gabriela Ramos on the panel—how are you tackling manipulative design in your products for younger users?
networking_tip: Child safety advocates and platform governance leaders care deeply about this. Find the edtech and platform folks; they're invested in the outcome.

title: Harnessing AI for Water Resilience and Sustainable Growth
description: As artificial intelligence becomes the backbone of global economic growth, its physical footprint is expanding rapidly particularly through energy-intensive, water-dependent data centres and digital infrastructure. At the same time, AI is emerging as one of the most powerful tools available to solve the world's most urgent water challenges: scarcity, leakage, contamination, flooding, and inequitable access.
speakers: David Wood, ICfS; Shruti Kapil, ICFS; Sujith Nair, Foundation for Interoperability in Digital Economy
summary_one_liner: AI's water paradox: data centers consume it, AI can save it
icebreaker: David, what's the water impact of a typical AI data center most people don't realize?
networking_tip: Water tech founders and sustainability officers mix here. Sustainability people often attend sessions back-to-back—grab them between talks.

title:
Unlocking AI's Potential for Agricultural Innovation and DPI-Enabled Economic 
Growth
description: This session explores how artificial intelligence, supported by digital public infrastructure, can strengthen agricultural systems and drive inclusive economic growth. It focuses on practical pathways to deliver trusted, data-driven advisory services, improve farmer decision-making, and enable scalable innovation through interoperable systems, partnerships, and governance frameworks that support real-world impact.
speakers: Fatema AlMulla, International Affairs Office of the Court; Jagadish Babu, EkStep Foundation; Nidhi Bhasin, Digital Green Trust; Niriksha Shetty, PxD; Sanjay Jain, Gates Foundation
summary_one_liner: Gates Foundation drives AI-powered digital public infra for farmers
icebreaker: Sanjay, which DPI-enabled agricultural models are Gates Foundation backing right now?
networking_tip: Development finance leaders + impact investors pack this session. Sit near the middle rows—easier to turn to neighbors than front/back seats.

title: Empowering the Human Edge: Building a Future-Ready Workforce in the Age of AI
description: Bringing together governments, enterprises, and academic leaders, this session will spotlight how large-scale AI skilling and reskilling initiatives are being designed and delivered; the gaps emerging in AI talent supply; and what it takes to build a workforce that can adapt and thrive in an AI-driven economy. The discussion will surface practical lessons and scalable approaches for building inclusive, future-ready AI talent ecosystems.
speakers: Aparna Ganesh, Tata Sons; Idris A. Rai, Inter University Council for East Africa; Jay Krishnan, Beyond Next Ventures; Phani Nagarjuna, Telangana AI Innovation Hub; Roma Datta Chobey, Google India; Sidharth Madaan, BCG; Tomoyuki Yamada, JICA; Vani Kola, Kalaari Capital
summary_one_liner: JICA and top VCs tackle the AI talent supply crisis
icebreaker: Vani, what reskilling gaps are VCs seeing across portfolio companies right now?
networking_tip: CHROs and talent leaders attend—find them in the hallway after. Sidharth's presence signals startup founder interest; connect there.

title: AI for Bharat
description: This session explores how artificial intelligence is being applied to address context-specific challenges. It will highlight emerging applications and technology developments from research institutions and innovation ecosystems. The discussion will focus on the intersection of AI systems and local needs, examining how AI is influencing daily life and economic activity across different sectors.
speakers: Mr. Aakrit Vaish, Activate; Mr. Akshay Chaturvedi, Leverage Edu; Mr. Amit Kumar, Google; Mr. Avinash Raghava, SaaSBoomi & AIBoomi; Mr. Jasminder Singh Gulati, Native AI; Mr. Karthik Reddy, Blume Ventures; Mr. Ramesh Rasker, MIT; Mr. Ritesh Malik, Innov8; Mr. Sanjay Jain, Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation; Mr. Tej Kapoor, ICICI Venture; Mr. Vijay Shekar Sharma, Paytm; Mr. Will Poole, Capria Ventures; Ms. Anuja Dhawan, Exotel; Ms. Deepali Dahiya, Native AI; Ms. Juhi Bhatnagar, India AI Research Organization; Ms. Natasha Malpani, Boundless Ventures; Ms. Natasha Malpani, Boundless Ventures
summary_one_liner: Grassroots AI applications solving India's most local challenges
icebreaker: Ask Amit Kumar how Google is tackling India-specific AI challenges beyond global applications.
networking_tip: Find founders in the room—they're actively building solutions and seeking technical talent.

title: AI Literacy: Building Skills, Inclusion, and Global Leadership
description: This session addresses the critical AI literacy gap limiting equitable access to AI knowledge across sectors and geographies. It will explore strategies to embed AI education across formal learning, workforce upskilling, and lifelong learning through training multipliers like teachers, government officials, and workforce development leaders. It will introduce the concept of the Universal AI Literacy Stack, and examine how multi-stakeholder collaboration among governments, industry, academia, and global partners can position countries as AI literacy leaders.
speakers: Lakshmi Misra, The Garage Noida; Prabhat Kumar, AIforAll Global; Sourabh Choudhary, AIforAll Global
summary_one_liner: Universal AI literacy stack to close the global knowledge gap
icebreaker: Lakshmi, which sectors are struggling most to upskill their people for AI?
networking_tip: Education policy makers dominate here. Join the teacher training breakout—smaller group, easier one-on-one conversations.

title: Standards and Policies for AI in Farmer-Centric Smart Agrifood Systems
description: This session will examine the standards and policy foundations needed to responsibly scale AI-enabled, farmer-centric agrifood systems. It will focus on sustainability, food and nutrition security, and inclusive income growth by addressing interoperability, trust, and deployment at scale. The discussion will explore priority standards gaps, enabling policy levers, and coordination across governments, research, and innovation actors to move from pilots to secure, widely adopted AI systems across the agrifood value chain.
speakers: Frederic Werner, International Telecommunication Union (ITU) and United Nations; Gopal Patra, CSIR- Fourth Paradigm Institute, Bengaluru; Rabi N. Sahoo, Division of Agricultural Physics, ICAR- Indian Agricultural Research Institute; Raghu Chaliganti, Interactive & Cognitive Systems group at Fraunhofer HHI; Santanu Chaudhury, IIT Delhi; Volker Klima, German Embassy in New Delh
summary_one_liner: Fraunhofer and India set AI standards for smart farming at scale
icebreaker: Santanu Chaudhury's working on farmer-centric systems—what's your biggest interoperability challenge scaling AI in agrifood?
networking_tip: Standards bodies and agritech founders will be comparing notes. Arrive early to grab a seat where you can overhear policy + technical conversations.

title: Redesigning the AI Economy
description: The main stage session will examine how participatory and ethical data pipelines can support a more inclusive AI ecosystem at national scale. Bringing together policymakers, technologists, researchers, and community representatives, the discussion will explore community-led data creation, evaluation, and model development. The session will highlight how fair compensation, local knowledge, and transparent governance can strengthen AI systems and inform responsible AI policy and practice in India and across the Global Majority.
speakers: Amitabh Nag, Digital India Bhashini Division; Divya Siddarth, Collective Intelligence Project; ⁠Dr. Sunayana Sitaram, Microsoft Research India; Manu Chopra, Karya
summary_one_liner: Community-owned data pipelines could reshape who profits from AI
icebreaker: Divya, how do you actually build fair compensation into data pipelines at scale?
networking_tip: Main stage format means speakers are harder to reach. Network aggressively with impact investors and impact founders during breaks—they're your peer group.

title: Practical Aspects of Using AI in Daily Life
description: This hands-on workshop aims to give an introduction to AI with live demonstrations starting from basics such as how it can be used in data analysis, making presentations and drafting documents. It also covers precautions one should take while using AI and dealing with proprietary, confidential or sensitive data. The session then moves to an entrepreneur perspective on challenges the ecosystem currently faces. The session will end with an open floor for questions.
speakers: Dr.Preet Deep Singh, Apna; Prof. Shiva Kakkar, Jaipuria.Group; Prof.Vaibhav Chaudhary, UNICAMP Brazil; Shri.Nirmit Parikh, BlueMachines AI
summary_one_liner: Hands-on workshop to use AI for everyday productivity tasks
icebreaker: Dr. Singh, what's the most surprising productivity tool you've seen non-technical managers master in AI?
networking_tip: Hands-on workshop = smaller, engaged group. Skip drinks; network during the live demo itself—people bond over tools faster than slides.

title:
Unlocking AI's Potential for Agricultural Innovation and DPI-Enabled Economic 
Growth
description: This session explores how artificial intelligence, supported by digital public infrastructure, can strengthen agricultural systems and drive inclusive economic growth. It focuses on practical pathways to deliver trusted, data-driven advisory services, improve farmer decision-making, and enable scalable innovation through interoperable systems, partnerships, and governance frameworks that support real-world impact.
speakers: Fatema AlMulla, International Affairs Office of the Court; Jagadish Babu, EkStep Foundation; Nidhi Bhasin, Digital Green Trust; Niriksha Shetty, PxD; Sanjay Jain, Gates Foundation
summary_one_liner: AI-powered DPI driving farmer advisory and agricultural inclusive growth
icebreaker: Ask Jagadish how EkStep's DPI approach differs from vendor-led ag-tech.
networking_tip: Gates Foundation speaker present—focus on scalable, open-source solutions.

title: AI Literacy: Building Skills, Inclusion, and Global Leadership
description: This session addresses the critical AI literacy gap limiting equitable access to AI knowledge across sectors and geographies. It will explore strategies to embed AI education across formal learning, workforce upskilling, and lifelong learning through training multipliers like teachers, government officials, and workforce development leaders. It will introduce the concept of the Universal AI Literacy Stack, and examine how multi-stakeholder collaboration among governments, industry, academia, and global partners can position countries as AI literacy leaders.
speakers: Lakshmi Misra, The Garage Noida; Prabhat Kumar, AIforAll Global; Sourabh Choudhary, AIforAll Global
summary_one_liner: Bridging AI literacy gaps through education and workforce development
icebreaker: Ask Prabhat how AIforAll measures AI literacy impact across geographies.
networking_tip: Educators dominate this session—share curriculum gaps you've observed.

title: Harnessing AI for Water Resilience and Sustainable Growth
description: As artificial intelligence becomes the backbone of global economic growth, its physical footprint is expanding rapidly particularly through energy-intensive, water-dependent data centres and digital infrastructure. At the same time, AI is emerging as one of the most powerful tools available to solve the world's most urgent water challenges: scarcity, leakage, contamination, flooding, and inequitable access.
speakers: David Wood, ICfS; Shruti Kapil, ICFS; Sujith Nair, Foundation for Interoperability in Digital Economy
summary_one_liner: AI-driven water resilience addressing infrastructure and climate challenges
icebreaker: Ask David how ICfS measures water saved through AI-optimized infrastructure.
networking_tip: Climate tech investors present—quantify water ROI, not just carbon metrics.

title: Sovereign AI for National Security : India's Path to digital Sovereignty
description: The session explores how Sovereign AI is becoming central to  national security, covering its role in defense modernization, cyber resilience, space and hypersonic domains, internal security, and policing. It highlights how indigenous AI enhances threat detection, border management, and critical infrastructure protection, while also examining government–industry collaboration to build secure, resilient AI capabilities.
speakers: Idashisha Nongrang,IPS; Mr. Martin Willcox; Mr. Pier Stefano; Shri Brijesh Singh  IPS; Shri, Abhishek Verma; Shri, Ajay Singhal
summary_one_liner: India builds indigenous AI for defense, cyber, and space security
icebreaker: Mr. Willcox, how are defense organizations actually implementing sovereign AI in cyber resilience today?
networking_tip: Defense and security officials are here—rare access. Build credibility on technical specifics before pitching. Seek out the IPS officers specifically.

title: Effective AI Assessments, Verification and Assurance: Establishing the Foundations for Responsible Confidence in AI
description: A structured discussion on the challenges and requirements for building an ecosystem for AI system assessments, governance, and risk management. Building on global efforts such as the UN's AI auditing review, recognized AI standards, and emerging AI assurance skills and testing frameworks, the session will outline a roadmap toward reliable reporting on AI system quality, governance, and monitoring. Expert presentations will cover practices, pilot studies, reporting demands, barriers, and pathways to overcome them globally.
speakers: Anne McCormick; Dr. Ansgar Koene; Dr. Jibu Elias; Dr. Philip Howard; LEE Wan Sie; Narayanan Vaidyanathan; Prof. Dr. Balaraman Ravindran
summary_one_liner: EY and global experts build the AI auditing playbook
icebreaker: Anne McCormick's work on AI auditing ecosystems—what's the biggest gap you see between assessment frameworks and real-world implementation?
networking_tip: High decision-maker density means quality over quantity. Target compliance officers during breaks; they're navigating these standards right now.

title: From Guardrails to Adaptive Governance in the Global South: Building a Joint Responsible Governance–HTA Framework to Deliver Safe, Trusted, and Scalable AI in Health
description:
There is growing recognition that Global South contexts require governance models that go beyond static regulation. These models must retain regulatory rigor while enabling dynamic assessment, contextual evidence generation, and socio-technical considerations that reflect local priorities, capacities, and values.
Core Proposition: A Two-Track Adaptive Governance Model
This panel proposes a pragmatic, two-track governance approach for AI in health
speakers: Dr. Mona Duggal; Dr. Monika Kochar; Dr. Ricardo Corpuz; Dr. Sarang Deo; Dr. Shalini Garg; Mr. Haitham Ali Ahmed El-Noush; Rado Andriantsimiavona
knowledge_partners: HEALTH AI - THE GLOBAL AGENCY FOR RESPONSIBLE AI IN HEALTH
summary_one_liner: Adaptive AI health governance designed for Global South realities
icebreaker: Dr. Mona Duggal's adaptive governance framework—how are you thinking about context-specific regulation vs. one-size-fits-all health AI rules?
networking_tip: Global South health policy makers cluster together. Position yourself near discussion breaks to join conversations with public health officials and healthtech founders.

title: Startup Spotlight 2: AI-Validated 3D Bio-printed Disease Models for Oral Submucous Fibrosis
description: A rapid pitch by an exceptional AI startup, selected for its innovation and impact
speakers: Dr. Kanika Singroha
summary_one_liner: Biotech AI validating 3D disease models for oral fibrosis treatment
icebreaker: Ask Dr. Kanika how her bioprinting validation accelerates clinical trials.
networking_tip: Healthcare investors and pharma here—emphasize regulatory pathway clarity.

title: From Lab to Lives: Turning Innovation into Impact
description: This session will feature a discussion on translating cutting-edge research into scalable, real-world impact across health, agriculture, and fintech. It will also include a rapid pitch spotlighting an AI-powered product development platform driving innovation from lab to market.
speakers:
Meghna Bal, Director, Esya Centre



; Anurag Agrawal, Dean, Biosciences and Health Research & Head, Koita Centre for Digital Health, Ashoka University; Hemendra Mathur, Venture Partner, Bharat Innovation Fund; Ravindra Misra, Chief Product Officer, OPL Innovate
summary_one_liner: Scaling research breakthroughs into health, agri, fintech impact
icebreaker: Ask Anurag Agrawal how Ashoka's digital health research translates to market-ready products
networking_tip: Connect with Hemendra Mathur post-pitch to understand Bharat Innova's investment thesis on deep tech

title:
AI for
Education: Future-Ready Universities and Schools
description: This session examines how AI can be deployed at scale across schools and higher education institutions in India. It explores government-led adoption, impacts on learning and pedagogy, and pathways to ensure inclusive AI literacy for students and educators in a rapidly evolving education ecosystem.
speakers: Chetan Aggarwal, CPRG; Dr. Ramanand, CPRG; Johan Harvard, Tony Blair Institute for Global Change; Noopur Jhunjhunwala, ChangeINKK; R Balasubramaniam, GoI; Sanjay Kumar, Ministry of Education, GoI; Shri Jitin Prasada, Ministry of Commerce and Industry (MoCI) and Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology (MeitY), GoI
knowledge_partners: Center of Policy Research and Governance
summary_one_liner: Government-led AI adoption transforms India's schools and universities at scale
icebreaker: Shri Jitin Prasada's government adoption angle—are you piloting AI in schools or universities right now?
networking_tip: Education officials + EdTech founders will network hard here. Position yourself between keynote and break.

title: Enterprise Adoption of Responsible AI: Challenges, Frameworks and Solutions
description: How can Responsible AI be implemented across the data and AI lifecycle? This seems to be a distant dream across the world, with very limited unified approach to legal, technical, governance and operational requirements. This session builds on top of the unified Techno-legal framework published by the Indian Office of PSA, brings together researchers, policy makers, framework developers, technology platforms and enterprises, to understand the challenges, opportunities and demonstrates a reference implementation of Responsible AI across Data & AI lifecycle.
speakers: Abilash Soundararajan, PrivaSapien; Ashish Tewari, Infosys; Dr.  Subodh Sharma, IIT Delhi; Dr. Geetha Raju, CeRAI - IIT Madras; Raj Shekhar, iSPIRT; Shri Avinash Agarwal, Department of Telecommunications, GoI; Sureshram Venghatachari, PrivaSapien; Vibhav Mithal, Anand & Anand
summary_one_liner: Live demo of responsible AI implementation across enterprise data lifecycle
icebreaker: Abilash Soundararajan, which enterprise governance mistake do you see repeated most?
networking_tip: CDOs and compliance officers attend—skip generalist talks, find the technical implementation deep-dives.

title: Democratising Access to AI through Data Infrastructure | Models, Governance and Market Design
description: This workshop examines how equitable access to high-quality data can enable inclusive and responsible AI development, particularly in emerging economies. It brings together experts to explore data infrastructure, governance frameworks, and market incentives that support scalable data ecosystems. Through focused discussions on technical models, market design, and regulation, the session aims to generate practical recommendations for reducing data access barriers, improving interoperability, and ensuring that AI development benefits diverse communities, sectors, and local contexts.
speakers: Dr. Gokul Krishnan, CeRAI - IIT Madras; Dr. Nishant Chadha, Policy and Research, ISB; Dr. R. Srinivasan, Center for Digital Public Goods (CDPG) – IIM B; Mr. Abhishek Kumar, Product and Engineering, Wadhwani AI; Mr. Arun Prabhu, Cyril Amarchand Mangaldas; Mr. Ashish Aggarwal, Nasscom; Mr. Gaurav Godhwani, CivicDataLab; Ms. Aparajita Mridha, Department of Post; Ms. Astha Kapoor, Aapti Institute; Ms. Sreenidhi Srinivasan, Ikigai Law
summary_one_liner: Building equitable data infrastructure so AI doesn't just serve elites
icebreaker: Dr. Gokul Krishnan, what data infrastructure gap hurts emerging economies most right now?
networking_tip: Workshop format allows deep dives—grab Dr. R. Srinivasan during breaks when crowds thin out.

title: A Billion Voices, One AI: How Language Tech Transforms Nations
description: This session will be a moderated panel with Q&A, featuring experts in national language missions, Voice AI, and equitable tech investment across India and developing economies as Africa. The discussion focuses on building language AI infrastructure at population scale, sharing experiences, and setting a forward with themes like open infrastructure and South-South cooperation.
speakers: Amitabh Nag, Digital India Bhashini Division; Chennai Chair, Masakhane African Languages Hub; Santosh Kevlani, Voice & Language AI Initiative, EkStep Foundation; Srikanth Gopalakrishnan, Center for Open Societal  Systems; Vijay Sureshkumar, DPI Emerging Innovations at Gates Foundation
summary_one_liner: Building language AI infrastructure for a billion diverse voices
icebreaker: Srikanth Gopalakrishnan on language tech for billions—what language are you betting on first for your AI product?
networking_tip: NLP researchers and open-source contributors cluster together. Post-session, they'll dissect technical choices—join that conversation to build credibility.

title: Agentic Commerce: Trust, Tokens and 'Know Your Agent' for the AI Economy
description: This session explores how agentic AI is reshaping digital commerce through autonomous decision-making, trusted identities, and tokenized value exchange. Industry leaders in applied AI will discuss emerging architectures for secure, explainable agents, the evolution of trust and accountability, and the role of tokens in coordinating economic activity. Moderated by an academic expert, the conversation bridges research and practice, examining risks, governance, and opportunities that will define the AI-driven commerce economy over the coming decade globally
speakers: Dr Pankaj Jalote, IIIT Delhi; Dr Prakhar Mehrotra, Paypal⁠; Janet George, Mastercard; Mr Arvind Jayaprakash, Glance; Prag Sharma, Citi
summary_one_liner: Mastercard explores autonomous AI agents reshaping digital commerce
icebreaker: Dr. Pankaj Jalote on agentic commerce—how are you thinking about 'Know Your Agent' for autonomous transactions in your stack?
networking_tip: Fintech, Web3, and AI product roles converge here. Target enterprise architects during Q&A; they influence hiring and partnerships.

title: Hardware-Rooted Sovereignty: Verifiable Safe and Trusted AI Infrastructure for the Global South
description:
The session will bring together attendees from the Indian government, data security professionals, Global South policy experts, and
technical researchers in hardware and AI security. The panellists will draw on their research-talent network and event convening
experience, and present live demos and examples of their hardware-enabled verification product.
speakers: Connor Dunlop, LucidComputing; Eileen Donahoe, Stanford Global Digital Policy Incubator; Jayat Joshi, Secure AI Futures Lab; Robert Trager, International Governance Lead at the Centre for the Governance of AI, and Senior Research Fellow at the Blavatnik School of Government at the University of Oxford; S. Krishnan, Ministry of Electronics & IT, GoI; Stuart Jonathan Russell, University of California, Berkeley; Varun Agrawal, Secure AI Futures Lab
summary_one_liner: Stuart Russell and Jaan Talinn push hardware-verified AI safety
icebreaker: Stuart Russell on verifiable AI safety—how are you thinking about hardware-rooted trust in your sovereign infrastructure?
networking_tip: Heavy hitter event with defense + gov officials. Arrive 15min early; these decision-makers network strategically before sessions start.

title: South-South Cooperation in AI Policymaking: Developing a Collaboration Roadmap
description: This session will include presentations by AI policymakers from multiple countries and a discussion to identify shared interests that can inform the development of collaboration roadmaps. Participants will explore cooperation opportunities related to infrastructure pooling, data sharing, cross-border regulatory sandboxes, regulatory harmonisation and mutual recognition, skills programmes, joint AI incident monitoring, and collaborative audit mechanisms.
speakers: Cyprien Nshimiyimana, Centre for the Fourth Industrial Revolution; Irene Karungi Sekitoleko, Ministry of ICT and National Guidance​; Kautsarina Adam, Ministry of Communication and Information Technology of the Republic of Indonesia; Maxwell Ababio, Data Protection Commission; Odilile Ayodele, Human Sciences Research Council; Rachel Adams, Global Center on AI Governance; Rama Devi Lanka, NITI Aayog, GoI; Richard Mwaura Kiarie, National Treasury; Siphokazi Novukuza, Department of Communications and Digital Technologies; Wolfger Bungarten, Federal Ministry for Economic Cooperation and Development (BMZ)
summary_one_liner: Global South nations forge joint AI policy and cooperation roadmaps
icebreaker: Which country's AI policy approach surprised you most—and why should others learn from it?
networking_tip: 10+ diplomats here—form small peer groups by region during breaks for deeper collaboration talks.

title: From Buzzword to Blueprint: Engineering Sustainable AI at Scale
description: This session brings together distinguished thought leaders from industry, academia, and the startup ecosystem to explore how AI sustainability can transform from an abstract ESG aspiration into a measurable engineering discipline. The session will draw out practical insights, frameworks, and actionable guidance that practitioners worldwide can immediately apply. The questions asked will elicit specific expertise from panellists while building a cohesive narrative.
speakers: Archana Joshi, Xoriant; Dr. Gayathri Aaditya Eranki, Sir M V School of Architecture, Design & Planning; Dr. Niladri Choudhuri, Green Computing Foundation; Jaskaran Singh, Birchlogic; Naresh Choudhary, Infosys; Srinivas Varadarajan, Vigyanlabs; Vineet Mittal, Ziroh Labs
summary_one_liner: Turning AI sustainability from ESG talk into engineering discipline
icebreaker: Srinivas Varadarajan's engineering sustainable AI—what's your biggest carbon trade-off between model performance and efficiency?
networking_tip: CTOs and infrastructure engineers here want technical depth. Lead with a specific sustainability metric you're tracking; attracts the right buyers.

title: Public Health Powered by AI: RailTel's Collaborative Model for AI Enabled Inclusive Healthcare for Bharat and Beyond
description: This session will dissect the transition of artificial intelligence from experimental "sandboxes" to the bedrock of national public health infrastructure. The discussion will explore how the synergy between RailTel's expansive digital footprint and Qure.ai's clinical intelligence is creating a sovereign health surveillance grid.
speakers: Dr. Anshul Vikram Pandey, Pan Science Innovations (PSI); Dr. Anubha Gupta, IIIT Delhi; Dr. Sunil Kumar  Barnwal, National Health Authority, GoI; Jean Philbert Nsengimana, Africa Centres for Disease Control and Prevention (Africa CDC); Mr Vijay Navaluri, Supervity; Prof. K. Srinath Reddy, Public Health Foundation of India; Shri Atman Jadon, Superceuticals; Shri K. Manohar Raja, RailTel Corporation of India Limited; Shri Prashant Warier, Qure.ai; Shri R. S. Mani, CSIR; Shri Rajiv Sikka, Medanta; Shri Rama Manohara Rao, RailTel Corporation of India Limited
summary_one_liner: RailTel and Qure.ai build India's AI-powered health surveillance grid
icebreaker: Prof. K. Srinath Reddy's vision for AI in public health—how are you bridging the gap from sandbox to national infrastructure?
networking_tip: High density of government and development finance leaders. Sit near hospital administrators; they control budgets and make vendor decisions.

title: Competing to Innovate: How Competition Accelerates AI Innovation
description: AI risks being shaped by a concentrated few, leaving the Global South as consumers rather than co-creators. When data, compute, foundational models, and distribution are controlled by a handful of corporations, innovation suffers. A competitive, open source AI stack, built on affordable compute, local cloud options, and locally trained models, is essential to fostering innovation. This panel explores AI resource distribution, barriers facing Global South innovators, and remedies through openness, competition, and South–South cooperation.
speakers: Amba Kak, AI Now Institute; Augustine Peter, Competition Commission of India; Kush Amlani, Global Competition & Regulation, Mozilla; Payal Malik, Competitiion Commission of India; Shweta Rajpal Kohli, Startup Policy Forum (India)
summary_one_liner: Mozilla-led debate on breaking AI monopolies for global innovation
icebreaker: Ask Amba Kak why competition policy matters more for AI than traditional tech sectors.
networking_tip: Network with regulators—they shape the rules that determine winners in AI markets.

title: Responsible AI for Bharat: Building Trust, Safety, and Global Leadership
description: This session examines how India can build a responsible AI ecosystem rooted in trust, safety, and public value. It focuses on policy frameworks, governance mechanisms, and accountability practices that balance innovation with societal impact. Emphasizing inclusivity, transparency, and national priorities, the discussion explores how responsible AI for Bharat can strengthen public institutions, safeguard citizens, and position India as a global leader in ethical and people-centric AI development.
speakers: Dr. Subi Chaturvedi, InMobi; Dr. Tripta Thakur, UTU; Mr. Ankush Sabharwal, CoRover.ai; Mr. Arvind Kumar, Software Technology Park Of India-STPI; Mr. Ravi Arora, Multilateral Institutions and International Affairs at Mastercard; Mr. Vivek Raj, Panama Corporation; Professor Nitin Saxena, IIT Kanpur
summary_one_liner: India's roadmap for responsible AI that centers public trust
icebreaker: Dr. Subi Chaturvedi, what does 'trust' actually mean in India's AI governance context?
networking_tip: Policy makers cluster early—arrive 15min before to grab seats near Dr. Tripta Thakur's section.

title: AI for Disaster Management: Anticipatory, Hyperlocal, Scalable
description: This session spotlights how "right-sized" and responsible AI-enabled workflows can strengthen disaster risk reduction (DRR) by enabling fast, inclusive capture of potential risks, losses and needs, trusted verification, and improved decision-making for responders.
speakers: Mr. Puneet Chandok, Microsoft; Mr. Sujit Mohanty, UNDRR; Ms. Lakshmi Pattabiraman, C4EC; Ms. Manju Dhasmana, Microsoft; Shri Abhishek Singh, Meity, GoI; Shri Krishna Vatsa, NDMA; Snehal Verma, Nature Dots
knowledge_partners: United Nations Office for Disaster Risk Reduction (UNDRR)
summary_one_liner: UN and India deploy anticipatory AI for disaster risk reduction
icebreaker: Puneet Chandok, how does hyperlocal AI actually work in a disaster scenario?
networking_tip: High decision-maker density means quality over quantity—prepare 2-3 specific questions for officials.

title: Making AI All Inclusive: Bridging AI Communities to India's AI Future
description: This session would explore the potential of JAN AI to democratise India's artificial intelligence landscape and bridge digital divides. Discover frameworks for ensuring equitable AI access, culturally responsive design, and inclusive development practices. Learn how stakeholders can collaborate to build AI systems that serve all Indians, not just privileged segments, creating pathways for all communities to participate in and benefit from India's technological transformation
speakers: Mr. Jayant Rastogi, MagicBus; Mr. Madan Padaki, JAN AI; Ms. Nidhi Bhasin, Digital Green; Ms. Noopur Jhunjhunwala, ChangeINKK; Prof. Ramesh Raskar, MIT Media Labs; Sri Rajan, Bain & Co
summary_one_liner: MIT's Ramesh Raskar and leaders push AI access for all Indians
icebreaker: Prof. Ramesh Raskar, which communities are you targeting first with JAN AI?
networking_tip: Impact investors here—sit near social enterprise founders to signal shared values early.

title: Unlocking Health Equity through Responsible AI
description: This session will examine how responsible AI can advance health equity by improving access to trusted medical knowledge, clinical decision support, and workforce capacity. Bringing together policymakers, healthcare leaders, clinicians, and industry experts, the discussion will focus on trust, transparency, and governance in health AI. The panel will explore how evidence-based, explainable AI systems can be deployed safely and at scale to strengthen health systems and improve outcomes, particularly in emerging and resource-constrained settings.
speakers: Dr. Ayesha Chaudhary, WomenLift Health; Dr. B. Srinivas, MoHFW & National Medical Library; Dr. Jan Herzhoff, Elsevier; Dr. Sangeeta Reddy, Apollo Hospitals; Mr. Kazim Rizvi, CoRE-AI
summary_one_liner: Elsevier and Apollo Hospitals tackle AI-driven health equity gaps
icebreaker: Dr. Sangeeta Reddy, how do you measure 'trust' in clinical AI systems?
networking_tip: Hospital admins are practical buyers—ask about pilots, not theory; they skip theory-only discussions.

title: Startup Spotlight 3: AI-powered Product Development Platform
description: A rapid pitch by an exceptional AI startup, selected for its innovation and impact
speakers: Dr. Beena Rai
summary_one_liner: AI product dev platform fast-tracking lab-to-market innovation
icebreaker: Ask Dr. Beena Rai how her platform reduces time-to-market for AI-driven solutions
networking_tip: Grab coffee post-pitch with other founders attending to compare product-market fit learnings

title: Cracking Global Markets: Lessons from GCC-Bred Innovators
description: This session will feature a discussion on advancing inclusive health and social impact through strategic partnerships and innovation. It will also include a rapid pitch by Fifth Sense, showcasing AI-powered sign language translation gloves designed to enhance accessibility and communication.
speakers:
Anushree Banerjee, Senior Manager, Strategy & Partnerships, Grand Challenges Canada 
; Kruti Dalal, Director of Resource Mobilisation, Armann
summary_one_liner: Strategic partnerships and AI innovation for inclusive global health
icebreaker: Ask Anushree Banerjee how Grand Challenges Canada identifies breakthrough health innovations
networking_tip: Connect with NGO & impact sector leaders to explore collaborative funding pathways

title: Startup Spotlight 4: Fifth Sense - Sign Language Translation Gloves
description: A rapid pitch by an exceptional AI startup, selected for its innovation and impact
speakers: Aishwarya Karnataki
summary_one_liner: AI sign language translation gloves enabling accessibility breakthrough
icebreaker: Ask Aishwarya Karnataki about Fifth Sense's hardware-software integration challenges
networking_tip: Seek out accessibility-focused impact investors and disability rights NGOs in the audience

title: Capital, Control, and Clarity: How to Turn Investor Questions into Yeses
description: This session will feature practical insights on navigating investor expectations, structuring capital, and building clarity in fundraising conversations. It will also include a rapid pitch by NariRaksha.AI, showcasing AI-driven solutions for harassment prevention and strengthening digital trust.
speakers:
Yashodhara Bajoria, Founder, CAxpert

; Jayraj Bharat Patel, AVP, Kalaari Capital
summary_one_liner: Master fundraising fundamentals with investor-ready founders and capital partners
icebreaker: Ask Jayraj Patel what makes AI startups stand out in Kalaari's investment pipeline
networking_tip: Share your pitch deck with Yashodhara Bajoria for CAxpert's mentor feedback session

title: AI for Inclusive Economic Progress: The Public Services AI stack
description: This session will present an AI stack for public services to enable inclusive growth, from India to the world. The session includes short keynotes by panellists, followed by a moderated discussion on implementation challenges, interoperability, and collaboration across governments, technologists, and civil society.
speakers: Alpesh Shah, IEEE Standards; Amir Banifatemi, Cognizant; B. Ravindran, Department of DSAI, IIT Madras; Gabriela Ramos, Task Force Inequalities & Social Financial disclosure; Joanna Shields, Precognition; Mark Surman, Mozilla; Wan Sie Lee, AI Verify Foundation
summary_one_liner: India's public services AI stack blueprint for inclusive global growth
icebreaker: Ask B. Ravindran what makes a public services AI stack actually inclusive versus theoretically.
networking_tip: Connect policy makers with technologists—they solve different parts of the same problem.

title: AI Innovators Exchange: Accelerating Innovation Through Startup and Industry Synergy
description: This session explores how India is leveraging AI to deliver inclusive, scalable solutions to national and global challenges. It focuses on synergies among industry, academia, and government to support startups and strengthen innovation ecosystems. Bringing together policymakers, industry leaders, startups, academia, and international institutions, the discussion highlights public-private collaboration, examines how global institutions empower innovation through industry and academic support, and concludes with policy recommendations to enable wider startup-led innovation and advance AI for good.
speakers: Dr. Nikhil Agarwal, Foundation for Innovation and Technology Transfer (FITT), IIT Delhi; Dr. Zille Anam, UK Research and Innovation, British High Commission; Mr. Jae Kyeong Lee, Korea SMEs & Startups Agency (KOSME); Mr. Rohan Chhatwal, Maruti Suzuki ; Mr. Sandeep Aggarwal, ShopClues.com; Mr. Sandeep Nailwal, Polygon Foundation; Mrs. Priya Kapur, Sona Comstar; Ms. Anna Schwarz, Deputy Head for Industries and Tech; Ms. Manju Dhasmana, Microsoft; Ms. Neelashi Shukla, Stride (Circulus Capital); Prof. Manan Suri, IIT Delhi
knowledge_partners: Foundation for Innovation and Technology Transfer
summary_one_liner: Startup-industry synergy accelerating India's AI innovation ecosystem at scale
icebreaker: Sandeep Nailwal's working on startup synergies—are you building on the startup or investor side of this equation?
networking_tip: VCs and founders attend; don't miss the networking session. Exchange LinkedIn with 5+ Series A founders to build pipeline.

title: India AI Impact Buildathon
description: The India AI Impact Buildathon, under the India AI Impact Summit 2026, is a national-level initiative aimed at democratizing AI education and fostering AI solutions for social good, with a strong focus on reducing digital frauds and cyber scams. Through free AI learning resources and hands-on innovation, over 35,000 participants build responsible, impact-driven solutions, culminating in a national finale showcasing top AI innovators.
speakers: Abhinav Ghosh, HCL Tech; Debasish Mishra, SBI; Dr Chandrasekhar Buddha, Ministry of Education, GoI; Mr. Ankit Kakkar, Mongo DB; Mr. Sandeep Saini, HCL Tech; Neeraj Walia, ; SP Balamurugan, HCL GUVI
summary_one_liner: 35,000+ builders tackling digital fraud with responsible AI solutions
icebreaker: What's your cyber fraud AI solution—are you building an entry point for early-career engineers?
networking_tip: Student-heavy event; recruit talent by mentoring during buildathon breakouts. Identify 2-3 standout developers for follow-up.

title: India's AI Infrastructure: From Vision to Reality
description: India's electronics hardware sector is increasingly focusing on AI-powered design and manufacturing innovations, strategic alignment of AI hardware with PLI 2.0 incentives, seamless integration of AI into MSME business ecosystems, and comprehensive talent development/upskilling programs. This session will bring together industry leaders, government policymakers, and academia to address issues of AI scalability, ethics, and inclusivity—unleashing demographic advantages and policy momentum for resilient, globally competitive AI infrastructure and sustainable growth.
speakers: Col Suhail Zaidi (Retd), MAIT; Mr. Amrit Jiwan, Canon India; Mr. Kishore Balaji, IBM; Mr. Ranganath Sadasiva, HPE; Mr. Sumit Monga, Lenovo Group; Mr. Tarandeep Bagga, CISCO; Ms. Dipakshi Mehandru, Intel Corporation; Ms. Vibha Mehra, Nokia; Shri Harish Krishnan, Cisco India & ASEAN
summary_one_liner: Aligning AI hardware strategy with India's PLI 2.0 and MSME growth
icebreaker: Kishore Balaji and the PLI 2.0 strategy—how is your MSME leveraging these hardware incentives?
networking_tip: High decision-maker density; arrive early to secure seats near policy makers. Discuss specific PLI allocation challenges.

title: Women in AI: A South Asia Outlook on Representation, Equity and Empowerment
description: This session will advance a regional dialogue on women in artificial intelligence across South Asia, focusing on representation, equity, and empowerment. The session will examine implications for women's education, skills development, and work, including risks of bias and exclusion. The discussion will outline actionable pathways for gender-inclusive, people-centered AI
speakers: Aditi Jha, LinkedIn; Aditi Namdeo, Independent Data & AI Policy Exper; Anita Gurumurthy, IT for Change; Aparajita Bharti, The Quantum Hub; Emad Karim, UN Women; Eunsong Kim, UNESCO; Kanta Singh, Country Representative a.i; Leki Choden, Dragon Coders; Tim Curtis, UNESCO; Vivek Menon, Amrita Vishwa Vidyapeetham University, India
summary_one_liner: South Asia's roadmap for gender-inclusive AI equity and empowerment
icebreaker: Anita Gurumurthy's work on equity in AI—what's the biggest barrier to women's representation in your sector?
networking_tip: High-density decision makers present; connect 1-on-1 with speakers post-session during coffee break for deeper policy conversations.

title: Whose Language, Whose Model? Public-Interest Multilingual LLMs
description: LLM development is critical to the public interest in the Global South, yet decisions about their development and use remain concentrated in the Global North. This workshop brings together global civil society, NLP researchers, and technologists to inform responsible LLM development globally. The AI Summit hosted in India this year offers a timely opportunity to convene groups that often work in isolation and to advance questions of language access and global AI governance, including systems.
speakers: Aliya Bhatia, Center for Democracy & Technology; Dhanaraj Thakur, Multiracial Democracy Project; Jhalak Kakkar, National Law University, New Delhi; Marlena Wisniak, European Centre for Not for Profit Law
summary_one_liner: Civil society demands Global South ownership of multilingual LLMs
icebreaker: Jhalak Kakkar, whose languages are actually missing from current LLMs—and why?
networking_tip: Small workshop = intimate access to speakers; ask for 1-on-1 time on languages relevant to your work.

title: Multilingual Voice-AI Agents for Crisis Response and Underserved Populations
description: When floods strike, clinics overflow, EMIs slip, or civic systems fail, help exists behind apps, portals, and English menus. For millions, that help is unreachable. This session explores Multilingual Voice-AI Agents for crisis response, reaching people by phone, in their language, handling real tasks in real time. This involves no downloads and forms - just voice that works when systems don't, especially for underserved and vulnerable communities.
speakers: Dr Laxmi Gupta, Bennett University || PhD– IIT Delhi.; Sachin Keshav, INDUS AI // AIT - Pune; Shreeyash Kanwade, INDUS AI // IIIT - Dharwad; Vivek Gupta, IndusLabs AI // IIT - Delhi
summary_one_liner: Voice-first AI agents bridging crisis response for underserved communities
icebreaker: Dr Laxmi Gupta's multilingual voice agents—what language gaps are blocking crisis response in your region?
networking_tip: Smaller, technical crowd; approach speakers directly. Exchange research interests with other NLP/crisis tech engineers.

title: Farmer Productivity and Employment: Transforming Agriculture for a Sustainable Future
description: This session brings together policy leaders, technologists, and development partners to explore how AI and Digital Public Infrastructure (DPI) can strengthen agriculture across India and the Global South. It will showcase real-world implementations from Maharashtra, ATI Ethiopia, and other initiatives, highlighting improved farmer access to advisories, inputs, finance, and markets. The discussion will demonstrate how open, collaborative digital approaches can accelerate agricultural transformation, enhance food security, and build climate resilience.
speakers: Dr. Girum Ketema, Digital Agriculture and Finance,Agriculture Transformation Institute, Addis Ababa; Kirti Pandey, COSS; Mr. Jagadish B, EkStep Foundation; Mr. Kunjbihari Daga, Micro Save Consultancy; Mr. Parimal Singh, Nanasaheb Deshmukh Krishi Sanjeevani Project; Mr. Ravi R Singh, Digital Agriculture and Farmers Welfare, Govt of India
summary_one_liner: AI and DPI transforming smallholder farming across the Global South
icebreaker: How is Jagadish B's DPI approach reshaping farmer productivity in regions beyond India's reach?
networking_tip: Mix of AgriTech and development finance leaders; find the development finance attendees during panels—they fund scaling.

title: AI for Industries: Resilience, Innovation and Efficiency
description: AI for Industries: Resilience, Innovation, Efficiency explores how artificial intelligence can accelerate India's industrial transformation through global collaboration and proven best practices. As part of the India AI Action Summit, this session brings together international expertise in applied AI, industrial digitisation, and trusted technologies with Indian startups delivering scalable impact in healthcare and livelihoods. The session will provide insights on innovation pathways, responsible deployment, governance, and real-world outcomes through cross-border knowledge exchange that shape the future of industries.
speakers: Clas Neuman, SAP; Madhav Krishna, Vahan.ai; Priyadarshi Mohapatra, Curebay; Sunil Mathur, Siemens India; Upasna Dash, JBC; Upen Barve, GIIC
summary_one_liner: Cross-border AI best practices driving India's industrial digital transformation
icebreaker: Madhav Krishna focuses on industrial efficiency—what manufacturing pain point is keeping you up at night?
networking_tip: Medium crowd; prioritize CTOs and German-India business execs. Follow up immediately on shared industry challenges.

title: Beyond Digital Empires: AI Implementation for Middle Powers
description: This session explores the challenges and opportunities facing "middle powers" as they navigate complex geopolitical, economic, and technical choices in building AI capabilities. It will examine tradeoffs through case studies and practical examples, covering sovereign and open-source AI, compute infrastructure, DPI, and risks of dependency. The aim is to identify empirically grounded pathways that enable countries to pursue a "third way" toward technological autonomy in a challenging global environment.
speakers: Akash Kapur, GovLab (NYU); Kate Kallot, Amini; Natalie Black, Ofcom; Pablo Chavez, Tech Policy Solutions; Shashi Shekhar Vempati, DeepTech for Bharat Foundation; Sridhar Ganapathy, Principal
summary_one_liner: Middle powers charting a sovereign third way in AI development
icebreaker: Shashi Shekhar Vempati on AI sovereignty—how are you navigating geopolitical choices in your AI strategy?
networking_tip: High-profile policy crowd; sit near foreign policy strategists. This is a listen-and-learn event—ask thoughtful questions.

title: Empowering Policymakers: Futures Literacy for Tech-Informed Foreign and International Digital Policy
description: Emerging technologies are reshaping global power, making digital governance a diplomatic priority. This session introduces futures literacy as a vital tool for proactive policymaking. By integrating complementary perspectives from India and Germany the panel demonstrates how to navigate complexity. Participants will explore how these diverse methodologies can help identify policy space for informed decision making, ensuring a resilient and tech-informed approach to international digital policy and diplomacy.
speakers: Astha Kapoor, Aapti Institute; Dr. Urvashi Aneja, Digital Futures Lab; Hans-Christian Mangelsdorf, German Federal Foreign Office; Lars Radscheidt, Gesellschaft für Internationale Zusammenarbeit (GIZ); Sebastian Blum, Data Innovation Lab
summary_one_liner: Germany and India teach policymakers to anticipate tech's geopolitical impact
icebreaker: Astha Kapoor, how does futures literacy change a diplomat's approach to AI policy?
networking_tip: High official density + Indo-German focus—mention your country's tech policy priorities upfront to match.

title: Innovations from India's AI Center's of Excellence in Health, Education, Agricultre and Sustainable Cities
description: This panel explores emerging innovations from India's AI Centres of Excellence across Health, Education, Agriculture, and Sustainable Cities. Speakers will examine practical, high-impact AI systems—spanning service delivery, decision support, and public infrastructure—that can move from pilots to large-scale deployment. The discussion will focus on measurable outcomes, data and governance foundations, and pathways for responsible adoption in government and partner ecosystems. The session will highlight examples, implementation lessons, and approaches to scaling.
speakers: Dr Krithika Rangarajan, AIIMS, New Delhi; Dr. S. Neethi, IIT Madras; Nitin Saxena, IIT Kanpur; Pushpendra P Singh, IIT Ropar; Rahul Singh, IISc; Srikanth Nadhamuni, AI CoE, Ministry of Education, Govt. of India
knowledge_partners:
AI Center of
Excellence (AI-CoE), Ministry of Education
summary_one_liner: India's AI Centres of Excellence scaling pilots across key sectors
icebreaker: Dr Krithika Rangarajan's centres of excellence—which sector's innovations align most with your organization's roadmap?
networking_tip: High gov/policy density; ask speakers about funding cycles and partnership opportunities before crowd disperses.

title: Financing the Future: Building AI Ready Digital Foundations for Asia and the Pacific
description: Rapid AI advances are reshaping economies, but adoption requires robust digital foundations. This session brings together policymakers, practitioners, and development partners to explore how Asia-Pacific countries can build scalable, secure AI infrastructure aligned with their development priorities. Discussions will cover what "AI-ready" means at different development stages, the government's role in creating enabling policies and systems, sustainable financing models combining public and private capital, and how startups can innovate effectively on these foundations.
speakers: Antonio Zaballos, Asian Development Bank; Azizjon Akramov, Ministry of Economy and Finance of the Republic of Uzbekistan; Azizjon Akramov, Ministry of Economy and Finance of the Republic of Uzbekistan; Carolyn Florey, Asian Development Bank; Carolyn Florey, Asian Development Bank; Firuzjon Sodiqov, AI Council, Ministry of Industry and New Technologies, Tajikistan; Firuzjon Sodiqov, AI Council, Ministry of Industry and New Technologies, Tajikistan; Khushal Wadhawan, IndiaAI, GoI; Mayank Chaudhary, Asian Development Bank; Ritul Gaur, Asian Development Bank; Ritul Gaur, Asian Development Bank; Z Sergelen, Mongolian National IT Park (NITP)
summary_one_liner: Building AI-ready digital infrastructure for Asia-Pacific policymakers
icebreaker: Ask Antonio Zaballos about ADB's prioritization framework for digital infrastructure in emerging economies
networking_tip: Network with other policy leaders to explore regional infrastructure standards collaboration

title: Startup Spotlight 5: NariRaksha.AI – AI for Harassment Prevention and Digital Trust
description: A rapid pitch by an exceptional AI startup, selected for its innovation and impact
speakers: Sonal Khanna
summary_one_liner: AI-driven harassment prevention and digital trust innovation platform
icebreaker: Ask Sonal Khanna how NariRaksha.AI detects harassment patterns across diverse communication channels
networking_tip: Connect with women founders and gender-focused impact investors pre-pitch meeting

title: From Implementers to Innovators: Shifting the Narrative Towards Women Entrepreneurship in AI
description: Women globally are poised to lead the AI revolution and shape economic and social growth through innovation, leadership and ethical AI development. This panel topic explores the challenges and opportunities as women navigate the shift from supporting roles evolving from consumers of AI to becoming the primary architects and entrepreneurs behind innovative AI solutions.
speakers: Mr. Bibin Babu, GrowQr AI; Mr. Sameep Shastri, BRICS Chamber of Commerce & Industry; Ms. Amrita Chowdhury, Gaia; Ms. Ankita Sachdeva, BRICS Chamber of Commerce & Industry; Ms. Natalya Popova, Innopraktika; Ms. Ruby Sinha, BRICS CCI WE and Founder, sheatwork; Ms. Shivani Singh Kapoor, ThinkStartup; Ms. Yashika Pokhriyal, BRICS Chamber of Commerce & Industry; Nigela Guimaraes, Global Strategic Partnerships, Instituto+Mulheres, Brazil
knowledge_partners: BRICS Chamber of Commerce & Industry (Women Empowerment)
summary_one_liner: Women rising from AI consumers to architects and entrepreneurs
icebreaker: Ask Ms. Amrita Chowdhury: what's one myth about women founders in AI that needs debunking in BRICS?
networking_tip: Impact investors + women founders networking event: exchange contacts during coffee break, not after keynote.

title: Trustworthy AI: Balancing Innovation and Regulation
description: This panel will explore how innovation and regulation can evolve together as artificial intelligence advances. It will examine trust, transparency, accountability, and responsible development, highlighting how these principles may encourage sustainable, human-centric AI adoption within an increasingly interconnected ecosystem.
speakers: Caitlin Searle, Australian High Commission; Inderpreet Sawhney, Infosys; Mariagrazia Squicciarini, UNESCO; Mr. Syed Ahmed, Infosys; Suvendu Pati, Reserve Bank of India
summary_one_liner: Navigating the tightrope between AI innovation speed and regulatory trust
icebreaker: What would Mariagrazia Squicciarini say is the biggest gap between AI innovation speed and regulation?
networking_tip: Ethics officers and regulators attend—corner them after panel; they're making compliance decisions now.

title: Leveraging Artificial Intelligence in Public Audit for greater Transparency and Accountability
description: The session on Impact of AI in Audit highlights key initiatives, emerging practices, and strategic priorities for integrating artificial intelligence in public auditing. It presents insights on how AI can enhance audit planning, execution, and reporting through advanced data analytics and intelligent tools. The discussions emphasize multi-stakeholder collaboration and promote dialogue on the responsible, ethical, and context-specific use of AI, underscoring its potential to strengthen transparency, efficiency, and trust in public financial accountability systems.
speakers: Dr. Sanjeev Kumar, Wadhwani Foundation; Mr Subramanian Krishnan Sangaran, Comptroller and Auditor General of India; Ms. Priyanka Sharma, KPMG India; Prof. Agam Gupta, IIT  Delhi; Prof. Madhusudhanan, IIT  Madras; Shri K. Surjith, Comptroller and Auditor General of India; Shri Naveen Singhvi, Comptroller and Auditor General of India; Shri V Ajay Yeshwanth, Comptroller and Auditor General of India; Srinath Chakravarthy, NISG; Srinath Chakravarthy, NISG
knowledge_partners: Comptroller and Auditor General of India (CAG)
summary_one_liner: CAG-led AI integration strengthening public audit transparency and trust
icebreaker: Ask Shri Naveen Singhvi how CAG uses AI to catch financial fraud auditors missed before?
networking_tip: High decision-maker density in public audit: request 1-on-1 pre-event; public sector moves slower but commits.

title: AI and the Future of Work: Employability, Skills, and Labour Market Transformation
description: This panel examines how Artificial Intelligence is reshaping labour markets, from job creation and skill transitions to education and policy responses. Bringing together government, research, industry, and academia, the discussion explores AI-enabled employment platforms, emerging skill demands, workforce strategies, and how education systems can evolve to prepare workers for an AI-driven economy.
speakers: Dr Dhanya M. B., V. V. Giri National Labour Institute; Shri Ajoy Sharma, Ministry of Labour & Employment, GoI; Shri Kartik Narayan, Apna; Shri Ritesh Hada, Karnavati University
summary_one_liner: Reshaping labour markets through AI-enabled skilling and employment platforms
icebreaker: Ask Shri Kartik Narayan: which jobs disappear vs. transform fastest when AI enters labor markets?
networking_tip: CHROs seeking upskilling solutions here: sponsor a lunch table discussion, capture their immediate needs.

title: AI in Biology - Impact on Biomanufacturing
