summary_one_liner: Intergenerational AI choices shape prosperity for Asia and Africa's billions
icebreaker: Amandeep Singh Gill's work on AI governance—how do you see it reshaping policy in your region?
networking_tip: High decision-maker density means grab coffee during breaks; UN officials attend—ask about funding mechanisms for AI initiatives.

title: Safeguarding Children in India's AI Future: Towards Child-Centric AI Policy and Governance
description:
As India advances ambitious national AI strategies and positions itself as a global AI leader, the governance choices made today will have long-term 
consequences for children's rights, safety, dignity and development. Children are not merely 'users' 
of AI systems; they are deeply embedded within algorithmic ecosystems that mediate opportunities 
and risks.
speakers: Akash Pugalia, Teleperformance; Ashish Jaiman, Nedl Labs; Atish Gonsalves, LEGO Education; Chitra Iyer, Space2Grow; Gaurav Aggarwal, iSPIRT Foundation; Maya Shermon, GPAI and Senior Tech & Innovation Advisor (ST&I Attaché), Embassy of Israel in India; N.S. Nappinai, Cyber Saathi; Shireen Vakil, Space2Grow; Uthara Ganesh, Snapchat; Zoe Lambourne, Childlight
knowledge_partners: Institute for Governance, Policies and Politics, New Delhi
summary_one_liner: Protecting children's rights in India's rapidly expanding AI ecosystem
icebreaker: Ms. Nappinai's child safety expertise—how are you embedding children's rights into your AI governance?
networking_tip: EdTech founders + child advocates mix; Ms. Pragya Mishra shapes policy—connect on child-centric design principles.

title: Scaling impact from India's Soverign AI and Data
description: India and many nations are advancing indigenous generative AI to meet local linguistic, cultural, and governance needs while strengthening technology sovereignty. However, models alone cannot deliver national-scale value. Real impact depends on sovereign infrastructure, robust deployment stacks, clear use-case maturity, scalable architectures, and advanced AI research. This panel examines these critical dependencies and imperatives required to translate indigenous AI capabilities into inclusive, measurable outcomes for citizens, the economy, and public institutions.
speakers: Amit Sheth, IAIRO; Amith Singhee, IBM; Ana Paula Assis, IBM; Rajiv Chetwani, ISRO; Rishi Bal, BharatGen; Sandip Patel, IBM; Shri P S Pradyumna IAS, AP Govt; Shri. Abhishek Singh, IAS, Meity, GoI; Tanvi Lall, People+AI
summary_one_liner: Sovereign AI infrastructure and deployment stacks for national-scale impact
icebreaker: Amit Sheth's sovereign AI work—how are you building indigenous models for your market?
networking_tip: Enterprise & IBM partners attend—visit sponsor booths early; IAS officials control budgets—ask about gov digital infrastructure RFPs.

title: AI and India's Economic Growth: Sectoral Impact and the Road Ahead
description: This session explores AI as a catalyst for India's inclusive economic growth, highlighting its sectoral impact across industry, services, governance, agriculture, finance, healthcare, and MSMEs. It examines how AI enhances productivity, efficiency, and competitiveness while reducing leakages and enabling innovation. The discussion also outlines key challenges, policy linkages, and the evolving role of Chartered Accountants in AI governance, assurance, and value creation.
speakers: CA. Anand Prakash Jangid, ajalabs.ai; CA. Charanjot Singh Nanda, The Institute of Chartered Accountants of India; CA. Dayaniwas Sharma, The Institute of Chartered Accountants of India; CA. Harpreet Singh, The Royal Bank of Scotland; CA. Narasimhan Elangovan, InCorp Advisory Services; CA. Prabhaw Kumar Agarwalla, The Institute of Chartered Accountants of India; CA. Prasanna Kumar D, The Institute of Chartered Accountants of India; CA. R. Vittal Raj, The Institute of Chartered Accountants of India; CA. Umesh Sharma, The Institute of Chartered Accountants of India
knowledge_partners: Institute of Chartered Accountants of India
summary_one_liner: Chartered Accountants explore AI's sectoral impact on India's economic growth
icebreaker: CA Charanjot Singh on MSME AI impact—are your clients asking about AI readiness assessments?
networking_tip: Chartered accountants cluster around finance track; MSME owners need advisors—position yourself as their AI-finance translator.

title: AI Competitiveness and Innovation: From Insight to Action
description: An overview of the AI competitiveness landscape, examining why speed, coordination, and institutional capacity now define leadership. Senior industry and policy leaders will share brief perspectives on execution barriers, lessons from national strategies, and public-private alignment. The discussion is structured around three key pillars: innovation as a competitive signal, securing AI supply chains and infrastructure, and talent, energy, and government adoption as force multipliers.
speakers: Graham Brookie, Atlantic Council; Nabiha Syed, Mozilla Foundation; Ruth Berry, Nvidia; Thomas Zacharia, AMD
summary_one_liner: Speed, coordination, and institutional capacity define AI leadership now
icebreaker: Graham Brookie's Atlantic Council insights on AI competitiveness—how's your country positioned?
networking_tip: Senior policy leaders attending; network right after talks before they leave; geopolitical focus means discussion of funding shifts.

title: From Algorithms to Outcomes: Building AI that Works for People
description: This session will kick off the daylong event 'AI For Social Good: Impact That Works', featuring a Nobel laureate, international researchers, members of Indian and international civil society, prominent industry leaders and senior members of the Government of India. This session will feature plenaries and a fireside chat on how research agendas can be aligned with government priorities so that AI adoption and scale-up decisions can be driven by rigorous evidence.
speakers: Iqbal Dhaliwal, J-PAL; MIT; Michael Kremer, J-PAL & University of Chicago; S. Krishnan, IAS, Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology (MeitY)
summary_one_liner: Nobel-backed session aligning AI research with government impact priorities
icebreaker: Michael Kremer's Nobel work—how are you applying evidence-based policy in government AI adoption?
networking_tip: High-level gov officials present; attend keynote front-row to ask questions; J-PAL researchers network during lunch afterward.

title: Innovation to Impact: AI as a Public Health Gamechanger
description: Health is central to India's socioeconomic progress and a core pillar under AI for Economic Development and Social Good. With strong digital public health infrastructure through ABDM, global IT leadership, and growing AI R&D ecosystems, India is poised to scale AI from innovation to impact. The roundtable "Innovation to Impact: AI as a Public Health Gamechanger" will drive actionable pathways across policy, adoption, public–private collaboration, and outcome-driven AI deployment, unlocking economic, social, and health dividends
speakers: Dr. Bishnu Panigrahi, Fortis Healthcare; Dr. V. K. Paul, NITI Aayog, GoI; Mr. Aman Sharma, GoI; Mr. Bharat Sesha, Philips India; Mr. Harsh Mahajan, Mahajan Imaging & Labs; Mr. Neeraj Jain, PATH; Mr. Nico Schiettekatte, Embassy of the Kingdom of the Netherlands, New Delhi; Mr. Roy Jakobs, Royal Philips; Ms. Anupriya Patel, Ministry of Chemicals and Fertilizers
summary_one_liner: Philips-anchored roadmap for AI-powered public health transformation in India
icebreaker: Roy Jakobs and the Philips health innovation angle—how are you leveraging ABDM in your product roadmap?
networking_tip: Government + enterprise mix means ask about ABDM integration plans to connect with policy and exec buyers.

title: AI for Societal Value: Responsible Innovation Across Healthcare and High-Impact Sectors
description: This session explores how artificial intelligence is reshaping healthcare and other high-impact sectors as it moves from research to real-world deployment. It examines pathways for responsible innovation, sustainable commercialization, and long-term societal value, while addressing ethical considerations, regulatory readiness, and trust. Through forward-looking perspectives, the discussion highlights how AI systems can be designed, governed, and scaled to deliver meaningful impact without compromising transparency, fairness, or accountability.
speakers: Dr. Arif Ahmed Sekh, UiT The Arctic University of Norway; Dr. Gunjan Gupta Govil, Gunjan IVF World and a fertility specialist; Dr. Kiran D. Sekhar, Kiran Fertility Clinics; Dr. Swarupa Mitra, Fortis Medical; Dr. Tanuj Bhatia, SGRR Medical College & SMI Hospital; Prof. Dilip K. Prasad, UiT The Arctic University of Norway
knowledge_partners: UiT The Arctic University of Norway
summary_one_liner: Responsible AI innovation bridges research to real-world healthcare impact
icebreaker: Dr. Kiran Sekhar's healthcare AI work—what's your biggest barrier to responsible deployment?
networking_tip: Academic-heavy crowd in smaller session; find researchers during lunch; medical device innovators seek ethics partnerships.

title: AI for Impact - Global South Forum: Shared Solutions, Shared Futures
description: AI for Impact - Global South Forum brings together policymakers, practitioners, and partners to share what works, and what doesn't, in using AI for public good. Informed by dialogues in Kigali and Nairobi, the forum focuses on moving beyond small pilots to solutions that work within real budgets, infrastructure, and capacity. It examines how countries can build reliable systems and highlights practical approaches to scaling AI responsibly, strengthening institutions, and delivering lasting public value.
speakers: Janet Zhou, Gates Foundation; Johan Harvard, Tony Blair Institute; Lacina Kone, Smart Africa; Nakul Jain, Wadhwani AI Global (Moderator); Robert Opp, UNDP; Shalini Unnikrishnan, BCG; Sunil Wadhwani, Wadhwani AI (Keynote Speaker)
summary_one_liner: Global South leaders scaling AI beyond pilots to real public impact
icebreaker: What's one AI for public good lesson from Global South implementation that surprised you most?
networking_tip: High decision-maker density means shorter conversations. Ask about their region's specific challenges to stand out.

title: Building a Trusted and Resilient AI Infrastructure Ecosystem: Balancing Innovation, Security, and Rights
description: This panel will examine principles and infrastructure for a secure, trusted AI ecosystem. It will showcase global and Indian best practices in governance, transparency, and accountability, while exploring how policy frameworks and innovation can responsibly accelerate adoption. Speakers will address challenges such as interoperability gaps, data security, and ethical deployment. The session emphasizes strategies for safe, scalable, resilient, and inclusive AI transformation, balancing innovation with responsible implementation to strengthen trust and sustainability.
speakers: Ankit Bose, Nasscom; Mr. Chengetai Masango, United Nations Secretariat of the Internet Governance Forum - Intergovernmental Organisation; Mr. Raju Vegesna, Sify - Industry; Mr. Abhishek Singh, Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology; Ms. Amrita Choudhury, CCAOI - Civil Society; Ms. Shahana Chaterji, Public Policy and Regulatory Affairs, Shardul Amarchand Mangaldas & Co - Legal; Rishikesh Kanegaonkar, Nayara Energy
summary_one_liner: Frameworks for secure, transparent, and accountable AI infrastructure globally
icebreaker: Ankit Bose on AI trust infrastructure—what's your biggest security challenge with current ecosystems?
networking_tip: CISOs & infrastructure leaders attend; ask Raju Vegesna about resilience frameworks; gov officials set compliance standards.

title: From Insights to Action for Resilient, High-Performance Data Centres
description: As AI-driven computing demand accelerates, data centers are emerging as complex, dynamic loads on modern power systems. This session examines how AI and advanced energy technologies are being deployed to enable resilient, flexible, and high-performance AI data center infrastructure. It features applied research about hybrid grid architectures, advanced cooling and geothermal systems, predictive digital twins, geospatial and transmission siting and planning tools, and the ARIES platform for large-scale testing and risk reduction.
speakers: Mr. Ben Kroposki, Power Systems Engineering Center, U.S. DOE National Laboratory of the Rockies; Mr. Jal Desai, U.S. DOE National Laboratory of the Rockies; Mr. Reji Kumar, Indian Smart Grid Forum; Ms. Jaquelin Cochran, U.S. DOE National Laboratory of the Rockies
knowledge_partners: U.S. Department of Energy (DOE) National Renewable Energy Laboratory (NREL)
summary_one_liner: Advanced energy tech and AI powering next-gen data center resilience
icebreaker: Ben Kroposki's work on digital twins for data centers fascinates me—how are you thinking about energy modeling?
networking_tip: Data center engineers cluster naturally—find the cooling systems discussion and ask specific NREL findings questions.

title: AI Masterclass in Robotics
description: This session, conducted by Tata Consultancy Services, will demonstrate how strategic AI goals can be turned into practical, production-ready solutions for inspection, and autonomous material movement, emphasizing resilient, safe, and compliant deployment at scale. Participants will gain hands-on experience with AI systems, along with industry-specific blueprints and replicable best practices.
speakers: Laksh Parthasarthy, Tata Consultancy Services; Naresh Mehta, Tata Consultancy Services
summary_one_liner: Hands-on TCS masterclass on production-ready AI robotics deployment
icebreaker: Laksh Parthasarthy—how do teams transition from lab robotics AI to production inspection systems?
networking_tip: Technical depth 5 crowd = hiring managers seeking senior engineers. Share production deployment war stories.

title: AI for Social Good: Impact that Works
description: This day-long research and policy symposium will convene senior policymakers, leading researchers, and practitioners to examine how AI can meaningfully improve public service delivery towards an AI ecosystem that maximises social good. Participants will explore evidence from rigorous impact evaluations of AI innovations applied across education, health, labour, agriculture, governance, and climate – highlighting what works, why it works, and what must change for transparent, fair, and responsible scale-up that delivers sustained real-world impact.
speakers: Aimee Barnes; Asra Khan; Audrey Lorvo; Azeez Gupta; Becky Faith; Brigitte Hoyer Gosselink; David Yanagizawa-Drott; Dean Karlan; Elizabeth Kelly; Fatema AlMulla
summary_one_liner: Rigorous evidence on what works when AI meets public service delivery
icebreaker: Dean Karlan's J-PAL research on impact eval—are you measuring AI's real-world effects in your work?
networking_tip: Research-heavy crowd means find speakers during Q&A; impact investors cluster—connect over concrete evidence of AI effectiveness.

title: From Research to Reality: Building Safe and Localized Health-AI Solutions for India
description:
This 55-minute workshop focuses on driving actionable insights that bridge the gap between
research and reality in healthcare AI. The session brings together a multidisciplinary group to
explore the complete execution flow in healthtech: from research insights to funding, from
technical development to on-ground implementation, and the critical role of government support
in creating an interconnected ecosystem.
speakers: Aarushi Gupta, Digital Future Labs; Anunaya Jain, Jhpiego; Dr. Azra Ismail, Emory University, USA; Dr. Taniya Kaul, Myna Mahila Foundation; Prerak Mehta, Dalberg Advisors; Sunandan Madan, Dhwani Rural Information; Vikas Yadav, Gates Foundation; Zeel Mehta (Moderator), Myna Mahila Foundation
summary_one_liner: Bridging research-to-reality gap in localized healthcare AI for India
icebreaker: Ask Dr. Azra Ismail how Emory's research translates to Indian healthcare contexts.
networking_tip: Workshop format = smaller groups—focus on 1-2 deep conversations vs. many shallow ones.

title: Launch of AI Impact Casebooks – Health & Education
description: This session will present the AI Impact Casebooks on Health and Education, documenting real-world use cases, policy insights, and implementation learnings.
speakers:
Shri S. Krishnan, Secretary, MeitY; Ms. Catharina Boehme,
Officer-in-Charge, WHO South-East Asia Region; Smt. Punya Salila Srivastava, Secretary, Ministry of Health and Family Welfare; Ms. Gouri Gupta, 
Senior Director (EdTech), Central Square Foundation; Mr. Shankar Maruwada, 
CEO, EKStep Foundation; Smt. Debashree Mukherjee, Secretary, Ministry of Skill Development and Entrepreneurship ; Ms. Shikha Dahiya, Joint Director, IndiaAI
summary_one_liner: AI Impact Casebooks launch with government and WHO policy insights
icebreaker: Ask S. Krishnan what policy learnings surprised his team most in health AI.
networking_tip: Government officials often have limited time—book introductions via event organizers pre-event.

title: Mobilizing MDB Financing to Scale High-Impact AI Solutions in Asia
description: MDB financing can play a critical role in covering the substantial upfront and ongoing costs of deploying AI for social good (AISG) to achieve the SDGs. However, sustainable and large-scale deployment will require coordinated multisectoral action and support from concessional funders. Additionally, MDBs must adapt their traditional transaction processes to better align with the fast pace of AI innovation and the rapidly evolving needs of social sectors.
speakers: Antonio Zaballos, Asian Development Bank; Arjun Venkatraman, Gates Foundation; Dr J Ganesan, Government of Haryana; Hun Kim, Asian Infrastructure Investment Bank; Mahesh Uttamchandani, World Bank
summary_one_liner: Mobilizing multilateral development bank financing for scalable AI social good
icebreaker: Ask Arjun Venkatraman how Gates Foundation prioritizes concessional AI funding geographically.
networking_tip: MDB officials are relationship-focused—ask for 15min follow-up meetings, not immediate pitches.

title: From AI Innovation to Nation-Building
description: This session will include a leadership talk and keynote addresses on AI for economic development and social good.
speakers: 2. Prof. S Ravi Kiran; Dr. Amol Gite; Mr. Anirudh Srinivasan; Prof. Ganesh Ramakrishnan
knowledge_partners: BharatGen, TIH for IoT & IoE, IIT Bombay.
summary_one_liner: IIT Bombay showcases AI innovation pathways for national development
icebreaker: Prof. S Ravi Kiran at IIT—what's your lab's focus in generative AI for India's challenges?
networking_tip: Deep tech founder hub; approach PhD students during breaks; Prof. Ramakrishnan leads AI research—ask about collaboration opportunities.

title: Infosys Springboard - Democratizing AI Learning for Bharat - The road less travelled
description:
India stands at a unique inflection point. We are one of the youngest nations globally, with enormous talent potential—yet unemployment among educated youth remains a pressing concern.
While many factors contribute to this challenge, three stand out consistently:
lack of industry‑relevant skills,
limited awareness of emerging opportunities, and
absence of structured career guidance.
For fringe and underserved communities—rural youth, women, differently abled individuals—these barriers are magnified by geography, socio‑economic constraints, and access gaps. If India's AI journey is to be sustainable and inclusive, talent cannot come from a narrow segment of society. Inclusion is not charity—it is a national necessity.
room: Hall No. 5 First Floor - Session Hall 1
speakers: Mrs. Padma Bhamidipati ; Mr. Akshay Beerala; Mr. Chaithanya Kothapalli; Mr. Amit Gupta ; Mr. Suresh Babu
summary_one_liner: India's hyperscale data centers meeting sovereign AI compute demands now
icebreaker: What's your take on sovereign vs. hyperscale data centres for AI workloads in India?
networking_tip: Connect with Cloud Architects during breaks—they influence infrastructure vendor selection decisions.

title: Power of AI and Content in revolutionizing the Multi Billion Dollar Book Industry
description: ReproBooks is a Technology driven global content platform company with over 7.5 million content with 1000+ Publisher network, 500+ languages. This session will show how ReproBooks with over 2 decades of experience, is revolutionizing the Book Industry with the power of its content and AI.
room: Hall No. 3 First Floor - Session Hall 4
speakers:
Romi Vohra: CEO and MD - ReproBooks
; Shrenik Jain: CTO - ReproBooks
; Kunal Vohra: COO- ReproBooks
summary_one_liner: AI transforms 7.5M+ content book platform across 500+ languages
icebreaker: Ask Romi Vohra how ReproBooks scales content AI across 500+ languages
networking_tip: Seek out publishing execs and content platform founders for B2B partnerships

title: Fintech Revolution - AI Balancing Innovation & Trust
description: NA
room: Hall No. 4 First Floor - Session Hall 3
speakers:
Sh. Pravin Anand - Managing Partner, Anand & Anand
; Sh. Amit Kapoor - Founder & CEO, OneStack
; Sh. Mayank Gupta - Cp-Founder, Zoppr
; Sh. Santosh Bhat - Chief Data Scientist & Head of Advance Technology, Policy Bazaar
; Sh. Vineet Singh - Co Founder & CEO, Castler
; Sh. Hemant Kohli - Angel Investor and Serial Entrepreneur
summary_one_liner: Fintech leaders balance AI innovation with regulatory trust frameworks
icebreaker: Ask Amit Kapoor how OneStack navigates fintech regulatory complexity with AI
networking_tip: Connect with founding fintech execs for regulatory insights and partnerships

title: AI Powered  Bharat through Universal Digital Connectivity
room: Hall No. 4 First Floor - Session Hall 2
summary_one_liner: Universal digital connectivity enabling AI-powered Bharat transformation
icebreaker: Explore how universal connectivity unlocks AI adoption in underserved regions
networking_tip: Meet government tech leads and policy architects shaping digital India

title: Launch of AI Impact Casebooks – Gender & Agriculture
description: This session will present the AI Impact Casebooks on Gender and Agriculture, capturing evidence-based use cases and policy perspectives.
speakers:
Shri Abhishek Singh, Additional Secretary, MeitY, & CEO IndiaAI Mission; Ms Christine Arab,
Regional Director, UN Women; Smt. Rashmi Singh, Secretary, Ministry of Women and Child Development; Shri Vikas Rastogi, Additional Chief Secretary, Agriculture, Animal Husbandry, Dairy Development, and Fisheries Department, Government of Maharashtra (TBC); Mr. Paul Procee, Acting Country Director, World Bank (India) (TBC); Mr. JP Tripathy, Director, Agriculture; Sh. Shri Devesh Chaturvedi, Secretary,  Ministry of Agriculture & Farmers Welfare; Ms. Shikha Dahiya, Joint Director, IndiaAI
summary_one_liner: AI impact casebooks showcase gender equality and agricultural transformation
icebreaker: Ask Abhishek Singh about IndiaAI Mission's gender & agriculture impact metrics
networking_tip: Connect with UN Women and Ministry leaders for global SDG alignment

title: AI in Health: Saving Lives at Scale
description: Can AI innovation help in diagnosing silent heart attacks to deliver measurable health gains for underserved populations at scale? Hear from a leading international researcher, and an expert panel, about how rigorous evidence from randomised evaluations can distinguish promising ideas from solutions, and strengthen health systems. Showcasing on-ground evidence, participants will understand what it takes to make AI work in practice - aligning technology with frontline workflows and governance structures, and generating actionable evidence for sustainable improvements in healthcare delivery.
speakers: Aimee Barnes, J-PAL; Rob Sherman, Meta; Senthil Kumar, IAS, Ministry of Health & Family Welfare, Govt. of Tamil Nadu; Shahed Alam, Noora Health; Ziad Obermeyer, Berkeley
summary_one_liner: Rigorous evidence on AI diagnosing silent heart attacks at scale
icebreaker: Ziad Obermeyer's silent heart attack diagnostics work—how do you approach health equity in your AI implementations?
networking_tip: High decision-maker density + impact focus. Ask about measurement frameworks to engage public health officials directly.

title: Data, People, and Pre-Empting Mass Exclusion: Building Ethical AI as Digital Public Infrastructure
description: This is a focused session examining how AI in public services can unintentionally exclude vulnerable communities and how such risks can be anticipated and mitigated. Anchored in community-centric design and inclusive data governance, the discussion will connect grassroots realities with ethics, policy, and safety perspectives, positioning AI as a transparent, accountable, and people-first Digital Public Infrastructure that enables social empowerment rather than mass exclusion.
speakers: Arpita Kanjilal, Digital Empowerment Foundation; Dr. Bhavani Rao R, UNESCO W4EAISAC; Jayesh Ranjan, IAS, Government of Telangana; Nicolas Miailhe, AI Safety Connect; Osama Manzar, Digital Empowerment Foundation; Paola Galvez Callirgos, Globethics; Ram Papatla, APAC Trust and Safety, Google; Ram Papatla, Google India
summary_one_liner: Preventing AI-driven exclusion of vulnerable communities in public services
icebreaker: Nicolas Miailhe's digital public infrastructure lens—how do you anticipate exclusion risks in your systems?
networking_tip: Ethics-focused crowd prefers depth over breadth. Pick one exclusion risk example and dig into solutions together.

title: AI-Powered Ports: Reimagining Efficiency and Operations
description: The session will examine how AI is redefining ports as intelligent national infrastructure rather than merely operational logistics assets. It will focus on AI's role in enhancing efficiency, resilience, risk management, and governance in the maritime sector, while addressing workforce transition, policy frameworks, and responsible adoption.
speakers: Dr. Manish Tiwari, IGPP; Mr. Dhruv Kotak, J M Baxi Group; Mr. Rajesh Soundararajan , IAS, V.O.C Port Authority; Mr. Subrat Tripathy, APSEZ Ltd.; Mr. Susanta Kumar Purohit, IRSEE, V.O.C Port Authority; Mr. T.K. Ramachandran, MoPSW; Ms. Aprajita Rana, AZB & Partners; Prof. (Dr.) Gaurav Vallabh, Economic Advisory Council to the Prime Minister (EAC-PM)
knowledge_partners: Institute for Governance, Policies and Politics, New Delhi
summary_one_liner: Transforming India's ports into AI-driven intelligent national infrastructure
icebreaker: Ask T. K. Ramachandran or Dr. Manish Tiwari: which AI use case in ports delivers ROI fastest—and why aren't more ports adopting it?
networking_tip: Maritime ops + supply chain execs rarely meet logistics tech founders. Volunteer to help with a logistics challenge—instant credibility.

title: Scaling Enterprise Transformation - How India Can Leapfrog in the AI Economy
description: As AI adoption accelerates, enterprises are realizing that the next wave of transformation looks very different from early hype. This session brings together investors, founders, and transformation leaders to examine where enterprise AI creates real value, where it falls short, how companies can move from pilots to scaled impact, how operating models must evolve for the new "AI worker," and what this means for India Inc's opportunity.
speakers: Arpan Sheth, Bain & Company; Chinmaya Sharma, InfoEdge Ventures; Karthik Reddy, Blume Ventures; Mihir Shukla, Automation Anywhere; Sravanth Aluru, Avataar.ai; Tejeshwi Sharma, Peak XV
summary_one_liner: Bain and VCs reveal what truly drives enterprise AI transformation
icebreaker: Karthik Reddy's VC perspective on AI transformation—which industry verticals are you most bullish on?
networking_tip: Disruptors + VCs present: pitch concrete transformation metrics, not potential. CXOs respond to measurable results.

title: AI for Her: Catalyst Women Leaders Driving Responsible and Inclusive AI
description: The session will cover responsible AI frameworks, mitigation of gender and data biases, and the translation of national AI policies into real-world applications across health, education, and social sectors. It will also address access to capital, mentorship, and ecosystem support required to scale women-led AI innovations. Through a moderated panel discussion, global technology leaders, policymakers, and founders will share practical insights on building safe and trusted AI systems while nurturing future women technologists.
speakers: Ms Anna Roy, NITI Aayog, GoI; Ms Annapurna Vishwanathan, Airbus India & South Asia; Ms Ivana Bartoletti, Wipro Limited; Ms Roma Datta Chobey, Google India; Ms Sandhya Varanasi, Schneider Electric; Ms Sarah E. Kemp, Intel; Ms Sarika Gulyani, FICCI; Ms. Deepti Gaur Mukerjee, Ministry of Corporate Affairs
summary_one_liner: Women tech leaders shaping responsible AI across health, education, society
icebreaker: Anna Roy's work on translating AI policy into practice—what's your biggest gender bias challenge right now?
networking_tip: Women leaders here value substantive discussions. Reference specific FICCI frameworks or recent mitigation successes.

title: GenAI Talent Imperative: Building Global Future Workforce
description: GenAI Talent Imperative: Building the Global Future Workforce is a high-impact roundtable bringing together leaders from industry, academia, and government to shape the future of AI-ready talent. As Generative AI rapidly transforms roles, skills, and productivity, this session will explore workforce readiness, emerging GenAI skill requirements, and scalable skilling frameworks. Join the dialogue to align policy, education, and industry needs for building a globally competitive, future-ready workforce.
speakers: Dr Abhilasha Gaur, SSC Nasscom; Emily Bastedo, ISACA; Indrani Choudhury, Microsoft; Jagdish Mitra, Humanize; Neha Jain, IT & Electronics, GoUP; Nitin Seth, Incedo; Pramod P.J., Meity, GoI; Prof Jai Prakash, AKTU; Prof Jyoti Kumar, IIT Delhi; Prof. Shyam Rath, AICTE; Rishikesh Patnakar, NSDC; Sanjeev Jain, Wipro; Tulika Pandey, Ministry of Electronics & IT, GoI; Vijay Swaminathan, Draup
knowledge_partners: Nasscom  FutureSkills Prime  A MeitY-nasscom Digital Skilling Initiative
summary_one_liner: Nasscom-led blueprint for building a GenAI-ready global workforce
icebreaker: Emily Bastedo on global talent readiness—what GenAI skills gap is most urgent for your organization?
networking_tip: CHROs and L&D leaders here. Share specific upskilling outcomes you've measured to spark credible partnerships.

title: From Co-Design to Courtroom: Building a Fair Trial Adviser for Justice Systems
description: This session explores how collaborative, human-centred AI can strengthen fair trial guarantees across justice systems. Drawing on results from a pre-Summit hackathon, it presents a prototype Fair Trial Adviser that delivers transparent, citation-based legal guidance across languages. The discussion will highlight co-design, ethical safeguards, explainability, and inclusive access, alongside emerging guidelines for safe, responsible, and judicial AI.
speakers: Daisy Peterson, Oxford Institute of Technology and Justice; Lodovica Raparelli, Oxford Institute of Technology and Justice; Wassim Hamidouche, Microsoft
knowledge_partners: Oxford Institute of Technology and Justice
summary_one_liner: AI-powered fair trial adviser delivering multilingual citation-based legal guidance
icebreaker: Ask Daisy Peterson or Lodovica Raparelli about the hackathon prototype—what surprised you most about building AI for fairness in courts?
networking_tip: Lower decision-maker density but highly specialized. Deep technical conversations > volume. Find the 2-3 people doing justice tech and spend quality time.

title: Harnessing AI for Equitable and Resilient Health Systems
description: This session convenes policymakers, industry, technologists, and public health experts to explore how AI can be responsibly scaled to deliver health system impact. With reference to case studies and innovation platforms, it will examine practical pathways for moving from pilots to sustainable, system-level adoption. The session will explore governance, standards, and ethical considerations for responsible AI adoption and identify pathways for inclusive and equitable AI adoption, particularly in low- and middle-income countries.
speakers: Aparnaa Somanathan, World Bank; Geetha Manjunath, Niramai Health Analytix; Kalavathi GV, Siemens Healthineers; Karthik Adapa, WHO-SEARO; Kiran Gopal Vaska, National Health Authority, GoI; Mamta Murthi, The World Bank Group; Pramod Varma, India DPIs; Preetha Reddy, Former UNESCO Assistant Director-General for Social and Human Sciences
summary_one_liner: World Bank convenes leaders on scaling AI in low-income health systems
icebreaker: Mamta Murthi and Pramod Varma: what's one AI governance barrier in LMICs that keeps you up at night?
networking_tip: High decision-maker density + health focus = perfect for HealthTech pitches. Identify World Bank/dev finance officers early and request 1-on-1s.

title: AI, Innovation and Collaboration: Shaping Resilient Economies
description: This panel examines how innovation and collaboration can transform AI data centers into strategic assets for secure, reliable, and affordable power systems. Bringing together hyperscalers, utilities, and public sector leaders from the United States and India, it will explore advances in compute efficiency, cooling, grid integration, and demand flexibility, alongside enabling policy frameworks that strengthen power systems and position AI infrastructure as a catalyst for long-term resilience and economic growth.
speakers: Mr. Abhishek Ranjan, BSES Rajdhani Power Limited (BRPL); Mr. Deepesh Kiran Nanda, Tata Consultancy Services; Mr. Jal Desai, U.S. DOE National Laboratory of the Rockies; Ms. Jaquelin Cochran, U.S. DOE National Laboratory of the Rockies
knowledge_partners: U.S. Department of Energy (DOE) National Renewable Energy Laboratory (NREL)
summary_one_liner: US-India collaboration on AI data centers as strategic power assets
icebreaker: Ask Jal Desai or Jaquelin Cochran: what's the one grid integration constraint stopping your data center expansion right now?
networking_tip: Energy + data center ops crowd. Utilities and hyperscalers don't often meet—position yourself as a bridge between these silos.

title: The AI–Energy–Finance Trifecta: Future-Proofing India's Datacenters
description: The session explores how accelerating AI adoption is driving a surge in data center energy demand while also creating new opportunities for efficiency, resilience, and sustainability. It brings together experts to examine the AI–Energy–Finance Trifecta—highlighting renewable integration, intelligent energy management, and innovative financing. The discussion aims to chart collaborative pathways for building green, resilient, and future‑ready data centers aligned with India's digital and net‑zero ambitions.
speakers: Dr. Ashish Kumar Goel, IAS, UPPCL; Jitendra Srivastava, IAS, REC Limited; Mani Khurana, World Bank; MoeZ Cherif, World Bank; Sandeep Bandivdekar, Microsoft | India; Vrushali Gaud, Climate Operations at Google
summary_one_liner: Financing green, AI-ready data centers for India's net-zero ambitions
icebreaker: Dr. Ashish Kumar Goel or Mani Khurana: what financing structure actually unlocks green datacenter capital in India right now?
networking_tip: Infrastructure investors + gov officials in same room. Attend morning sessions when energy finance leaders are most engaged.

title: AI and the State: Policy and Practice in Government
description: The panel will explore how governments can approach AI deployment differently from private sector actors, including how procurement decisions can influence market outcomes in the public interest. It will examine the role of safety research, measurement, evaluation, and community participation in supporting responsible public sector AI deployment. The discussion will also consider how red-teaming, ongoing assessment, and evaluation processes can strengthen transparency and accountability.
speakers: Christine Custis, Partnership on AI (PAI); Gaia Marcus, Ada Lovelace Institute; Jaan Tallinn, Estonia; Prof. Alondra Nelson, Institute for Ethics in AI at the University of Oxford; Rumman Chowdhury, ; Stephanie Ifayemi, Partnership on AI (PAI)
knowledge_partners: AI Policy and Governance Working Group (AIPGWG)
summary_one_liner: Global policy leaders debating responsible government AI deployment practices
icebreaker: Prof. Alondra Nelson on public interest AI procurement—how do you balance innovation speed with safety?
networking_tip: Policy + safety-focused crowd. Ask about red-teaming processes to reveal how procurement officials think.

title: AI for National Defence
description: This session brings together senior stakeholders from India's defence ecosystem to explore Secure by Design principles for AI in national defence. Speakers representing the Army, Navy, and Air Force will join participants from the private sector to share operational, strategic, and technological perspectives. The discussion will examine secure AI development, deployment challenges, governance approaches, and cross-sector collaboration to support resilient and mission-ready AI systems for defence applications.
speakers: Air Vice Marshal Deepak Joshi, HQ IDS; Dr Chandrika Kaushik, DRDO; Maj. Gen. (R) Sandeep Sharma, Army; ⁠Shri. Sarjan Shah, Shield AI; Suhas Gopinath, Globals
summary_one_liner: India's tri-service leaders discuss secure-by-design AI for defense
icebreaker: Ask Dr. Chandrika Kaushik what 'Secure by Design' means in India's defence AI context.
networking_tip: Defence sector leaders value long-term partnerships—build relationships, not just pitches.

title: AI for our Oceans of Tomorrow: Data, Models and Governance
speakers: Cmd. Dr. Prashant Srivastava, Ministry of Earth Sciences; Dr. Deepak Subramani, IISC Bangalore; Dr. Shishir Shrotriya, RIS; Hari Warrior, Dept. of Ocean Engineering and Naval Architectur, IIT-K; Mr. Abhay Shukla, AI Transmute Solutions; Mr. Jayakrishnan Hari, IBM -Research; Mr. Rakesh K. Mishra, Ernst and Young LLP; Mr. Siva Kumar Murthy, Ernst and Young LLP; Shri. Kartikeya Anand, Alternative Energy Company (AEC), UK
summary_one_liner: AI and data governance protecting ocean ecosystems through innovation
icebreaker: Ask Dr. Deepak Subramani about IISC's ocean data models and governance
networking_tip: Network with IIT/IISC researchers and Ministry of Earth Sciences officials

title: Pushing the Frontier of AI in Education
description: At the IndiaAI Impact Summit, the Ministry of Education session presents a structured and integrated view of how AI is being operationalized across Indian education. The session will bring together leadership perspectives across policy interventions, curriculum and pedagogy, higher education transformation, industry collaboration, and AI Centres of Excellence to demonstrate how AI adoption is being translated into institutional and system-level change."
speakers: Dr Shreedhar Vembu, Zoho Corporation; Dr Vibhu Mittal, Inflection AI; Mr Rajan Anandan, Peak XV PArtners; Prof Manindra Agrawal, IIT Kanpur; Prof Manoj Singh Gaur, IIT Jammu; Prof Mitesh Khapra, IIT Madras; Saumya Gupta, Ministry of Education
summary_one_liner: Ministry transforms Indian education with structured AI integration roadmap
icebreaker: Ask Dr. Shreedhar Vembu how Zoho democratizes AI tools for educators
networking_tip: Connect with Peak XV, IIT faculty, and EdTech founders for scale opportunities

title: Model Context Protocol, Open Standards and Data in the Age of Agentic AI
description: This workshop explores how open standards, data governance, and the Model Context Protocol (MCP) are shaping the next generation of agentic AI systems.
speakers: Amanda Brock, OpenUK; Anil Madhavapeddy, Computer Laboratory, University of Cambridge; Anil Madhavapeddy, Cambridge University; James Lovegrove, RedHat; Karan MV, GitHub; Naresh Vyas, TwoCents.ai; Rohit Ghumare, OpenUK; Saiyam Pathak, Kubesimplify; Shivay Lamba, JSNation; Simon Hansford, Civo
summary_one_liner: Open standards and MCP drive next-gen agentic AI systems architecture
icebreaker: Ask Karan MV about GitHub's Model Context Protocol integration strategy
networking_tip: Engage OpenUK and Cambridge researchers on open standards implementation

title: AI for our Oceans of Tomorrow: Data, Models and Governance
speakers: Cmd. Dr. Prashant Srivastava, Ministry of Earth Sciences; Dr. Deepak Subramani, IISC Bangalore; Dr. Shishir Shrotriya, RIS; Hari Warrior, Dept. of Ocean Engineering and Naval Architectur, IIT-K; Mr. Abhay Shukla, AI Transmute Solutions; Mr. Jayakrishnan Hari, IBM -Research; Mr. Rakesh K. Mishra, Ernst and Young LLP; Mr. Siva Kumar Murthy, Ernst and Young LLP; Shri. Kartikeya Anand, Alternative Energy Company (AEC), UK
summary_one_liner: AI and data governance protecting ocean ecosystems through innovation
icebreaker: Ask Dr. Prashant Srivastava about Ministry of Earth Sciences' ocean AI agenda
networking_tip: Connect with Ministry officials and IIT researchers for ocean tech partnerships

title: Pushing the Frontier of AI in Education
description: At the IndiaAI Impact Summit, the Ministry of Education session presents a structured and integrated view of how AI is being operationalized across Indian education. The session will bring together leadership perspectives across policy interventions, curriculum and pedagogy, higher education transformation, industry collaboration, and AI Centres of Excellence to demonstrate how AI adoption is being translated into institutional and system-level change."
speakers: Dr Shreedhar Vembu, Zoho Corporation; Dr Vibhu Mittal, Inflection AI; Mr Rajan Anandan, Peak XV PArtners; Prof Manindra Agrawal, IIT Kanpur; Prof Manoj Singh Gaur, IIT Jammu; Prof Mitesh Khapra, IIT Madras; Saumya Gupta, Ministry of Education
summary_one_liner: Ministry-led blueprint for operationalizing AI across Indian education systems
icebreaker: Ask Prof Khapra how IIT-M is adapting ML curriculum for primary schools.
networking_tip: Connect with Ministry officials during breaks—they shape ed-tech funding priorities.

title:
World Café
Cross-Border Applied AI
Joint Research, Innovation and Startup Communities: Turn Expertise into Practical Next Steps for International AI Collaboration.
description: World Café: Cross-Border Applied AI brings together global researchers, startups, SMEs, policymakers, and industry leaders to turn expertise into action. This interactive session focuses on practical, sovereignty-aware models for international AI collaboration—spanning joint research, innovation, and startup ecosystems. Aligned with the India AI Impact Summit's Sutras and Chakras, the discussion is designed to generate concrete outcomes that directly inform Summit deliberations and enable meaningful, cross-border AI partnerships.
speakers: Alexandra Bech Gjørv; Anand kamannavar; Anil Sharma; Pasi Toivanen; Sagar Sen
summary_one_liner: Interactive workshop building actionable cross-border AI research partnerships
icebreaker: Ask Pasi Toivanen or Alexandra Bech Gjørv about turning their cross-border research into a scalable startup—what's the biggest friction point?
networking_tip: World Café format = small group rotations. Sit with someone from a different country/sector in each round to maximize diverse connections.

title: Planet-Scale Intelligence for Economic Growth: AgriStack, Climate AI, and Foundational Models for Global Impact
description: This session explores how planet-scale intelligence built on AI, Earth observation and Digital Public Infrastructure can move from pilots to production and reshape real economies. Anchored in India's experience with AgriStack, it examines climate-smart credit, resilient food systems, and risk-informed public spending, with lessons for the Global South. Speakers will discuss foundational Earth models, governance and validation layers, and the public–private architectures needed to make AI a trusted, shared asset for inclusive growth.
speakers: Abhishek Arora; Derick Jose; Gaurav Aggarwal; Suman Chandra Rawat, IAS
summary_one_liner: Earth observation meets AI for climate-smart agriculture and economic growth
icebreaker: Ask Gaurav Aggarwal how AgriStack is actually moving from pilots to production—what's the financing model that works?
networking_tip: Heavy climate investor presence. Catch speakers during breaks before the room empties—decision-makers often leave early at policy forums.

title: Universities as Clty-Scale AI Catalysts: Delhi's Path from Research to Public Impact
description: 90-minute programme opens with a 10-minute institutional framing by NSUT and STPI on Delhi's AI ecosystem and universities' convening role. A 15-minute keynote by Prof. Anand Srivastava links academic leadership to responsible city-scale AI, curriculum, research, and industry engagement. A 40-minute panel explores translating research to deployment, talent, incubation, inclusivity, and scaling pilots with academic, STPI, government, industry, and policy experts. A 15-minute NSUT - STPI showcase presents 2-3 initiatives. Closing 10-minute reflections outline collaboration pathways ahead.
room: Hall No. 5 First Floor - Session Hall 1
speakers:
Prof. Anand Srivastava, VC, NSUT2
 ; Sh. Varun Aggarwal Co-founder, Aspiring Minds
 ; Ms. Maya Sherman, Head, Innovation, at Embassy of Israel in India
summary_one_liner: Delhi universities bridging AI research to city-scale public deployment
icebreaker: Prof. Anand Srivastava—how is NSUT bridging the gap between academic AI research and city-scale impact?
networking_tip: University incubator heads here fund early-stage AI teams; have your research-to-deployment story ready.

title: AI for Disability Inclusion: Global Lessons on Accessibility by Design
description: "AI for Disability Inclusion: Global Lessons on Accessibility by Design" examines how artificial intelligence can advance disability inclusion through an accessibility-by-design approach. Convened by The Quantum Hub (TQH), the Royal Society (UK), and the Department of Empowerment of Persons with Disabilities, Government of India, it brings together leaders from government, industry, and civil society. Drawing on global evidence, the discussion will focus on co-designing AI solutions with persons with disabilities and on policy safeguards aligned with India's social empowerment priorities.
speakers: Andrew Fleming, British Government; Manmeet Nanda, Department of PwDs,  GoI; Mr. Agustya Mehta, Meta; Mr. Amar Jain, Mission Accessibility; Mr. Tukaram Mundhe, Department of disability, Ministry of Maharashtra; Nipun Malhotra, TQH, Nipman Foundation; Professor Alison Noble, The Royal Society (UK)
summary_one_liner: Co-designing AI with disabled persons for true accessibility-by-design inclusion
icebreaker: Ask Andrew Fleming or Professor Alison Noble: what's the biggest gap between accessibility research and actual assistive tech adoption?
networking_tip: Disability-led design focus = co-design mindset. Find sessions with actual disabled participants and ask *them* about unsolved problems—not just experts.

title: Building Trust in the Age of Synthetic Media
description: This session will convene a policy dialogue at the India AI Impact Summit 2026 on the role of content provenance in enabling safe and trusted AI. As synthetic media scales, provenance mechanisms can support transparency, accountability, and trust. The discussion will situate provenance within AI governance and digital public infrastructure frameworks, explore standards-based approaches to address mis- and disinformation while protecting privacy and free expression, and examine practical implementation pathways and public–private collaboration.
speakers: Andrew Jenks, Microsoft; Andy Parsons, Adobe; Deepak Goel, Ministry of Electronics & IT, GoI; Gail Kent, Google; John Miller, Information Technology Industry Council; Sameer Boray, Information Technology Industry Council
knowledge_partners: Coalition for Content Provenance and Authenticity (C2PA)
summary_one_liner: Content provenance standards combating deepfakes and synthetic media threats
icebreaker: Deepak Goel, how close are platforms to adopting C2PA standards for content provenance?
networking_tip: Trust & Safety Officers and Media Execs have siloed networks—work the breakout groups, not the main floor.

title: Responsible AI for Health: Governance, Implementation and Investment Considerations
description: This session will explore real-world experiences in implementing AI in health systems, highlighting key governance and regulatory challenges alongside enabling factors such as data systems, partnerships, leadership, and financing. Drawing on country insights and aligned with global AI governance and normative processes, the session will advance dialogue on ethical, equitable, and people-centred deployment. It will conclude with shared priorities and practical pathways for partnership and investment to support responsible scale-up.
speakers: Alain Labrique, WHO Headquarters, Geneva; Andreas Reis, WHO; Divleen Jeji, Google for Health; Emily Muller, Wellcome trust; Sameer Pujari, WHO; Suneeta Krishnan, India Country office, Gates Foundation; Sunil Kumar Barnwal, National Health Authority, GoI; Ulrike Till, WIPO
summary_one_liner: WHO-led dialogue on ethical AI deployment and investment in health systems
icebreaker: Alain Labrique, what governance gaps are blocking AI investment in health systems right now?
networking_tip: WHO delegates and health policy makers tend to cluster in the investment panel discussion—that's your window to pitch.

title: AI Diplomacy: Asia Leads – Governing Artificial Intelligence in a Fragmented World
description: As AI reshapes global security faster than treaties can anticipate, traditional governance is falling behind. This session proposes "AI Diplomacy"—shifting the focus from rigid harmonization to establishing operational "fire-breaks" for immediate risks. Convening ministers and experts, we explore how Asian leadership can secure trusted lines of communication in a fragmented world. Join this high-level dialogue to transition from abstract ethics to durable, cross-border crisis mechanisms.
speakers: Anne Marie, Denmark's Tech; Azizjon Azimi, Artificial Intelligence Council of the Republic of Tajikistan; Dr. Yuko Harayama, GPAI Tokyo Expert Support Center and Tohoku University; H.E. Mr. Nezar Patria, Communication and Digital Affairs of the Republic of Indonesia; Prof Alejandro Reyes, University of Hong Kong; Scholar-in-residence, Asia Society; Adviser, AI Safety Asia; Prof ⁠Stuart Russell OBE, UC Berkeley and Center for Human-Compatible AI; Wan Sie Lee, IMDA Singapore
summary_one_liner: Ministers and AI safety pioneers forging Asia-led AI governance mechanisms
icebreaker: Prof. Stuart Russell, how do you see Asian AI safety frameworks differing from Western approaches?
networking_tip: Heavy hitter event with ministers and diplomats—position yourself by the speaker exit for brief, high-value conversations.

title: Beyond Language Models: The Next AI Race for Science, Biology, Energy & Sovereignty
summary_one_liner: Next-generation AI applications in science, biology, energy, and national capability
icebreaker: What specific biology/energy challenges are ripe for frontier AI models?
networking_tip: Seek out deep-tech founders—this attracts frontier AI capital and policy interest.

title: Shaping Resilient Futures in the Age of AI: Leadership for the Technology, Energy, and Security Transitions
description: The ability of countries, regions, and alliances to thrive amid geopolitical volatility and systemic shocks depends on aligning three domains: AI and strategic technologies, diversified low-carbon energy systems, and modernised security capabilities. Rather than advancing in isolation, these pillars must progress together, at speed and scale, to strengthen economic and societal resilience. This discussion explores the "triple transition," outlining practical pathways to navigate it while promoting cooperation, accountability, and public trust globally.
speakers: Deepak Bagla, Atal Innovation Mission, NITI Aayog; Deepak Bagla, Atal Innovation Mission, NITI Aayog; Harsh Vardhan Shringla, Rajya Sabha, India; Harsh Vardhan Shringla, Rajya Sabha; Sarith Felber, Ministry of Justice, Israel; Shyam Krishnakumar, The Pranava Institute; Tanya Filer, StateUp
summary_one_liner: Aligning AI, energy, and security for geopolitical resilience and national strategy
icebreaker: Ask Harsh Vardhan Shringla how Parliament views AI's role in India's security posture.
networking_tip: NITI Aayog & Rajya Sabha presence means government policy-making contacts—invaluable for policy-dependent startups.

title: The Role of AI in Drug Discovery
description: Modern drug discovery is in three parts: Finding a promising gene variant, translating that to a molecule that can be given to a patient and finally testing it in human clinical trials. The speakers will share their experiences and challenges in each of these three steps.  AI is being increasingly used in each of these steps and the speakers will describe the the role of AI in each part.
speakers: Aditya Kulkarni, Avammune; Aditya Kulkarni, Avammune; Jonathan Picker, Harvard Medical School; Jonathan Picker, Harvard Medical School; Parag Saxena, Vedanta Capital; Parag Saxena, Vedanta Capital; Vibhu Aggarwal, Miimansa; Vibhu Aggarwal, Miimansa
summary_one_liner: AI acceleration across gene discovery, molecule design, and clinical validation in pharma
icebreaker: Ask Jonathan Picker (Harvard) how AI is reducing molecule-to-human trial timelines.
networking_tip: Vedanta Capital investor present—ideal for biotech-AI startup fundraising conversations.

title: Launch of AI Impact Casebooks – Energy & Accessibility
description: This session will present AI Impact Casebooks on Energy and Accessibility, documenting evidence-based AI applications and implementation learnings.
speakers: Smt. Kavita Bhatia, Scientist G, GC (AI & ET Division), MeitY; Ms. Laura Cozzi, Director, Sustainability, Technology and Outlooks, IEA (TBC); Shri Piyush Singh, Additional Secretary, Ministry of Power; Sh. Santosh Kumar Sarangi, Secretary, Ministry of New and Renewable Energy ; Shri Praveen Kumar, Chairman & Managing Director, Artificial Limbs Manufacturing Corporation of India (ALIMCO) (TBC); Ms. Noopur Jhunjhunwala, Founder, ChangeInkk Foundation (TBC); Professor Debabrata Das, Director, IIIT-Bangalore (TBC); Smt. V. Vidyavathi, Secretary, Department of Empowerment of Persons with Disabilities, Ministry of Social Justice and Empowerment ; Ms. Shikha Dahiya, Joint Director, IndiaAI
summary_one_liner: Government-backed AI casebooks documenting energy and accessibility implementation evidence
icebreaker: Ask Kavita Bhatia (MeitY) how accessibility casebooks are reshaping AI procurement.
networking_tip: MeitY and IEA officials present—crucial for energy/public-sector AI policy deals.

title: The Future of Work, Skills and Innovation in Age of AI
description: India's AI transformation is shifting work from routine tasks to human-centric roles, emphasizing judgment, coordination with AI, and accountability. The 90-minute flagship session, "From Human Capital to Cognitive Capital," presented by 1Works with Conch Deep Tech Venture Studio & Advancer Corp, explores how trust, skills, and accountability must be re-engineered in AI-augmented systems. Bringing together leaders from public sector, industry, and academia, it positions Cognitive Capital as India's strategic advantage for continuous readiness and human-centric AI adoption.
room: Hall No. 3 First Floor - Session Hall 4
speakers:
Sh. Jayant Chaudhary,
Hon'ble MoS MoE &
MSDE; Sh. T G Sitharam,
India Co-Chair Human
Capital Working
Group & Former
Chairman, AICTE; Sh. Voruganti Aravind, CEO - 1Works & Executive Director - Conch Deep Tech, Venture Studio; Sh. Dayal Mukati, CTO
- 1Works & Conch Deep
Tech Venture Studio; Sh. Sairam
Santharam - CISO , Avancer
Corporation
(USA); Sh. Rakesh
Asthana- Former
Commissioner
of Police,
Delhi, Former CBI ; Sh. Vivek
Kumar Yadav- Director (IT &
Cybersecurity),  Ministry of
Defence, GoI; Sh. Aditya
Narayan Singh
Deo - Co-Founder , Elevate EX; Sh. Vijaibarath GM -
Cybersecurity, Tata Agratas; Sh. Sandip - 
Ghosh Publisher, Outlook Magazine; Sh. Sunil
Bajpai (Ex
IRSME) - Chief Trust
Officer, Tanla Platforms; Sh. Sunil
Gupta - Co-Founder &
CEO , Yotta Data
Services; Sh. Narayanan
Rajagopalan - Founder &
CEO, Kavach
Healthcare; Sh. Raghunandan
(Ex ITS) - Former Secretary,
TRAI | Professor of Practice, IIT
Hyderabad; Sh. Yogesh
Kochhar - Education Futurist &
Author, YOL; Sh. Anju De Alwis  - Co-Founder, Ultimate Access Education ; Sh. Vivek Chadda, Founder & Author, AcceleratorX Ventures & Startupology; Sh. Dr Ashok Kumar Gadiya, Chairman, Mewar University; Sh. Usha Batra, Director R&D, Chair Person Skill Department, Sri Vishwakarma
Skill University, India's First Skill University
summary_one_liner: From routine work to cognitive capital: India's AI-driven workforce transformation strategy
icebreaker: Ask Jayant Chaudhary (MoS) how India plans to reskill 50M+ workers for AI roles.
networking_tip: AICTE and Ministry contacts here—essential for education-tech and workforce startups.

title: Industrial AI Challenges: From World's Next Industrial-Tech Innovation Hub
description: This session will explore how AI is being applied to solve complex industrial challenges and how the global innovation hub in Dhahran can foster collaboration between industry leaders, startups, investors, and academia. Discussion will highlight the vision for open innovation, large-scale deployment of AI in industrial settings, and opportunities for global entrepreneurs and technology companies to contribute transformative solutions for real-world industrial problems.
speakers: Aysar Tayeb, Aramco; Dr. Ammar A. Al Nahwi, Aramco; Krishnan Raman, Accenture Technology
summary_one_liner: Aramco-led industrial AI innovation hub bridging startups, academia, and enterprise deployment
icebreaker: Ask Aysar Tayeb (Aramco) which industrial use cases are highest ROI for AI pilots.
networking_tip: Fortune 500 energy exec + Accenture—strong B2B enterprise sales opportunities.

title: Beyond the Cloud: The Sovereign AI Moment
description: While much of the world defaults to cloud-hosted AI, a growing cohort of  enterprises and public sector institutions are charting a different course — deploying powerful AI models on their own infrastructure, on their own terms.
speakers: Bernard Nguyen, Nvidia; Mr.Abhinav Aggarwal, Fluid AI; Mr.Balasubramanian V, NABARD; Mr.Raghav Aggarwal, Fluid AI; Mr.Ritwik Rath, HPCL
summary_one_liner: On-premise sovereign AI: enterprises and institutions reclaim control from cloud providers
icebreaker: Ask Bernard Nguyen (Nvidia) how enterprises justify sovereign AI capex vs. cloud OpEx.
networking_tip: HPCL + NABARD = public-sector infrastructure clients—ideal for sovereign AI sales pipeline.

title: Navigating the AI Regulatory Landscape: A Cross-Compliance Framework for Safety and Governance
description: This session examines the evolving AI regulatory landscape through a cross-compliance lens, comparing various national frameworks for data governance, safety, and accountability. It highlights practical approaches to implementing trustworthy, safe AI, drawing on large-scale project experience. The discussion aims to support policymakers, practitioners, and institutions in aligning innovation with regulatory compliance, ethical standards, and responsible AI governance across jurisdictions.
speakers: Aarthi Sivanandha, AZB & Partners; Dr. Lalit Patil, International Neurodegenerative Disorders Research Center (INDRC)  "; Dr. Mohammed Misbahuddin, C-DAC Bangalore; Dr. S. D. Sudarsan, C-DAC Bangalore; Dr. Vit Dockal, International Development Research Centre (INDRC), Czech Republic; Mr. Ramesh Naidu Laveti, C-DAC Bangalore
summary_one_liner: Cross-national AI regulatory frameworks for safety and accountability
icebreaker: Ask Aarthi Sivanandha about AZB's approach to navigating India's evolving AI compliance requirements versus global standards.
networking_tip: Connect with C-DAC researchers on implementing trustworthy AI—they bridge policy and technical execution.

title: Shaping Resilient Futures in the Age of AI: Leadership for the Technology, Energy, and Security Transitions
description: The ability of countries, regions, and alliances to thrive amid geopolitical volatility and systemic shocks depends on aligning three domains: AI and strategic technologies, diversified low-carbon energy systems, and modernised security capabilities. Rather than advancing in isolation, these pillars must progress together, at speed and scale, to strengthen economic and societal resilience. This discussion explores the "triple transition," outlining practical pathways to navigate it while promoting cooperation, accountability, and public trust globally.
speakers: Deepak Bagla, Atal Innovation Mission, NITI Aayog; Deepak Bagla, Atal Innovation Mission, NITI Aayog; Harsh Vardhan Shringla, Rajya Sabha, India; Harsh Vardhan Shringla, Rajya Sabha; Sarith Felber, Ministry of Justice, Israel; Shyam Krishnakumar, The Pranava Institute; Tanya Filer, StateUp
summary_one_liner: Aligning AI, energy, and security transitions for national resilience
icebreaker: Ask Harsh Vardhan Shringla about Rajya Sabha's vision for coordinating AI and energy security at the regional level.
networking_tip: Deepak Bagla from NITI Aayog sets India's AI innovation agenda—pitch sovereign tech solutions strategically.

title: Building Trust in the Age of Synthetic Media
description: This session will convene a policy dialogue at the India AI Impact Summit 2026 on the role of content provenance in enabling safe and trusted AI. As synthetic media scales, provenance mechanisms can support transparency, accountability, and trust. The discussion will situate provenance within AI governance and digital public infrastructure frameworks, explore standards-based approaches to address mis- and disinformation while protecting privacy and free expression, and examine practical implementation pathways and public–private collaboration.
speakers: Andrew Jenks, Microsoft; Andy Parsons, Adobe; Deepak Goel, Ministry of Electronics & IT, GoI; Gail Kent, Google; John Miller, Information Technology Industry Council; Sameer Boray, Information Technology Industry Council
summary_one_liner: Content provenance frameworks for trustworthy synthetic media governance
icebreaker: Ask Deepak Goel how India's Ministry of Electronics & IT plans to embed provenance standards in synthetic media regulation.
networking_tip: Microsoft, Adobe, and Google represent the tech side—explore partnership opportunities on provenance infrastructure.

title: Generative AI and Future Networks
room: Hall No. 4 First Floor - Session Hall 2
summary_one_liner: Next-generation networks powered by generative AI capabilities
icebreaker: Connect with fellow engineers on how generative models optimize network performance and resource allocation.
networking_tip: Ask speakers about infrastructure bottlenecks—common pain points reveal partnership opportunities.

title: Beyond the Cloud: The Sovereign AI Moment
description: While much of the world defaults to cloud-hosted AI, a growing cohort of  enterprises and public sector institutions are charting a different course — deploying powerful AI models on their own infrastructure, on their own terms.
speakers: Bernard Nguyen, Nvidia; Mr.Abhinav Aggarwal, Fluid AI; Mr.Balasubramanian V, NABARD; Mr.Raghav Aggarwal, Fluid AI; Mr.Ritwik Rath, HPCL
summary_one_liner: On-premise AI infrastructure for sovereign and enterprise autonomy
icebreaker: Ask Bernard Nguyen (Nvidia) and Fluid AI founders about the enterprise economics of on-premise vs. cloud AI.
networking_tip: NABARD and HPCL represent public sector buyers—pitch sovereign infrastructure solutions to decision-makers.

title: AGI for Bharat: Sovereignty, Security, and Societal Transformation
room: Hall No. 4 First Floor - Session Hall 3
speakers:
Air Vice Marshal (Dr) 
; Devesh Vatsa VSM (Retd), Advisor, DSCI NASSCOM; 
Shri Arvind Gupta        Director, VIF

; Mrs Hemavathy, GM, Network & Cyber Security SBU
; Dr N Ranjana, Director, Future Technology Management, DRDO
; Dr Mohit Saxena, Infinity Labs
; Dr Jaijit Bhattacharya, Founder & President, Centre for Digital Economy
; Wg Cdr S Sudhakaran (Retd), CEO, QuGates Technologies
; Ms Ritu Advani, Director, QuGates Technologies
summary_one_liner: AGI development aligned with India's sovereignty, security, and societal goals
icebreaker: Ask VIF Director Arvind Gupta about India's strategic framework for AGI development amid geopolitical competition.
networking_tip: Defense and cybersecurity leaders present—position solutions as national security multipliers.

title: Co-Creating the MedTech Frontier: Ecosystem Innovation toward AI-Enabled Health for all
description: AI-enabled MedTech is expanding inclusive access, enabling preventive care, and improving efficiency, making healthcare more, inclusive affordable and scalable. As India emerges as a key MedTech innovation hub, a supportive ecosystem and strong collaboration across government, industry, and innovators are essential to overcome product development and market barriers, particularly in low- and middle-income countries. The panel will explore AI approaches in India's MedTech sector and pathways to accelerate productisation and scale.
speakers: Dr Prashant Nag, TATA 1mg; Dr T. Thangaradjou, ANRF; Dr Taruna Madan Gupta, Development Research Division, Indian Council of Medical Research (ICMR); Dr Vibhav Garg, Meril; Mr Christian Wickert, Merck KGaA; Mr Gaurav Agarwal, Innvolution Healthcare Pvt Ltd; Mr Kinjal Saxena, AIG Hospitals
summary_one_liner: AI-enabled MedTech innovation for accessible, scalable healthcare
icebreaker: Ask Dr. Prashant Nag (TATA 1mg) how AI improves diagnosis accuracy and access in India's underserved regions.
networking_tip: ICMR and Meril bridge research and commercialization—partner early on clinical validation.

title: Advancing AI Transparency in Practice
description: This discussion will examine how national and regional policies can align around shared expectations for transparency, safety and accountability. Anchored in the Hiroshima AI reporting framework, it will explore how reporting practices, risk disclosures and voluntary mechanisms — including assurance mechanisms and public–private collaboration — can complement national policies by accelerating learning, supporting innovation and strengthening trust.
speakers: Ashish Tewari, Infosys; Karine  Perset, OECD; Melika Caroll, Global Government Affairs and Public Policy; Natasha Crampton, Microsoft; Yoichi Iida, Ministry of Internal Affairs and Communications, Japan
summary_one_liner: Aligning global AI transparency standards and accountability reporting frameworks
icebreaker: Ask Karine Perset (OECD) how the Hiroshima framework bridges US, EU, and India's divergent transparency expectations.
networking_tip: OECD and Japanese government officials set global standards—align compliance early with international peers.

title: Navigating the AI Regulatory Landscape: A Cross-Compliance Framework for Safety and Governance
description: This session examines the evolving AI regulatory landscape through a cross-compliance lens, comparing various national frameworks for data governance, safety, and accountability. It highlights practical approaches to implementing trustworthy, safe AI, drawing on large-scale project experience. The discussion aims to support policymakers, practitioners, and institutions in aligning innovation with regulatory compliance, ethical standards, and responsible AI governance across jurisdictions.
speakers: Aarthi Sivanandha, AZB & Partners; Dr. Lalit Patil, International Neurodegenerative Disorders Research Center (INDRC)  "; Dr. Mohammed Misbahuddin, C-DAC Bangalore; Dr. S. D. Sudarsan, C-DAC Bangalore; Dr. Vit Dockal, International Development Research Centre (INDRC), Czech Republic; Mr. Ramesh Naidu Laveti, C-DAC Bangalore
summary_one_liner: Navigate global AI regulatory frameworks and safety governance compliance
icebreaker: Ask Aarthi Sivanandha how AZB & Partners approaches multi-jurisdictional AI compliance strategies.
networking_tip: Connect with C-DAC researchers on government AI infrastructure projects post-session.

title: Cybersecurity Strategy in Era of AI
description: As digital infrastructure drives the global economy, cybercrime costs reach $10.5 trillion annually in 2025, with AI-assisted attacks surging 72%. This panel examines AI-powered defence mechanisms—predictive threat detection, automated response, and machine learning-based assessment—as essential countermeasures. Industry and government leaders will discover strategies for implementing next-generation architectures leveraging AI systems that detect threats faster and reduce breach costs, securing critical infrastructure against evolving cyber threats.
speakers: Dr Huzur Saran; Dr Sanjay Bahl; Dr Srikanta Bedathur; Dr. Gaurav Gupta MeITY; Mohit Joshi; Rajat Maheshwari
summary_one_liner: Mastercard and MeitY tackle AI-powered cybersecurity against trillion-dollar threats
icebreaker: Ask Mohit Joshi or Dr. Srikanta Bedathur: what's the #1 AI-assisted attack vector keeping your CISO team up at night?
networking_tip: High executive density (CISOs + enterprise leads). Sponsor or attend the VIP track if available—CISOs are time-poor and gravitate toward curated networking.

title: AI-DPI Experimentation and the Role of Sandboxes
description: This session explores how sandboxes can support safe, accountable, and trustworthy AI adoption in DPI systems. Through presentations and panel discussion, participants will engage with practitioners to examine challenges and complexities introduced by AI-enabled capabilities in DPI. The conversation will focus on how sandboxes provide controlled settings to test new technologies while fostering trust through diverse stakeholder involvement. Participants will leave with practical governance insights and design principles for building inclusive and scalable AI-powered DPI.
speakers: Alexandru Oprunenco; Dr. Nkundwe Moses Mwasaga; Dr. Verena Kontschieder; Kavita Bhatia; Lorrayne Porciuncula; Morine Amutorine; Sushant Kumar
summary_one_liner: Sandboxes enabling safe, trustworthy AI testing within digital public infrastructure
icebreaker: How is your organization using sandboxes to test AI in DPI without breaking compliance?
networking_tip: During the panel, sit near Dr. Mwasaga or Kavita Bhatia—regulators and practitioners who make hiring decisions cluster there.

title: Global AI Assurance and Standards: From Principles to Proof
description: This session brings together leaders from policy, industry, and certification bodies to explore how AI assurance is shaping governance and practice. It will spotlight key practical standards, real-world adoption across sectors, India's strategic role in quality infrastructure, and UK-India collaboration on standards, skills, and market access to build trust and responsible AI globally.
speakers: Bindya S RaJ; Carsten Maple; Natasha Crampton; Raj Bharat Patel; Sue Daley OBE; Tim Mcgarr
summary_one_liner: UK-India alliance setting global AI assurance standards and certification
icebreaker: Carsten Maple, what's the one AI standard your team wishes enterprises would actually implement first?
networking_tip: High decision-maker density means skip the general reception—target Compliance Officers during the certification bodies' presentation.

title: AI in Governance: Revolutionising Government Efficiency
description: As governments increasingly apply AI tools, how can evidence guide their use towards effective and equitable public service delivery of targeted schemes? This session, featuring a researcher presentation followed by a panel discussion with experts, highlights findings from a randomised study that tested whether machine learning can improve the targeting of social services. Building on these results, the participants will learn how rigorous evidence can help adopt AI to strengthen state capacity and broaden political participation.
speakers: Dean Karlan, Northwestern University & former Chief Economist of USAID; Kapil Viswanathan, IFMR; Mohammed Y. Safirulla, IndiaAI Mission, MeitY; Utkarsh Saxena, Adalat AI
summary_one_liner: Randomized evidence on machine learning improving social service targeting
icebreaker: Dean Karlan, what's the biggest barrier to randomized evaluation of AI targeting in social services?
networking_tip: High decision-maker density: focus on the Q&A after Utkarsh Saxena's presentation where public sector CIOs ask direct questions.

title: AI Masterclass in Financial Services
description: This immersive session will highlight how AI is transforming the BFSI landscape, both in India and globally. In this masterclass specially curated for professionals in financial services, Tata Consultancy Services will equip participants with practical strategies for implementing AI, including outcome-driven design and guidance on scaling AI safely, within regulatory standards. Attendees will also gain hands-on experience with advanced AI technologies, such as Voice-AI and domain-adapted models, while addressing real-world challenges.
speakers: Babu Unnikrishnan, Tata Consultancy Services
summary_one_liner: TCS masterclass on hands-on AI implementation for financial services
icebreaker: Babu, which TCS Voice AI implementation in BFSI are you most excited about expanding?
networking_tip: Masterclass format means one speaker—arrive 15 min early, stay through the breakout room for direct access to banking CIOs.

title: Democratizing AI Resources: Research Pathways to Open, Equitable Access
description: The session examines how to democratise AI across India's social and economic landscape so that people, communities, industry, and government benefit safely. It promotes a platform approach beyond models, offering shared building blocks for data, compute, skills, evaluation, and trusted deployment. Discussion covers privacy-preserving data collaboration, India-ready multilingual benchmarks, cost-efficient optimisation, and responsible, auditable architectures with policy controls, centring human-AI collaboration for judgment, empathy, intent, and accountability across sectors and diverse populations.
speakers: Mr. Arun Jain, Intellect Design Arena Ltd.; Mr. Jaswinder Sodhi, HSBC India; Smt. Sandhya Arun, Wipro Ltd
summary_one_liner: Platform approach to democratize AI with shared data, compute, and skills
icebreaker: Ask Smt. Sandhya Arun how Wipro democratizes AI beyond enterprise deployments.
networking_tip: Identify organizations scaling AI access—they hire talent and fund research.

title: Women in Climate and AI - Bridging the Gender Gap in Innovation
description: The objective of this panel is to highlight the importance of gender and it's necessity as the core for climate success. This session will focus on two priorities: changing the big systems (how money and rules work) and valuing local expertise (how women's hands-on knowledge makes AI smarter).
speakers: Jui Joshi, CCF; Ms. Pooja Kini, Salesforce; Samhita R, Resilience AI; Shalabh Tandon, IFC South Asia; Vaishali Nigam Sinha, Renew Foundation; Vrushali Gaud, Google
summary_one_liner: Women's expertise driving smarter climate AI and equitable green finance
icebreaker: Pooja Kini, what's the biggest misconception about women's role in climate AI innovation?
networking_tip: Lower decision-maker density but high passion—skip formal networking, attend the women's breakout dinner for deeper connections.

title: Countering Disinformation Warfare and Building Resilient Societies in an Era of AI
description: This session will examine the growing impact of AI-driven synthetic media on democratic stability and national security. Experts will analyze how deepfakes and automated propaganda are used as tools for narrative warfare in the modern era. The panel will discuss the difficult balance between implementing government regulations and protecting the right to free speech. Attendees will learn about practical solutions for building societal resilience, including the development of new fact-checking technologies and institutional defenses.
speakers: Achina Mayya, AEOS Group & Aevy TV; Mr. Aditya Raj Kaul, NDTV 24x7; Pathikrit Payne, Dr. Syama Prasad Mookerjee Research Foundation (SPMRF); Shri Jitin Prasada, Electronics & IT, GoI
summary_one_liner: Combating deepfakes and AI propaganda to protect democratic stability
icebreaker: Shri Jitin Prasada on deepfakes as weapons—what's your biggest concern for democratic institutions right now?
networking_tip: Security and policy folks dominate; sit with media trust leads to unlock cross-sector disinformation insights.

title: AI for Health Innovations
description: This panel will bring together leaders from healthcare, technology, research, and innovation ecosystems to discuss how Artificial Intelligence is transforming health innovation. The discussion will explore AI-driven solutions across diagnostics, medical devices, public health, clinical decision-making, and health systems strengthening, with a strong focus on real world deployment, scalability, ethics, and regulation in emerging markets like India.
speakers: Dr. Ajay Bakshi, NeuranceAI; Dr. Dileep Raman, Cloud  Physician; Dr. Himanshu Tyagi, Sentient; Dr. Taruna Madan Gupta, Indian Council of Medical Research; Mr. Karthik Adapa, IAS, WHO; Mr. Sandeep Nailwal, Polygon Foundation and  Founder Blockchain For Impact BFI
summary_one_liner: AI-driven diagnostics and health systems scaling across emerging markets
icebreaker: Dr. Ajay Bakshi's AI diagnostics work—are you building clinical validation into your healthtech roadmap?
networking_tip: MedTech investors cluster near IAS officers post-panel. Exchange contact info during the Q&A for warm intros.

title: People's AI: Designing a Future Where Everyone Belongs
description: This session explores what it takes to make AI genuinely inclusive and scalable in practice. It would examine how access to skills, recognition of diverse talent, inclusive employment models, citizen-centric policy, and cultural participation together shape AI systems that serve society.
speakers: Lakshmi Pratury, INK Global Foundation; Madhukar Yarra, NextWealth; Ravishankar Gundlapalli, MentorCloud; Rhea Mazumdar Singhal, The Udaiti Foundation, and  Founder, Ecoware; Yash Dongre, House of Anita Dongre
summary_one_liner: Building genuinely inclusive AI through diverse talent and citizen-centric design
icebreaker: Ask Lakshmi Pratury what INK Global Foundation learned about inclusive AI talent pipelines.
networking_tip: Connect with skill-building organizations—they identify future AI leaders early.

title: Digital Public Goods for Global AI Equity
description: This session examines the role of Digital Public Goods (DPGs) in advancing global AI equity, aligned with the AI Impact Summit 2026 focus on inclusive and responsible AI. As AI accelerates, access to AI resources and capabilities is becoming an important public-policy consideration. The discussion explores how open data and open-source tools enable context-sensitive AI ecosystems, drawing on relevant initiatives to identify pathways for expanding access to AI.
