title: AI for All in South Asia: Leveraging India's Digital Public Infrastructure for Inclusive Growth
description: This session explores how India's AI leadership can move beyond innovation to deliver inclusive social-economic outcomes across South Asia by replicating India's digital public infrastructure, enterprise AI adoption, startup ecosystem through cross-border collaboration and knowledge sharing. It positions AI for All as scalable, impact-first, commercially viable business model for 1.4 billion people, driven by frugal AI solutions for basic smartphones, local languages, low-connectivity networks, catalyzing financial inclusion, healthcare access, skills development, rural productivity, regional social empowerment.
speakers: Mr. Aditya Swam; Mr. Akhil Choudhary; Mr. Amith Singhee; Mr. Clas Neumann; Mr. Gautam Aggarwal; Mr. Karthik Rajaram; Mr. Narendra Singh Yadav; Mr. Piyush Saxena; Mr. Satinder Pal Singh; Mr. Sunil Abraham
knowledge_partners: The Associated Chambers of Commerce & Industry of India (ASSOCHAM)
summary_one_liner: ASSOCHAM positions India's DPI as a replicable AI-for-all model across South Asia
icebreaker: Karthik, which DPI playbook is most replicable for South Asia market founders?
networking_tip: ASSOCHAM members and DPI architects are here—focus on market strategy conversations during networking breaks.

title: AI for Societal Good: Global Nonprofit Innovations
description: Join leaders from social impact focused AI initiatives to explore how AI is redesigning global systems. Moving beyond theory, this session spotlights evidence-based nonprofit models advancing equity and justice. Attendees will gain actionable insights into funding and scaling community-centered AI that prioritizes human dignity over automation. This session explores the cross-sector collaborations necessary to build a responsible, high-impact AI future for philanthropists and technologists alike.
speakers: MR. Rangaswami; Mr. Utkarsh Saxena; Mr. Vilas Dhar
summary_one_liner: Indiaspora spotlights scalable nonprofit AI models for equity and justice
icebreaker: Vilas, how are you evaluating equity in nonprofit AI models before scaling?
networking_tip: Philanthropy directors control funding—ask about grant opportunities and portfolio companies during Q&A wrap-up.

title: Decoded: How AI Is Reshaping Work for Women
description: This panel will examine the intersection of AI, gender, and the future of work, within evolving digital economies. The discussion will explore gendered impacts of AI while highlighting design, governance, and workforce strategies that consider women's lived experiences and inform policy-relevant pathways toward inclusive, AI-enabled growth. Building on emerging insights from skilling initiatives, the session will focus on identifying pathways where AI can expand decent work and economic security for women at scale.
speakers: Atul Satija; Dr. M M Tripathi; Jona Repishti; Mythily Ramesh; Sharon Buteau
knowledge_partners: GxD hub, LEAD at Krea University
summary_one_liner: Krea University panel decodes how AI can expand decent work for women
icebreaker: Mythily, what design principle for AI tools matters most for women's workforce outcomes?
networking_tip: Gender advocates and CHROs attend—exchange skilling platform ideas and policy approaches over lunch.

title: AI in Education: Customising Learning for All
description: How can we use AI tools to improve educational outcomes? This session, featuring a presentation by an international researcher followed by a panel discussion with experts, showcases results from a UNESCO prize winning randomised study in Brazil evaluating the impact of an AI-powered essay-grader on students' writing outcomes. Eminent panelists, including a Yidan-laureate, will discuss how evidence can guide the use of AI into tailored instruction, parent engagement, and high-impact educational practices to strengthen learning systems and improve student outcomes.
speakers: Azeez Gupta; Brigitte Hoyer Gosselink; Marguerite Clarke; Namya Mahajan; Rukmini Banerji; Samantha Carter; Thiago Rached
summary_one_liner: UNESCO-winning RCT shows AI essay grading transforms student writing outcomes
icebreaker: Rukmini, what did the J-PAL RCT reveal about personalized AI tutoring at scale?
networking_tip: Education researchers cluster here—ask Brigitte about UNESCO prize implementation for founder connections.

title: AI for All: Building India's Future-Ready Human Capital from School to Workforce
description: To examine scalable, inclusive, and policy-aligned models for early-age AI education, and to demonstrate how structured initiatives can serve as national pipelines linking school education with higher education, innovation ecosystems, and workforce readiness.
speakers: Dr. Mandar Karyakarte; M/s Neha Sharma; Mr. Vivek Varshney; Prof. Anil D. Sahasrabudhe; Prof. Mukul S Sutaone; Prof. Om Prakash Vyas
knowledge_partners: Indian Institute Of Information Technology Allahabad
summary_one_liner: Former AICTE chief designs India's school-to-workforce AI education pipeline
icebreaker: Prof. Sahasrabudhe, how does IIIT's school-to-workforce pipeline avoid AI skilling gaps?
networking_tip: NEP teams and K-12 designers attend—propose curriculum collaboration during the workforce panel discussion.

title: Democratizing AI Resources Equitable Access to Compute and Data for Entrepreneurship
description: Democratizing AI Resources Equitable Access to Compute and Data for Entrepreneurship - Panel discussion and Discussion
speakers: Amit Srivastava; Animesh Aaryan; Nitin Seth
summary_one_liner: IIM Lucknow tackles equitable compute and data access for AI entrepreneurs
icebreaker: Amit, what's the biggest bottleneck you see for AI founders accessing compute resources?
networking_tip: Target compute infra providers during breaks—they're decision-makers with budget for early-stage founders.

title: Metrics, Methods and Platforms for Measurement of Artificial Intelligence for Trustworthy, Reliable and Explainable Applications
description: The session will focus on Metrics, Methods and Platforms for Measurement of Artificial Intelligence for Trustworthy, Reliable (Safe & Secure) and Explainable Applications covering major areas including Healthcare, Manufacturing, Mobility / Transportation and Governance, as well as cross-sectoral issues. A goal will be to highlight how to translate theory into real Trustworthy AI applications.
speakers: Amlan Chakrabarti; Carsten Maple; Debdeep Mukhopadhyay; Kavita Bhatia; Lipika Dey; Mainack Mondal; Mayank Vatsa; Partha Pratim Chakrabarti; Partha Pratim Das; Richa Singh
summary_one_liner: IIT Kharagpur presents metrics and benchmarks for trustworthy, explainable AI
icebreaker: With so many metrics for trustworthy AI, which one does Mayank Vatsa think matters most for real-world deployment?
networking_tip: Arrive early to connect with IIT faculty—they set research agendas and fund safety-focused projects.

title: Putting AI to Work: Solving the Productivity Challenge through Faster Adoption
description: As AI transforms economies and societies worldwide, governments are racing to develop frameworks that harness its potential. This panel brings together government leaders, industry, and startups to share real-world case studies of national AI strategies and AI adoption: what has worked, what has stalled, and why. The discussion will explore policy insights and lessons on meeting the adoption challenge, examining how regulatory environments act as both enablers and barriers to innovation as AI moves rapidly.
speakers: David Zapolsky; Kanishka Narayan; Kevin Allison; Shubhii Agarawal
summary_one_liner: Global case studies reveal what accelerates and what stalls national AI adoption
icebreaker: David Zapolsky, what's the biggest adoption barrier you're seeing in government transformation right now?
networking_tip: Focus on enterprise transformation officers during Q&A—they control procurement budgets and deployment timelines.

title: India Future Skills and AI Collaborative Roundtable: Building Workforces, Capacities, and Institutional Readiness
description: This strategic session advances the IndiaAI Mission's vision of AI for People, Planet, and Prosperity through inclusive, human-centered implementation. Built on two years of engagement, pilots, and practitioner insights, it converts intent into impact via commitments, scalable models, and partnerships. The discussion will focus on AI workforce readiness, large-scale faculty capacity building, and institutional readiness to integrate AI systems, infrastructure, and governance.
speakers: Antara Lahiri; Bhomik Shah; Hemant Lohiya; Kumar Anurag Pratap; Parminder Singh Kakria; Pratima Harite; Shipra Sharma
summary_one_liner: IndiaAI Mission roundtable converts skilling pilots into scalable workforce models
icebreaker: How is the IndiaAI Mission helping CSR heads build sustainable AI capacity in their communities?
networking_tip: Network with CSR heads and faculty leaders—they control funding for institutional AI readiness programs.

title: Empowering the Next Generation of Entrepreneurs in Asia and India through AI
description: The session positions AI as core entrepreneurial infrastructure powering the next generation of founders across Asia and India. It will open with strategic context on cross-border execution and talent mobility. The discussion will then highlight how AI talent becomes execution-ready through workcation and immersion models, alongside real startup and MSME impact cases. It will conclude with key insights, defined stakeholder roles, and clear pathways for post-summit ecosystem collaboration.
speakers: Dr Mukesh Kestwal; Dr Pushpendra Singh; Dr Radhika Trikha; JaeKyeong Lee; Prof Rajeev Ahuja; Shri Kamal Kishor (K.K.) Yadav, IAS; Shri Sanjeev Arora; Taehyung Lee; Youngseung Woo
summary_one_liner: India-Korea startup bridge builds cross-border AI entrepreneurship pipelines
icebreaker: Shri Kamal Kishor, how is India positioning itself for cross-border AI startup execution?
networking_tip: IAS innovation officers and Korea-India business network members are here—pitch your cross-border vision early.

title: Solving for India at Scale: Use of AI in Fintech
description: A 60-minute strategy-focused session on how India's largest fintech companies use AI to broaden financial access while designing for trust (security + privacy) and optimizing for India's diversity, user convenience and economic growth.
speakers: Gautham Krishnamurthy; Santanu Sinha
summary_one_liner: India's fintech giants use AI to scale financial inclusion
icebreaker: Gautham, how do India's fintech leaders balance AI scale with privacy in payments infrastructure?
networking_tip: Approach Series B+ founders and regulators during breaks—they make vendor/partnership decisions for fintech stacks.

title: Campus-to-Impact: Building India's AI Innovation Pipeline
description: It is a solution-oriented panel discussion addressing the democratization of AI innovation across India's academic landscape, with emphasis on Tier-2/3 institutions. Through structured dialogue featuring leaders from academia, industry, government, and international ecosystems, the session identifies scalable collaboration models, documents key challenges, and generates actionable policy recommendations. Live demonstrations by TMIF-incubated startups showcase successful campus-to-market journeys, highlighting how academic institutions can effectively contribute to India's AI innovation pipeline and create tangible real-world impact.
speakers: Dr. Kavita Singh; Dr. Nikhil Agarwal; Mr. Akshat Jain; Mr. Utkarsh Mishra; Ms. Maya Sherman; Prof. (Dr.) Manjula Jain
summary_one_liner: Democratizing AI innovation from Tier-2/3 campuses to market
icebreaker: Dr. Kavita Singh, what's blocking Tier-2/3 institutions from building real campus AI startups?
networking_tip: Connect with university deans and incubator managers first—they hire talent and allocate innovation budgets.

title: Teaching and Learning AI Policy: Practice and Impact
description: This workshop will bring together participants engaged in AI policy education in its broadest sense, including extra-curricular initiatives, professional development courses, lifelong learning opportunities, and formal programmes on AI policy and governance. It will examine how AI policy education can influence wider AI developments, foster critical AI literacy, highlight effective practices with demonstrable impact, and identify ways to democratise AI resources by engaging a wider range of people and organisations. The workshop will also be interactive.
speakers: Dr Emma Jones; Dr. Preeti Raghunath
summary_one_liner: How AI policy education shapes responsible AI development globally
icebreaker: Dr. Emma Jones, how are you designing AI policy education for non-technical audiences who need it most?
networking_tip: This is intimate—talk directly with policy educators and curriculum designers about co-creating programs.

title: From Policy to Harvest: Leveraging Generative AI for Data-Driven Agricultural Transformation
description: The session will bring together experts to spotlight India's next-generation digital agriculture infrastructure and examine how Generative AI can translate policy intent into on-ground agricultural productivity, resilience, and sustainability. The discussion will focus on the role of AI in enabling precision farming, improving crop forecasting, enhancing climate risk modelling, optimising supply chains, and strengthening farmer advisory services through real-time, data-driven insights.
speakers: Mr. Anand Chandra; Mr. Hemant Seth; Mr. Hemendra Mathur; Mr. Navneet Ravikar; Mr. Simon Wiebusch; Mr.Maulik Bhansali; Ms. Elisabeth Faure
summary_one_liner: Generative AI transforms India's agriculture from policy to field
icebreaker: Simon Wiebusch, what's the real ROI of generative AI on-farm vs. in supply chain optimization?
networking_tip: Climate tech investors and agritech founders are concentrated here—pitch impact metrics and unit economics early.

title: Multi-Stakeholder Collaboration to Foster AI Adoption in the Global South
description: This session explores the practical and governance dimensions of Responsible AI, focusing on how multi-stakeholder collaboration can accelerate its responsible and inclusive adoption across the Global South. It will highlight actionable frameworks for public-private partnerships, capacity building, ethical governance, and equitable access to AI. Bringing together policymakers, practitioners, researchers, and experts, the session will examine real-world challenges and demonstrate how to implement Responsible AI across critical sectors such as healthcare, education, finance, and law.
speakers: Aisha Walcott-Bryant; Dame Wendy Hall; Vukosi Marivate
knowledge_partners: Centre for Responsible AI (CeRAI), IIT Madras
summary_one_liner: Building responsible AI partnerships for Global South adoption
icebreaker: Dame Wendy Hall, what does responsible AI adoption actually look like in the Global South?
networking_tip: Policy makers and international development leaders drive funding—engage them early with concrete Global South use cases.

title: Stacked for Scale: The Future of AI Compute, Semiconductors, and Foundational AI
description: While the global conversation focuses on software and applications, the India AI Mission has prioritized physical infrastructure required to power it. This session aims to bridge the gap between startups building at the frontier and infrastructure development. The conversation will include discussion on how India is building a "full-stack" future, including compute roadmap, how the ISM is strengthening the supply chain for the next generation of AI-first startups, and importance of compute capacity and semiconductors.
speakers: ⁠Amitesh Sinha; Dheemanth Nagaraj; Navin Bishnoi; Preetam Tadeparthy; Rajan Anandan
summary_one_liner: India's full-stack AI infrastructure: compute, chips, and foundations
icebreaker: Amitesh, what's the biggest bottleneck you're seeing in India's semiconductor supply chain for AI?
networking_tip: Infrastructure investors cluster here—position yourself near speaker area post-session for 1-on-1s with CTOs.

title: Indo-Canadian Symposium on AI for Food, Energy and Health Sectors
description: Around the world, companies and universities are racing to develop large Foundation AI models tailored to these sectors. This session will focus on a series of talks on the application AI for food, energy and health, followed by discussion to arrive at summary points for sharing with the organizers. Focus points will be on driving advancements in forecasting and logistics, boosting efficiency and automation, and enhancing product quality across the entire value chain.
speakers: Dr. Baljit Singh; Dr. Debi Prasad; Dr. Mukesh Saini; Dr. Rajeev Ahuja; Dr. Steve Shirtliffe; Prof. Ajay Kumar Dalai; Prof. Suman Kumar
summary_one_liner: Indo-Canadian AI collaboration across food, energy, and health
icebreaker: Which sector's AI readiness surprised you most—food, energy, or health?
networking_tip: Multi-country attendance means bilateral partnerships form easily. Grab lunch with researchers from your target sector.

title: Building AI Readiness and Digital Competency Among Frontline Health Workers in India
description: This interactive workshop brings together public health leaders to build consensus on measuring digital access, use, and skills among frontline health workers. Participants will explore AI readiness frameworks, co-design skill metrics for frontline health workers and healthcare providers, and evaluate assessment methods. The session concludes with practical recommendations for scalable, context-aware digital skills measurement across regional and national health workforces.
speakers: Dr Valerie Jean Laloo, MBBS, MD; Dr. Amnesty LeFevre, PhD MHS; Dr. Diwakar Mohan, PhD MPH MD MBBS; Dr. Karthik Adapa, IAS; Dr. Marbabiang Syiemlieh, PhD, Gender Studies & Social Work; Dr. Mayank Date, MPH BDS; Dr. Nayanjeet Chaudhury, MBBS MD MPH; Dr. Osama Ummer MPH BAMS; Dr. Sampath Kumar, IAS; Mebanialam Tang, MA
summary_one_liner: Skilling India's frontline health workers for AI-era readiness
icebreaker: Dr. Diwakar, how are you measuring digital competency gaps among frontline workers?
networking_tip: Government officials and NGO leaders attending—exchange contacts during Q&A. They hire and fund heavily.

title: Opening Ceremony of Research Symposium
speakers: Kavita Bhatia, Chief Operating Officer, IndiaAI Mission, Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology (MeitY); S. Krishnan, Secretary, Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology; Jitin Prasada, Minister of State for Electronics and Information Technology, Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology; Ashwini Vaishnaw, Minister for Electronics and Information Technology, Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology; H.E. Mr. Alar Karis, President of Estonia; P. J. Narayanan, Professor and Former Director, International Institute of Information Technology Hyderabad (IIITH)
summary_one_liner: Official launch of national AI research symposium with government leadership
icebreaker: Discuss S. Krishnan's vision for India's position in global AI research
networking_tip: Arrive early to meet ministry officials and fellow researchers during reception

title: Keynote for Research Symposium by Sir Demis Hassabis (CEO & Co-Founder, Google DeepMind)
speakers: Sir Demis Hassabis, CEO and Co-Founder, Google DeepMind; Balaraman Ravindaran, Head, Department of Data Science and AI (Moderator), IIT Madras
summary_one_liner: Demis Hassabis keynote on frontier AI research and breakthrough discovery
icebreaker: Ask Demis about applying foundation model breakthroughs to real-world problems
networking_tip: Prepare thoughtful Q&As beforehand to stand out during post-keynote networking

title: AI and Robotics: The Engine of India's New Industrial Age
description: This session examines how high-performance robotics and Physical AI strengthen Make In India and accelerate automation. Panelists discuss how researchers, startups, and SMEs leverage platforms like NVIDIA's Isaac and Omniverse to build resource-optimized manufacturing ecosystems. Innovation and workforce upskilling create high-value jobs, ensuring sustainable, inclusive industrial growth across India. This operationalizes Planet and Progress Sutras through the Resilience, Innovation, and Efficiency Chakra for impact in emerging economies
speakers: Amit Goel, Nvidia; Raghu Dharmaraju, ARTPARK; Shashank Reddy, Evam Law & Policy
summary_one_liner: Robotics and Physical AI powering India's manufacturing revolution
icebreaker: Shashank, which Make in India robotics startups are you most excited about—and why?
networking_tip: SME owners and manufacturing CTOs here for practical insights. Pitch concrete automation use-cases.

title: Future of Fair Tech: Addressing Equity, Safety and Accountability in a Rapidly Evolving AI Landscape
description: This session will examine how India can translate fairness, safety, and accountability in AI governance as AI systems expand across public service delivery, platform regulation, and economic decision making. The discussion will focus on accountability frameworks for high impact AI, gaps in safety standards and enforcement, and structural inclusion challenges affecting women, rural populations, and marginalized communities.
speakers: Damar Juniarto, KONDISI and PIKAT Demokrasi; Lipika Kapoor, NABU Sciences | MIT; Niki Iliadis, The Future Society; Pauline Charazac, Center for AI Safety (CeSIA); Tess Buckley, techUK; Vidhi Sharma, Future Shift Labs Foundation
summary_one_liner: Tackling AI fairness, safety, and accountability gaps in India
icebreaker: Tess, how should startups practically implement fairness standards without slowing product velocity?
networking_tip: Ethics researchers + policy makers = smaller, focused crowd. Deep conversations happen naturally.

title: Strengthening Data and AI Collaboratives for Economic Growth and Social Good
description: Complex public challenges demand trusted, actionable data for better governance. As AI reshapes public systems, accessible, interoperable, and well-governed datasets are essential for transparent, inclusive development. This panel brings together global stakeholders to advance Data and AI Collaboratives—unlocking siloed data, enabling secure sharing, and decentralised governance—to build inclusive innovation ecosystems and scale ethical AI solutions that drive evidence-based decisions, economic growth, and social good.
speakers: Alexandru  Oprunenco, United Nations Development Programme (UNDP); Ambassador  Harry Verweij, Ministry of Foreign  Affairs, The Hague,  Netherlands; Anna  Tumcadóttir, Creative Commons; Ariane Hildebrandt, Federal Ministry for Economic Cooperation and Development (BMZ); Dr. Agnes  Kiragga, African Population Health Research  Council; Dr. Cecilia  Celeste Danesi, Artificial Intelligence and Civil Law, School  of Law (UBA); Dr. Hwirin Kim, World Meteorological  Organisation; Fred Werner  (Keynote  Address), International Telecommunication  Union (ITU); Gaurav  Godhwani, CivicDataLab; Kathleen  Victoir, Pasteur Network; Nasubo  Ongoma, Qhala
summary_one_liner: Unlocking siloed data for inclusive AI-driven governance globally
icebreaker: Fred Werner's keynote focuses on data governance—what's your biggest interoperability challenge?
networking_tip: Policy makers dominate this crowd. Schedule coffee beforehand; they move fast between sessions.

title: AI in Sustainment: Enhancing Operation Readiness of Military Equipment
description: Session will deliberate on the use of Artificial Intelligence for data-driven governance in equipment sustenance, focusing on predictive & prescriptive life cycle sustainability  and enhancing efficiency of maintenance processes. It will address challenges associated with infusion of AI for legacy weapon systems and decentralised use of data and data integration, while highlighting opportunities for collaboration with academia and industry to enhance combat potential and overall operational readiness by harnessing AI for informed decision making.
speakers: Brig Deepak Kumar, EME (B); Lt Gen Rajiv Kumar Sahni, AVSM, VSM , PhD, EME School, Indian Army; ⁠Maj Gen Mohit Gandhi, EME School; ⁠Maj Gen PS Bindra, VSM, Headquarters Southern Command, Indian Army; Maj Gen Shivendra Kumar Bhattacharya, EME (B); Mr Biswajit Biswas, Tata Elxsi; Mr. Sreeram Ananthasayanam, Delloitte; Prof. Sashikumaar Ganesan, IISc Bengaluru
summary_one_liner: AI-driven predictive maintenance for military equipment readiness
icebreaker: Prof Ganesan, how are predictive maintenance models adapting to India's legacy military equipment constraints?
networking_tip: Connect with Maj Gen Bindra afterward—procurement officials control defense tech budgets and move fast on proven solutions.

title: Building Safe and Trusted AI Infrastructure for Population-Scale AI
description: This session examines infrastructure for building trusted AI systems at population scale. As nations deploy AI in sensitive domains like healthcare and finance, the discussion explores how secure architectures protect privacy while enabling innovation. Panelists discuss zero-trust frameworks, specialized workforce development, and energy-efficient secure computing. This operationalizes the People and Progress Sutras through the Safe and Trusted AI Chakra, ensuring AI adoption remains inclusive, secure, and equitably shared.
speakers: Assaf Azrilevich, Nvidia; Benedict Macon Cooney, Tony Blair Institute for Global Change; Raj Reddy, Carnegie Mellon University; Tapan Sahoo, Maruti Suzuki; Utkarsh Saxena, AdalatAI
summary_one_liner: NVIDIA's blueprint for secure AI infrastructure at population scale
icebreaker: Raj Reddy, what zero-trust architecture lesson from population-scale AI surprised your team most?
networking_tip: CISOs and infrastructure engineers are early-morning attenders. Arrive 15 min early to catch them.

title: Defence Perspective in AI
description: This session will examine the transformative role of Artificial Intelligence in enhancing operational readiness, decision-making, and force modernisation within the Armed Forces. Senior military leadership, academia, and industry experts will deliberate on emerging AI-driven capabilities, human–machine teaming, autonomous systems, data-centric warfare, and secure digital ecosystems. ations in an increasingly complex security environment.
speakers: Dr. Vikram Jayaram, Neuralix Ai Private Limited; Lt Gen Harsh Chhibber, AVSM, VSM, Phd, Indian Army; Lt Gen Vipun shinghal, AVSM, SM, Indian Army; Maj Gen Pawan Anand, AVSM Phd (Retd), Centre for Emerging Technologies for Atma Nirbhar Bharat (USI-CETANB); Mrs Madhumita Mohapatra, Deloitte; Subimal Bhattacharjee, Individual
summary_one_liner: Senior military leaders chart AI's role in defence modernisation
icebreaker: Lt Gen Harsh Chhibber, what's the biggest gap you see between AI research labs and actual military deployment?
networking_tip: Arrive early to speak with military officers before the keynote—they're decision-makers who rarely attend tech conferences.

title: Operating Models for AI Quality Across Billion-User Markets
description: AI at a billion-user scale strains traditional operating models. Quality, cost, and speed collide as organizations expand across languages, markets, and use cases—particularly in mega-markets like India. This panel brings leaders on the front lines of AI transformation to unpack how operating models are evolving. The conversation will explore approaches to AI quality, governance and metrics, global feedback loops, and human-AI workflows that deliver results while embedding AI skills and novel ways of working.
speakers: Aneesh Chopra, innovativestate; Rahul Kapoor, PwC; Richard Vose, PwC Strategy; Sarala Jonnalagadda, Google Technical Services
summary_one_liner: Scaling AI quality and governance for billion-user markets
icebreaker: Aneesh, how do you balance quality vs. speed when operating AI across 1B+ users simultaneously?
networking_tip: Enterprise COOs dominate—they approve budgets. Ask about their current human-AI workflow pain points.

title: Boosting AI Adoption in the Global South: Critical Role of Trust Across the AI Tech Stack
description: This discussion explores how trust enables responsible and scalable AI adoption across sectors, especially in emerging economies. It focuses on shared accountability across the technology lifecycle, practical governance measures, and deployment safeguards that build public confidence. The conversation highlights collaboration, transparency, and real-world assurance practices as foundations for broader, inclusive AI uptake.
speakers: Denise Wong, Infocomm Media Development Authority, Ministry of Digital Development and Information, Singapore; Rebecca Finlay, Partnership on AI; Ria Strasser-Galvis, Anthropic; Terah Lyons, JP Morgan Chase
summary_one_liner: Trust as the foundation for scaling AI in emerging economies
icebreaker: Terah, what trust gaps across the AI stack are blocking adoption fastest in Global South markets?
networking_tip: JPMorganChase + policy leaders = high-value density. Volunteer for breakout discussions.

title: Roundtable on Opportunities for EU-India Collaboration for Twin Transition
description: AI plays a key role in advancing the vision of Twin-Transition for pursuing simultaneous digital transformation and sustainability. India's digital ecosystem can partner with EU business to for innovation, R&D investments, acceleration of AI adoption and sustainable technology solutions. This roundtable aims to develop a roadmap for EU-India collaboration with implementation strategies and collaborative opportunities to accelerate efficiency and sustainability, especially for SMEs.
speakers: Christian Wickert, Merck Life Science; Clas Neumann, SAP Labs Network; Dr. Lovneesh Chanana, FEBI Sectoral Committee on Technology & Digital Services; Dr. Magnus Ewerbring, Ericsson Group; Jürgen Westermeier, Federation of European Business in India (FEBI); Olivier Blum, Schneider Electric; Roberto Viola, Directorate-General for Communications Networks, Content and Technology, EU Commission; Sonia Prashar, Federation of European Business in India (FEBI)
knowledge_partners: Federation of European Business in India
summary_one_liner: EU-India roadmap for AI-driven digital and green transition
icebreaker: Roberto, which EU sustainability standards are reshaping India's SME innovation roadmaps?
networking_tip: EU and Indian trade diplomats network heavily here. Bilateral partnerships form over coffee breaks.

title: AI at Scale: Driving Adoption, Productivity and Market Access for Indian SMEs & Startups
description: This session will examine adoption, productivity, and market access challenges for SMEs and startups, aligned with the People, Planet, and Progress framework through a focus on democratising access to AI resources. The discussion will explore approaches to enabling broader AI adoption through safe and trusted systems, while supporting economic growth and human capital development. It will also consider how scaling AI deployment can contribute to inclusive outcomes and wider participation across sectors.
speakers: Anand Kamannavar, Applied Materials Inc; Ashok Chandak, IESA & SEMI India; Jyothis Indirabhai, NetraSemi; Navin Bishnoi, Marvell India  and IESA; Preet Yadav, NXP Semiconductors; Sundeep Gupta, Alphawave SEMI (Qualcomm)
summary_one_liner: Democratizing AI tools and market access for India's SMEs
icebreaker: Anand Kamannavar, what's the simplest AI tool SMEs should implement first to see immediate productivity gains?
networking_tip: This crowd is deal-ready—have a 2-min pitch ready and exchange contacts with CTOs on the SME panel track.

title: AI and Education: From Innovation to Impact
description: This high-level discussion will bring together policymakers, international organizations, and education leaders to explore how to turn AI innovation into measurable learning outcomes with a strong focus on teacher empowerment, equity, and children's safety. Drawing on national initiatives such as Estonia's AI Leap, the discussion will highlight how public-private cooperation, teacher-centered approaches, and strong governance can help translate AI innovation into real educational impact and serve as learning laboratories for scaling equitable AI in education.
speakers: Dr. Pia Rebello Britto, UNICEF; H.E. Clara Chappaz, Digital Affairs and Artificial Intelligence, France; H.E. Hon. William Kabogo Gitau, E.G.H, Ministry of Information, Communications and The Digital Economy in Kenya; HE Alar Karis, Estonia; Ivo Visak, AI LEAP (Estonia); Linnar Viik, Eesti.ai programme; Professor Petri Myllymäki, Finnish Center for Artificial Intelligence
summary_one_liner: AI-driven learning outcomes with teacher empowerment and child safety focus
icebreaker: Ask Dr. Pia Rebello Britto how UNICEF measures AI learning impact in emerging markets.
networking_tip: Connect with educators during breaks; they shape AI policy adoption timelines.

title: Safe and Trusted AI: The Ethics and Governance Perspective
description: Anchored in the principles of People, Planet, and Progress, this session examines how safe and trusted AI can be advanced through ethical safeguards, accountability and effective governance. Bringing together national and global experts, the discussion explores practical pathways for inclusive, equitable, and human-centred AI development and deployment across sectors, highlighting the role of international cooperation in strengthening trust and responsible AI adoption.
speakers: Dr Amit Kumar, RIS, New Delhi; Dr B K Murthy, Amity University, Noida; Dr Geetha Vani Rayasam, CSIR-NIScPR, New Delhi; Dr K Ravi Srinivas, NALSAR, Hyderabad and IIT-Madras; Dr Neethu Rajam, National Law University of Delhi; Dr Nupur Chowdhury, JNU, New Delhi; Dr Roli Mathur, ICMR, New Delhi; Dr S K Varshney, RIS, New Delhi; Dr Titipol Phakdeewanich, Ubon Ratchathani University, Thailand; Mr Saurabh Kapil, BioSky; Prof. Sachin Kumar Sharma, RIS, New Delhi
summary_one_liner: Ethical safeguards and governance frameworks for trusted, equitable AI
icebreaker: Ask Dr. K Ravi Srinivas how legal frameworks can balance innovation with AI accountability.
networking_tip: Identify governance researchers; they influence regulatory timelines in your sector.

title: Building Sovereign AI Infrastructure: Empowering Citizens, Transforming Nations
description: India is entering an era where AI is strategic infrastructure on par with power, telecom, and cloud driving the rise of Sovereign AI and national AI capability. This executive session brings together four technology leaders to cover the full AI lifecycle: AI Factory architecture, software/data/training/inference, sovereign AI strategy, and industry transformation. Outcomes include an end-to-end AI blueprint, sovereign AI frameworks, and high-ROI GenAI use cases across finance, healthcare, energy, telecom, and government.
speakers: Calista Redmond, Nvidia; Jigar Halani (moderator), Nvidia; John Fanelli, Nvidia; Marc Hamilton, Nvidia; Shanker Trivedi, Nvidia
summary_one_liner: Sovereign AI infrastructure strategy from AI Factory to national capability
icebreaker: Ask Calista Redmond how Nvidia's AI Factory model scales to sovereign requirements.
networking_tip: Nvidia leads this session—ideal for infrastructure vendors to book follow-ups.

title: Inaugural Session & Launch of WG Deliverables
description: This session discusses the overarching vision, priorities, and agenda of the India AI Impact Summit. It also gives an overview of the various deliverables across working groups.
speakers: Abhishek Singh, Additional Secretary, Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology, Government of India; S. Krishnan, Secretary, Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology, Government of India; Sh. Ashwini Vaishnaw, Minister of Railways; Minister of Information and Broadcasting; MeitY, Government of India
summary_one_liner: India AI Impact Summit vision, priorities, and cross-working group deliverables
icebreaker: Ask S. Krishnan which working group deliverable will unlock fastest AI adoption.
networking_tip: This is the summit kickoff—critical for understanding India's AI policy direction.

title: Building Sovereign AI Infrastructure: Empowering Citizens, Transforming Nations
description: India is entering an era where AI is strategic infrastructure—on par with power, telecom, and cloud—driving the rise of Sovereign AI and national AI capability. This executive session brings together four technology leaders to cover the full AI lifecycle: AI Factory architecture, software/data/training/inference, sovereign AI strategy, and industry transformation. Outcomes include an end-to-end AI blueprint, sovereign AI frameworks, and high-ROI GenAI use cases across finance, healthcare, energy, telecom, and government.
speakers: Calista Redmond; Jigar Halani; John Fanelli; Marc Hamilton; Shanker Trivedi
summary_one_liner: Sovereign AI infrastructure strategy from AI Factory to national capability
icebreaker: Ask Calista Redmond how Nvidia's AI Factory model scales to sovereign requirements.
networking_tip: Tech leaders dominate—perfect for B2B infrastructure partnerships.

title: Conversation
speakers: Mitesh Khapra, Head AI4Bharat; Mati Staniszewski, Co-Founder Elevenlabs; Moderator - Shraddha Sharma, Founder and Chief Executive Officer, Yourstory
summary_one_liner: Multilingual AI innovation and voice technology for emerging market impact
icebreaker: Ask Mitesh Khapra how AI4Bharat's language models enable voice in Indian languages.
networking_tip: Mati Staniszewski (Elevenlabs) is scaling voice tech—explore partnerships early.

title: Global Capital, Local Advantage: India in the AI Race
description: India's AI opportunity is global: products can be built locally and sold worldwide, but leadership depends on translating India's strengths—talent, digital infrastructure, and cost-efficient execution—into scalable applications. This session spotlights where India can lead across the AI value chain, focusing on sectors like financial services and insurance, where AI transforms underwriting, claims, and risk. It will examine sovereign AI—autonomy in models, data, and compute—and how cross-domain investments can accelerate India's advantage.
speakers: Abhishek Shukla; Dipender Saluja; Sanjay Tugnait; Shereen Bhan; Sriram Viswanathan
summary_one_liner: Where India can lead across the global AI value chain
icebreaker: Dipender, which vertical do you think has the best ROI potential: fintech AI or sovereign AI infrastructure?
networking_tip: VCs and Series A+ founders cluster near exits—position yourself there for 1-on-1 conversations about capital and expansion.

title: Shaping Equitable AI Transitions: Building Global Human Capital for the Age of AI
description: This session discusses people-centred, development-oriented, & equitable approaches for workforce transitions in the age of AI; and how countries can build agile, equitable, and future-ready reskilling systems aligned with the evolving world of work. It will also mark the formal launch of the Equitable AI Transitions Knowledge Output supported by ILO.
speakers: Prof. T.G. Sitharam, Chair ; Philippines, Co-Chair  ; Rwanda, Co-Chair
summary_one_liner: Equitable workforce reskilling systems for AI-driven economic transitions
icebreaker: Ask Prof. T.G. Sitharam how global co-chairs are aligning reskilling standards.
networking_tip: Representatives from Philippines and Rwanda present—explore cross-border talent pipelines.

title: Keynotes for Research Symposium by Prof. Dame Wendy Hall (Professor of Computer Science, University of Southampton)
speakers: Dame Wendy Hall, Professor of Computer Science, University of Southampton      ; Anand Deshpande, Founder, Chairman and Managing Director (Moderator), Persistent Systems
summary_one_liner: AI research keynotes bridging academia and enterprise innovation strategies
icebreaker: Ask Dame Wendy Hall what emerging research gaps she sees between academia and industry.
networking_tip: Dame Wendy Hall brings UK research credibility—essential for deep tech validation.

title: Cracking the AI Skill Code: Capabilities, Mindset, and Workplace Readiness
description: Artificial Intelligence is rapidly becoming a foundational workplace utility, requiring professionals to move beyond basic awareness toward practical capability. The key challenge is understanding what to learn, which skills truly matter, and how to adapt thinking and workstyles for an AI-enabled workplace. This session outlines an "AI Skill Code" for working professionals, focusing on building capabilities, practical learning, the right mindset, and workplace readiness, while showcasing how BITS Pilani WILP is redesigning AI education through foundations-driven, practice-oriented programs.
room: Hall No. 4 First Floor - Session Hall 3
speakers:
Prof. PB Venkataraman (Professor of Mechanical Engineering), Dean WILP, BITS Pilani
; Prof. Nishit Narang (Associate Professor, Computer Science and Information Systems), Head WILP-CSIS, BITS Pilani
; Prof. Vimal SP (Associate Professor, Computer Science and Information Systems), Associate Head WILP-CSIS, BITS Pilani
; Prof. Prakruthi Hareesh (Assistant Professor, Engineering), BITS Pilani
; Prof Gaurav Nagpal (Associate Professor, Management), BITS Pilani
; Prof. Neha Vinayak (Assistant Professor, Computer Science and Information Systems), BITS Pilani
summary_one_liner: Master practical AI skills for modern workplace competitiveness
icebreaker: Prof. Venkataraman, how do you advise non-technical professionals to approach AI capability building?
networking_tip: Connect with BITS Pilani faculty; they're shaping AI curriculum for India's next generation.

title:
From Data Centres to Dialects: Scaling Language AI 
for a Billion Voices
room: Hall No. 3 First Floor - Session Hall 4
summary_one_liner: Scale multilingual AI across India's linguistic diversity challenges
icebreaker: What infrastructure innovations enable billion-scale language models for low-resource Indian languages?
networking_tip: Seek out language AI startups; this track attracts founders solving multilingual challenges.

title: Sarvam (Closed Door Media Briefing)
room: Hall No. 5 First Floor - Session Hall 1
summary_one_liner: Exclusive briefing on Sarvam's latest AI capabilities
icebreaker: What's Sarvam's vision for indigenous AI models serving India's enterprise sector?
networking_tip: Closed-door format = pre-qualified attendees; exchange contact details before/after session.

title: Engineering the Future: Full-Stack AI with Google
description: Harness the power of Gemini 3.0 and the Antigravity IDE to build sophisticated, agentic AI logic natively on Google Cloud. This 1.2-hour intensive deep-dive with Google experts guides you through architecting high-performance, intelligent use cases tailored for the Android ecosystem. Learn to transform raw code into a global success story by leveraging Google Play's advanced growth and quality tools to scale your innovation to billions.
room: Hall No. 4 First Floor - Session Hall 2
speakers:
Sh. Anand Rangarajan, VP, Engineering in Google DeepMind
; Sh. Paige Bailey, Engineering Lead for GenAI Developer Experience at Google
; Sh. Amrit Sanjeev, Staff Developer Relations Engineer for Android at Google
; Sh. Prashanth Subrahmanyam, Lead Developer Adoption for Google Cloud in APAC
; Ms. Aneesha Dhar, Head-India ecosystem for Google play
summary_one_liner: Build agentic AI apps on Google Cloud with Gemini 3.0
icebreaker: Paige Bailey, how does Gemini 3.0's native Android integration simplify agentic development?
networking_tip: Google engineers in the room = direct hiring signals; ask about engineer gaps they're solving.

title: Keynote
speakers: Prayank Swaroop, Partner, Accel
summary_one_liner: Accel partner keynote on AI investment strategy
icebreaker: What patterns are you seeing in AI startup success vs. failure in 2026?
networking_tip: Plenary slots draw the entire conference; position yourself at networking breaks.

title: Harnessing the Transformative Potential of AI to Empower All
description: This session discusses how countries can harness AI to advance social empowerment for all, uplifting all sections of society and ensuring that the benefits of technological progress are shared equitably by all
speakers: Shri. Rajesh Aggarwal, Chair ; Switzerland, Co-Chair ; Nigeria, Co-Chair
summary_one_liner: AI for equitable social empowerment across all societies
icebreaker: How can countries prioritize equitable AI access without widening digital divides?
networking_tip: Multi-country chairs present; ask about cross-border AI collaboration frameworks they're developing.

title: Governing Safe and Responsible AI within Digital Public Infrastructure
description: This session will explore safe and responsible AI in Digital Public Infrastructure (DPI), with a focus on algorithmic transparency, human-centred governance, regulatory best practices, and inclusion, including perspectives from the Global South. Distinguished speakers from government, civil society, and industry will offer brief remarks, followed by a moderated discussion and audience Q&A.
speakers: Alexandria Walden, Google; H E Alar Karis, Republic of Estonia; H E Harry Verweij, Ministry of Foreign Affairs, The Kingdom of the Netherlands; H.E. Bernard Maissen, Head of the Federal Office for Communications, Switzerland; H.E. Taurimas Valys, Lithuania; Juan Carlos Lara, Derechos Digitales; Norman Schulz, Federal Foreign Office, Germany; Sabhanaz Rashid Diya, Tech Global Institute, India; Zach Lampell, ICNL FOC–TFAIR
knowledge_partners: Freedom Online Coalition - Task Force on Artificial Intelligence and Human Rights
summary_one_liner: Ensuring responsible AI governance within digital public infrastructure
icebreaker: Sabhanaz Rashid Diya, how do you balance algorithmic transparency with the reality of deploying AI in Global South DPI?
networking_tip: Civil society and gov officials dominate—focus on building relationships with policy makers; this crowd values trust over speed.

title: Charting India's AI–IP Playbook: Innovation, Rights and National Advantage
description: From AI-generated content and code to foundation models, traditional boundaries of authorship, inventorship, and ownership are increasingly contested as jurisdictions adapt their intellectual property regimes. The IndiaAI Mission positions indigenous datasets, models, and compute infrastructure as strategic national assets for innovation, exports, and long-term economic growth. Without a future-ready AI–IP framework, India risks legal uncertainty that could constrain innovation and investment. This session situates AI–IP policy within the vision of Viksit Bharat, linking science and innovation, safe and trusted AI, and AI-led economic growth and social good.
speakers: Anne E. Robinson, IBM; Dr. Shardul S. Shroff, Shardul Amarchand Mangaldas & Co; Jace Johnson, Adobe; Nitin Seth, Incedo; Prof. Sandeep Shukla, IIIT Hyderabad; Rai Rajani Vindokumar, Chubb; Sabeen Malik, Rapid7
summary_one_liner: India's AI intellectual property framework for innovation leadership
icebreaker: Anne Robinson's take on AI authorship rights—does your startup have an IP strategy yet?
networking_tip: IP lawyers and startup founders need each other here. Catch speakers immediately after for 1-on-1 legal guidance.

title: How AI Will Reshape Global Development Beyond the SDGs
description: As the 2030 deadline approaches amid economic, social, and geopolitical pressures, this session reframes global development as a structural transformation already underway. Artificial intelligence is reshaping growth models, public institutions, and human capital beyond the SDGs, raising questions about financing, governance, and delivery. Bringing together leaders from finance, philanthropy, technology, and government, the discussion explores how AI can boost productivity, strengthen capacity, unlock development pathways, and mitigate inequality globally equitably.
speakers: Amandeep Singh Gill, UN ODET; Kamal Kishore, UN Secretary-General for Disaster Risk Reduction; Komal Sharma Talwar, XLSCOUT; Paula Bogantes Zamora, Ministery of Science, Innovation, Technology and Telecommunications Costa Rica; Sangbu Kim, World Bank; Shankar Maruwada, EkStep Foundation; Vilas Dhar, Patrick J. McGovern Foundation
knowledge_partners: United Nations Office for Digital and Emerging Technologies
summary_one_liner: Leveraging AI to accelerate Sustainable Development Goals by 2030
icebreaker: How is Amandeep Singh Gill's UN work influencing your org's SDG roadmap?
networking_tip: Impact investors and UN officials cluster early. Arrive 15min before start to position yourself in their conversations.

title: Building Resilience and breaking dependency in enterprise and public sector AI - how can open source support this?
description: Panel examines how open source AI can reduce vendor lock-in and strengthen autonomy in enterprise and public sector deployments.
speakers: Amanda Brock, OpenUK; Anastasia Stasenko, Pleias; Jimmy Wales, Wikipedia; Laura Gilbert, Tony Blair Institute; Mishi Choudary, Software Freedom Law Centre
summary_one_liner: MCP and open standards shaping the agentic AI future
icebreaker: Amanda Brock, how does the Model Context Protocol change data governance workflows for agentic AI systems?
networking_tip: Workshop format = hands-on networking—pair with someone at your table working on interop, exchange Slack handles.

title: Responsible AI at Scale, Governance, Integrity, and Cyber Readiness for a Changing World
description: The session aims to develop a practical and inclusive framework for responsible AI adoption at scale, with a focus on governance mechanisms, content integrity safeguards, and cyber resilience. It will position India as a global standard setter for safe and trusted AI that is adaptable to diverse cultural, economic, and institutional contexts, particularly across the Global South. The discussion will generate actionable insights and policy-relevant recommendations that directly contribute to the objectives and outcomes.
speakers: Dr. Balaravindran, CeRAI - IIT Madras; Dr. Subi Chaturvedi, InMobi; Maj. Vineet Kumar, CyberPeace; Prof. (Dr.) G.S. Bajpai, National Law University Delhi
summary_one_liner: Framework for responsible AI governance and cyber resilience at scale
icebreaker: Dr. Subi Chaturvedi mentioned content integrity safeguards—what's your biggest governance gap?
networking_tip: CISOs and policy makers attend. Network during Q&A breaks when experts are most receptive to cyber resilience discussions.

title: Building Sovereign Deep Tech for a Resilient Future: Solutions from Finland and India
description: This panel discussion explores pioneering deep tech solutions emerging from innovators. Through examples presented by industry leaders, the panelists discuss how AI integrated solutions can enhance competitiveness, security, and societal resilience. The discussion further explores how research and innovative public-private partnerships can strengthen strategic autonomy and create globally competitive AI ecosystems. The event is hosted by the Embassy of Finland in New Delhi, the Finnish Innovation Fund Sitra and the Ministry of Transport and Communication of Finland
speakers: Antti Vasara, Foreign Ministry of Finland; Atte Jääskeläinen, Finnish Innovation Fund Sitra; Kimmo Lähdevirta, Ambassador, Finland to India; Mari Walls, Research Organization Collaboration and Academic Partnerships, CSC IT Centre for Science; Pasi Toivanen, Nokia; Petteri Orpo, Government of Finland; Sethu Saveda Suvanam, Reorbit
summary_one_liner: Finland showcases sovereign deep tech for strategic AI autonomy
icebreaker: Petteri Orpo's sovereign AI vision—how is Finland's approach reshaping your deep tech strategy?
networking_tip: Government officials and deep tech founders cluster. Leverage the international angle—connect with trade delegates between panels.

title: Beyond Earth: How AI is Powering the Next Era of Space Exploration
description: AI is emerging as a transformative force across the space sector, enabling greater autonomy, efficiency, scalability, and value creation across satellite design and operations, data processing, and downstream applications. It aims to deliberate on high-impact AI use cases across the space value chain, assess their technological and commercial implications, and identify opportunities for collaboration among  startups, academia, and research institutions. The session will provide a platform to exchange insights on innovation, data and infrastructure needs.
speakers: Dr Dipti Patil, MKSSS Cummins College of Engineering for Women, Pune; Dr Jagriti Dabas, ARMS 4 AI; Dr. Vinod Kumar, Indian National Space Promotion and Authorisation Centre (IN-SPACe); Mr Nitish Kumar, URSC, ISRO; Mr R. Durairaj, IISU, ISRO; Mr Vinay Simha, Hyspace (SkyServe); Ms Ishita Ganjoo, URSC, ISRO
summary_one_liner: AI transforms satellite operations and space sector innovation pipeline
icebreaker: Dr. Jagriti Dabas—how are space startups leveraging AI for satellite autonomy?
networking_tip: ISRO scientists, aerospace investors, and space founders all here. Position yourself near Dr. Vinod Kumar for satellite ops insights.

title: Closing the Loop: Building Global AI Incident Monitoring and Response Capabilities at the India AI Impact Summit
description:
AI incidents are emerging as early warning signals of systemic, cross-border risk - but the global infrastructure to 
capture and learn from them remains fragmented. This session brings together policymakers, and 
technical experts to explore how interoperable AI incident reporting and monitoring can strengthen prevention, early 
warning, and coordinated response. Participants will discuss institutional designs —from shared taxonomies to secure 
data-sharing—that can turn incident data into actionable governance, standards, and risk-management insights.
speakers: Akiko Murakami, Japanese AI Safety Institute; Caio Vieira Machado, Berkman Klein Center at Harvard University; Elham Tabassi, Senior Fellow at Brookings Institution; Former Chief AI Advisor at US NIST; Hugo Valadares, Department of Science, Technology, and Digital Innovation (DECTI) of the Brazilian Ministry of Science, Technology and Innovation; Marko Grobelnik, Digital Champion of Slovenia at the European Commission; Niki Iliadis, Global AI Governance at The Future Society
summary_one_liner: Global infrastructure for AI incident reporting and coordinated response
icebreaker: Elham Tabassi leads NIST AI standards—what AI incidents is your org tracking?
networking_tip: AI safety researchers and policy makers dominate. Arrive early to join speaker-led informal discussions on incident frameworks.

title: Towards Multilateral Agreement on Enforcing Red Lines
description: This panel will bring together governments and experts to discuss the potential for multilateral agreement on AI governance, the need for agreement on unacceptable risks and harms across the AI value chain, and for establishing multilateral commitment on enforcement mechanisms that address them. Panellists will explore the desirability of red lines, how international consensus on governance could be built, options for feasible and proportional enforcement, and practical ways forward given geopolitical and technical constraints.
speakers: Anita Gurumurthy, IT for Change; Cam Rincon, Ada Lovelace Institute; Gaia Marcus, Ada Lovelace Institute; Guilherme Fitzgibbon Alves Pereira, Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Brazil; Marielle Mumenthaler, · Federal Department of Foreign Affairs of Switzerland; Rumman Chaudhury, Humaine Intelligence
summary_one_liner: Can nations agree on AI red lines and enforcement mechanisms?
icebreaker: Rumman Chaudhury, what's one AI red line that governments actually agree on across regions?
networking_tip: Policy experts are rare—sit near diplomats and gov officials; they value 1-on-1 convos over large group chats.

title: Workforce Readiness for Artificial Intelligence in Primary Health Care
description: Digital health innovations and AI are reshaping triage, diagnosis, and population health management, but their impact on primary health care depends on whether frontline workers across cadres can adopt these tools safely, ethically, and effectively. This panel brings together senior experts from government, academia, industry, and think tanks to define AI readiness for primary health care and translate it into role-based competency pathways and practical implementation levers.
speakers: Dr Mona Duggal, ICMR; Dr Monika Kochar, Health, DAKSHIN, RIS; Dr Ranjana Kumar, Nashik; Dr Smisha Agarwal, Center for Global Digital Health Innovation, Johns Hopkins University; Dr Titipol Phakdeewanich, Regional Center for Human Rights, Faculty of Political Science, Ubon Ratchathani University, Thailand; Professor Anurag Agrawal, Biosciences and Health Research, Ashoka University; Professor Fuad, Embassy of the Republic of Indonesia, New Delhi
knowledge_partners: Center for Global Digital Health Innovation
summary_one_liner: Preparing primary health care workers for AI-enabled clinical practice
icebreaker: Dr. Mona Duggal's work on frontline health worker AI adoption—how are you training yours?
networking_tip: Healthtech founders and medical educators collaborate here. Connect with public health officials during panel breaks for hiring pipelines.

title: Physical AI and the Big Bang of General Robotics
description:
Incredible breakthroughs in end-to-end generative models, physically-based synthetic data generation and simulation, and mechatronics are driving the big bang of general robotics and physical AI. 

Join Amit Goel, Head of Robotics and Edge Computing Ecosystem, NVIDIA, to hear the latest in technology breakthroughs and the "3 computer" requirements for building generalized robotics systems, plus the amazing innovations through our partner ecosystem.
speakers: Amit Goel, Nvidia
summary_one_liner: NVIDIA unveils breakthroughs in general-purpose robotics and Physical AI
icebreaker: Amit Goel, which synthetic data techniques are actually unblocking robotics prototyping at scale right now?
networking_tip: Deep tech founders are scattered—use the speaker booth as a hub and ask Amit to introduce you to robotics researchers.

title: Use of AI for Disaster Resilient Infrastructure
description: The session will advance a policy focused understanding of the role of artificial intelligence in strengthening the resilience of critical infrastructure systems with emphasis on capacities to absorb disruptions, respond effectively, and recover sustainably. It will present sectoral evidence on AI-enabled resilience in transport, power and water systems, identify governance, standards and institutional capacity requirements and assess technology options and trade-offs for adoption in low-resource and climate-vulnerable contexts.
speakers: Dr. Manabendra Saharia, IIT Delhi; Dr. Pradeep Thapliyal, Space Application Centre, ISRO; Dr. Srikanta K Panigrah, Indian Institute of Sustainable Development (IISD); Mr. Anshu Sharma, SEEDS; Ms Ranjini Mukherjee, CDRI; Ms. Elizabeth Atwell, BHC; Ms. Rita Missal, NDMA; Ms. Samhita R, Resilience AI; Priyanka Das Rajkakati, VortexIo
summary_one_liner: AI strengthens critical infrastructure resilience against disasters
icebreaker: Dr. Manabendra Saharia on disaster-resilient AI—is your infrastructure strategy climate-ready?
networking_tip: Climate tech founders and infrastructure officials both attend. Pitch resilience solutions during networking breaks, not formal sessions.

title: The Intelligent City: Building Resilient and Inclusive Urban Futures
description: This panel examines how AI reshapes urban infrastructure addressing rapid urbanization across the Global South. Leaders with experience in  aviation, energy, water management, and governance explore deploying intelligent systems. The conversation covers how computer vision, predictive analytics, and IoT optimize resource consumption and improve citizen services. Panelists discuss data integration challenges, public-private collaboration, and building technical capacity. This advances the Planet and Progress Sutras through the AI for Economic Growth and Social Good Chakra.
speakers: Anshul Mishra, AIIMS Delhi; Jumbi Edulbehram, Nvidia; Mashal Dhawan, Smart Energy Water; Ujjwal Kumar, Quantum Alliance ; Viraj Tyagi, eGov Foundation
summary_one_liner: AI-powered smart cities for resilient and inclusive urban futures
icebreaker: Anshul Mishra, IAS, how is Bangalore using AI to solve water scarcity differently than other Indian cities?
networking_tip: Gov officials attend early sessions—grab coffee with urban planners and IoT engineers before the afternoon rush.

title: AI Transformation in Fintech: From Automation to Intelligence
description: A deep dive into AI's fintech evolution, from automation to intelligence, enabling smarter decisions, scalable innovation, risk resilience, personalization, and transformative impact across financial ecosystems.
speakers: Anjani Bharadwaj, HDFC ERGO; Ashutosh Gupta, IITB; Dr Prasad Ramanathan, TIH IIT Bombay; Mr Harsh Kumar, Poonawalla Fincorp; Mr Sriram Naganathan, HDFC ERGO; Mukund Kannan, Mphasis; Prof Dipak Gupta, Mehta School of Management, IIT Bombay
summary_one_liner: Fintech's AI evolution from basic automation to intelligent systems
icebreaker: Dr Prasad Ramanathan, how are fintech teams moving from rule-based automation to actual AI intelligence?
networking_tip: Fintech CTOs attend for talent and vendors—bring a concise case study and swap LinkedIn with banking innovation leads.

title: AI for Manufacturing Engineering and Technology: Powering India's MET Ecosystem
description: Building on the 2025 MET Roundtable, the 2026 session at the India AI Impact Summit will mark the launch of the AI for MET initiative and its Expert Council. This convening will bring together stakeholders to release a policy white paper outlining approaches to intelligent and sustainable manufacturing. The discussion will focus on pathways for strengthening manufacturing capabilities through AI-enabled innovation and adoption.
speakers: Dr Eric Grimson, Massachusetts Institute of Technology; Dr Krishnan Balasubramanian, IIT Madras; Dr. Ibrahim Hafeezur Rehman, NAMTECH; Dr. Vivek Mohindra, Dell Technologies; Sanjay Sharma, Arcelor Mittal China & SEA; Venu Nuguri, Hitachi India
summary_one_liner: Launch AI for Manufacturing initiative with MIT and IIT leaders
icebreaker: Dr. Grimson, how can MIT's robotics expertise accelerate India's smart manufacturing transformation?
networking_tip: Expert council launch = key opinion leaders in one room; pitch partnership ideas during breaks.

title: Break
summary_one_liner: Scheduled break time
icebreaker: Coffee break—perfect time to grab someone from the previous session.
networking_tip: Use breaks strategically; approach speakers while they're accessible, not during sessions.

icebreaker: Ask Vilas Dhar about McGovern Foundation's AI funding thesis

Lawrence, DeepMind Professor of Machine Learning, University of Cambridge; Bonnie Kruft, Managing Director, Microsoft Research; Pushmeet Kohli, Vice President of Science, Google DeepMind; Priya Donti, Assistant Professor, EECS and LIDS, Massachusetts Institute of Technology; Yoshua Bengio, Professor of Computer Science, Université de Montréal; Kalika Bali, Senior Principal Researcher (Moderator), Microsoft Research

summary_one_liner: Cutting-edge AI research projects and innovations on display

title: From Scale to Sustainability: Advancing Resilient & Efficient AI
description: This session discusses approaches towards building resource-conscious and efficient AI systems. It will mark the formal launch of the ‘Advancing Resilient AI Infrastructure’ Playbook, supported by Dalberg and the Resilient AI Challenge, supported by UNESCO.
speakers: Shri. Pankaj Aggarwal, Chair ; France, Co-Chair
summary_one_liner: Building resilient, efficient AI infrastructure and systems at scale
icebreaker: Ask Pankaj Aggarwal about the Resilient AI Infrastructure Playbook's key recommendations
networking_tip: Connect with Dalberg and UNESCO partners on sustainability-focused AI infrastructure strategy

title: Fintech for All: Democratizing Financial Access Through AI and Human Capital Development
description: This session explores how AI infrastructure drives equitable growth across fintech ecosystems in India and the Global South. Panelists examine how scalable platforms enable multilingual interfaces and risk models serving diverse populations. The discussion covers GPU-accelerated computing powering real-time fraud detection and personalized banking for underserved communities. Examples demonstrate how democratizing compute access and workforce skilling create economic opportunities and financial inclusion, operationalizing the People and Progress Sutras through the Inclusion for Social Empowerment Chakra.
speakers: Anjani Rathor, HDFC; Kamya Chandra (Moderator), CDPI; Lipika Kapoor, NABU Sciences; Sohoni Rajola, NPCI; Yogesh Agarwal, Nvidia
summary_one_liner: GPU-powered AI democratizes fintech for underserved communities
icebreaker: Lipika Kapoor on multilingual AI for financial inclusion—how are you reaching underserved users?
networking_tip: Impact investors and fintech founders attend. Ask moderator Kamya Chandra to introduce you to GPU infrastructure speakers post-panel.

title: Empowering AI Startups: Compute and the Venture Thesis
description: With billions flowing into AI, this session addresses a critical theme -- empowering AI startups: democratizing compute for economic growth and venture investment theses. It explores strategic thinking: leveraging engineering talent, infrastructure, and market scale for measured decision-making. Managing GPU access, cloud economics, and efficient frameworks becomes crucial to profitability. Panelists explore separating hype from opportunities, sustainable unit economics, and navigating seed to scale, operationalizing the People and Progress Sutras through the Democratizing AI Resources Chakra.
speakers: Arun Kumar, Celesta Capital; Hari Balaji, Ernst & Young; Poorvi Vijay, Elevation Capital; Schwark Satyavolu, Nenu AI; Tobias Halloran, Nvidia
summary_one_liner: Democratizing GPU compute access to supercharge AI startups
icebreaker: Tobias Halloran's compute credits framework—is your startup maximizing NVIDIA infrastructure access?
networking_tip: VCs fund compute-efficient startups here. Prepare a 30-second pitch on your infrastructure efficiency for investor speed-dating slots.

title: Democratizing AI resources and building inclusive AI solutions for India
description: The session will address the critical challenge of making AI accessible and affordable for India's diverse socio-economic landscape. While AI's transformative potential is widely recognised, cost barriers and complex ownership models often limit its deployment to well-funded organisations, creating a digital divide. The discussion will explore strategies to democratize AI through cost-effective solutions, sustainable deployment models, and comprehensive Total Cost of Ownership (TCO) frameworks
speakers: Mr Brad Staples, APCO; Mr Gokul V Subramaniam, Intel India; Mr Sandeep Saxena, MEA, France, Iberia, Italy HCLTech; Mr Sharath Bulusu, Google Pay India; Mr Tarun Chhabra, Nokia India; Ms. Rajita Kulkarni, Sri Sri University; Ms. Sarika Gulyani, FICCI; Shri Mahaveer Singhvi, Ministry of External Affairs, Government of India
summary_one_liner: Making AI affordable and accessible across India's diverse landscape
icebreaker: Brad, what's one TCO barrier you're seeing block AI adoption in tier-2 Indian cities?
networking_tip: CIOs and policy makers attend—have concrete case studies on cost reduction ready for the Q&A.

title: Sovereign AI Infrastructure for Bharat and Global South
description: India's strategic AI infrastructure must be built around three core pillars: security, sustainability, and open standards. Aligned with the objectives of Atmanirbhar Bharat and Digital Personal Data Protection (DPDP) compliance, this session examines the emerging architecture of sovereign compute ecosystems, including edge–cloud convergence for next-generation (6G) networks, neuromorphic computing, and low-precision inference systems designed for scalable deployment. It further explores multi-agent orchestration frameworks and cross-sector compute-exchange models that can expand access to high-performance computing for startups, academia, and public institutions. Such an approach aims to democratise advanced computational resources while strengthening India's long-term digital sovereignty, innovation capacity, and research acceleration.
speakers: Ajay Sehgal, Fractal; Kautsarina Adam, Jio Platforms; Rachel Adams, Bharat Gen; Srikant Velmakani, Fractal; Tarun Dua, Networks for Humanity
summary_one_liner: Building India's self-reliant compute backbone for digital sovereignty
icebreaker: Srikant, how is edge-cloud convergence reshaping India's sovereign AI infrastructure roadmap?
networking_tip: Deep tech founders and telecom CTOs are here—pitch infrastructure partnerships during the networking break.

title: Innovating Together: Harnessing Open-Source AI for Inclusive Economic Development
description: This session marks the official release of the policy brief titled, 'Advancing Open-Source AI in India: Recommendations for Governments and Technology Developers', published jointly by the IndiaAI Mission, FAIR Forward – Artificial Intelligence for All, Digital Futures Lab, and Nasscom. Developed through extensive expert consultations, this policy brief provides a blueprint for promoting open-source AI in India, outlining its key opportunities and potential challenges and risks.
speakers: Dr Bärbel Kofler, Federal Ministry for Economic Cooperation and Development, Germany; Dr Urvashi Aneja, Digital Futures Lab; Mr M Chockalingam, Nasscom AI; Ms Amanda Brock, OpenUK; Ms Lea Gimpel, Digital Public Goods Alliance; Ms Yasha Khandelwal, Tech4Biz
summary_one_liner: Official policy blueprint for open-source AI adoption in India launched
icebreaker: Dr. Aneja, what surprised you most while researching open-source AI adoption barriers in India?
networking_tip: Policy influencers dominate—ask about their organization's AI governance priorities to find collaboration angles.

title: Trusted AI: Practical Pathways for the Public Sector
description: Anchored in the 'Safe and Trusted AI' guiding principle of the India AI Impact Summit 2026, this moderated dialogue will explore how public-sector organizations can move from principles to practice by operationalizing assurance by design. The session will focus on practical, scalable approaches to pre-deployment assurance, human accountability, organizational readiness, and post-deployment oversight that enable responsible AI adoption at scale.
speakers: Anusha Dandapani, United Nations International Computing Centre (UNICC); Dr. Angela Lusigi, United Nations Development Program; Katharina Frey, United Nations International Computing Centre (UNICC); Robyn Scott, UNICC; Sameer Chauhan, United Nations International Computing Centre (UNICC)
summary_one_liner: Operationalizing trusted AI assurance for public sector organizations
icebreaker: Katharina, how do UN agencies balance AI innovation speed with the assurance frameworks your members require?
networking_tip: Public sector leaders cluster together—position yourself near the registration area to join their conversations.

title: From Volume to Value: Role of AI in Redefining Indian Pharma's Leadership for Viksit Bharat 2047
description: AI can accelerate Indian pharmaceutical innovation – driving economic growth and social good. The discussion will focus on how organizations can deploy AI across R&D and operations and scale responsibly to improve access to affordable innovative medicines. It will also address the ecosystem and policy enablers required for India to move up the value chain and advance the Viksit Bharat 2047 vision.
speakers: Dr Amit Sheth, Indian AI Research Organisation; Dr Sharvil Patel, Zydus Lifesciences; Mr Sudarshan Jain, Indian Pharmaceutical Alliance (IPA); Mr Winselow Tucker, Eli Lilly (India); Priyanka Aggarwal, BCG
summary_one_liner: AI-driven pharma innovation to make Indian medicines globally competitive
icebreaker: Dr. Sheth, how is AI reducing time-to-market for generic drug candidates in your research pipeline?
networking_tip: Pharma R&D leaders and biotech founders attend—have drug discovery acceleration metrics ready.

title: India Energy Stack (IES) and the AI-Ready Power Sector: Trust, Interoperability, and Scale
description: The power sector is entering a pivotal decade as renewables, electrification, and distributed resources make grid operations real time and complex. AI can enhance forecasting, optimization, and asset management, but fragmented data and systems limit scale. The India Energy Stack offers interoperable digital building blocks—shared identifiers, registries, standard protocols, verifiable credentials, and policy as code—to enable trust, reduce integration costs, expand consumer agency, and unlock participation, livelihoods, and innovation across millions of devices and actors.
speakers: Ms. Swetha Ravi Kumar, FSR Global; Sh Jitendra Srivastava, REC; Sh Pankaj Kumar, UPPCL; Sh Reji Pillai, ISGF; Sh RS Sharma, India Energy Stack; Sh. Prince Dhawan, REC
summary_one_liner: Nandan Nilekani unveils digital building blocks for AI-powered energy grids
icebreaker: Nandan, how does the India Energy Stack framework enable real-time AI forecasting across distributed grids?
networking_tip: Energy CIOs and utility execs are decision-makers—focus on grid optimization ROI during discussions.

title: Data for Development: Building AI in the Global South
description: As AI scales globally, access to high-quality, interoperable, and responsibly governed data is becoming a key determinant of development outcomes. This session explores data as critical public infrastructure, focusing on governance frameworks, institutional capacity, and international cooperation needed to support AI-led growth in the Global South. The discussion also highlights the evolving approach to data governance and its relevance for emerging economies, with a focus on equity, inclusion, and development-first AI pathways.
speakers: Alok Kumar Rai, IIM Calcutta; Anne Neuberger, US Government; Ashish Chahuan, National Stock Exchange; Dr. Madan Mohan Tripathi, National Institute of Electronics & Information Technology; Manoj Kumar Tiwari, Indian Institute of Management, Mumbai; Prof. Shalabh, IIT, Kanpur
knowledge_partners: Center of Policy Research and Governance
summary_one_liner: Data governance frameworks powering AI-driven development in emerging economies
icebreaker: Anne, what data interoperability standards are most critical for AI development in the Global South?
networking_tip: Development economists and policy makers dominate—reference specific countries to spark partnership conversations.

title: From Opportunity to Impact: Sharing the Israeli Model of AI Innovation and Governance
description: This event will showcase Israel's national AI model — prioritizing innovation, research, and agile governance over restrictive regulation—to drive social, economic, and public-service transformation. It highlights Israel's strengths (innovation hub, elite technical talent, collaborative public-private partnerships). The session features short talks on national strategy, AI in agriculture, personalized education, future of work, and industry leadership, aiming to share best practices and forge international partnerships.
speakers: Brigadier General (Res.) Erez Naftali Askal, Israel Artificial Intelligence Directorate; Dr. Victor Alchanatis, DSc., Volcani Institute, Ministry of Agriculture; Dr. Victor Israel Gosalker, Horizon Line Division; H.E. Reuven Azar, Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Israel; Mr. Avner Vilan, AI21; Ms. Inbal Mashash, Israel Employment Service; Ms. Meirav Zerbib, Ministry of Education, Innovation and Technology Administration
knowledge_partners: Ministry of Foreign Affairs and the Ministry of Innovation, Science and Technology
summary_one_liner: Israel shares its national AI innovation and governance model
icebreaker: Which Israeli AI innovation model resonates most with your country's startup ecosystem?
networking_tip: Catch bilateral delegates early—they're comparing notes on AI policy frameworks and partner selection.

title: AI in Agriculture
summary_one_liner: AI applications transforming agriculture, food systems, and rural resilience
icebreaker: Explore how AI is solving farmer-centric challenges in crop yield and resource optimization
networking_tip: Connect with agritech founders and solution providers on market traction and scalability

title: Best practices from the International Network for Advanced AI Measurement, Evaluation and Science.
description: This panel discusses best practices from the International Network for Advanced AI Measurement, Evaluation and Science, focusing on shared learnings, evaluation challenges, and how governments and industry can collaborate and share knowledge globally.
speakers: Adam Beaumont, UK AISI; Austin Mayron, US CAISI; Chris Meserole, Frontier Model Forum; Sara Hooker, Adaption Labs; Wan Sie Lee, Singapore AISI
summary_one_liner: Global best practices for AI measurement, evaluation, and government science
icebreaker: Ask Sara Hooker about Adaption Labs' approach to measuring AI safety and real-world impact

title: Building Anti-Fragile AI Startups in 2026
description: As foundational models mature into a standardized "utility," the 2026 startup battleground has shifted from raw compute to operational ingenuity. This session explores how the next generation of founders is leveraging agentic autonomy to build "lean giants"—highly resilient companies that maintain minimal headcount while achieving massive, industrial-scale output.
room: Hall No. 4 First Floor - Session Hall 2
speakers:
Sh. Paige Bailey, Engineering Lead for GenAI Developer Experience at Google
; Sh. Manik Pasricha

networking_tip: Connect with MeitY Startup Hub for government incentives; ask about lean-giant operational metrics.

title: Opportunities in the Steel Sector: An interaction with Secretary, Ministry of Steel
description: This session, Opportunities in the Steel Sector, features an interactive discussion with the Secretary of the Ministry of Steel. It explores emerging trends, investment prospects, and policy initiatives shaping India's steel industry. Participants will gain insights into strategic opportunities across production, technology adoption, sustainability, and infrastructure development. The session also addresses challenges, government support mechanisms, and pathways for innovation, providing stakeholders with a comprehensive understanding of how to navigate and capitalize on growth in the steel sector.

Shri Sandeep Poundrik, Secreatary, Ministry of Steel
