title: Trust in AI: Navigating Ethics and Policy
description: As AI underpins public services, infrastructure, and global commerce, building trustworthy systems is essential. This panel unites leaders across government, technology, and industry to explore frameworks that strengthen trust, accountability, and security. It examines shifting from aspirational ethics to enforceable governance standards, compares global regulatory models such as the EU AI Act and Global South approaches, promotes democratic oversight in policymaking, and advances international coordination to address risks like deepfakes, misinformation, and bias.
room: Hall No. 3 First Floor - Session Hall 4
speakers:
Srinivas Mantripragada, Founder, Maaya AI
; Manish Kumar, Founder, Rooman Technologies Ltd.
; Brando Benifei, Member of European Parliament 
; Vinesh Sukumar, Vice President - Head of GEN AI | Agentic AI | Voice AI | Sensing AI - Qualcomm
; Daniel Dobos, Research Director, Swisscom

summary_one_liner: Ethics and policy frameworks for building trustworthy AI systems globally
icebreaker: Ask Brando Benifei about EU AI Act alignment with India's emerging governance frameworks.
networking_tip: Connect EU Parliament members with Indian regulators; compare accountability mechanisms.

title: NeevCloud AI SuperCloud: Democratizing High-Performance AI Infrastructure for India's Innovation, Research & Growth
description: This session, Opportunities in the Steel Sector, features an interactive discussion with the Secretary of the Ministry of Steel. It explores emerging trends, investment prospects, and policy initiatives shaping India's steel industry. Participants will gain insights into strategic opportunities across production, technology adoption, sustainability, and infrastructure development. The session also addresses challenges, government support mechanisms, and pathways for innovation, providing stakeholders with a comprehensive understanding of how to navigate and capitalize on growth in the steel sector.
room: Hall No. 4 First Floor - Session Hall 3

icebreaker: Explore NeevCloud's API pricing models and academic research partnership opportunities.

summary_one_liner: Artificial intelligence applications and innovation in agricultural sector
icebreaker: Ask about precision agriculture AI use cases succeeding at scale in Indian farms.

speakers: Anne Neuberger, Strategic Advisor, Cisco; Raj Shukla, Member, UPSC; Moderator: Jyotsna Jayaram, Partner-Technology, Media and Telecom, Trilegal
summary_one_liner: Strategic perspectives on AI, security, and governance from policy and tech leaders
icebreaker: Ask Anne Neuberger about Cisco's stance on AI security in critical infrastructure.
networking_tip: Connect UPSC member Shukla with tech founders on policy-compliant product design.

title: AI & Global Diplomacy: Power, Partnerships, and the Future of Science
description: As artificial intelligence reshapes economies and geopolitics, science is no longer confined to laboratories—it is central to diplomacy. This session explores how AI is redefining global power, strategic partnerships, technology alliances, and international governance. Leaders will discuss India's role in shaping responsible AI frameworks, fostering cross-border collaboration, and strengthening science diplomacy in an era of rapid technological transformation.
speakers: Alan John Kwadwo Kyerematen, Previous Minister of Ghana; Amb Hugo Ortiz Dubon, El Salvador to the EU, Belgium and Luxembourg; Amb Lavina, African Union; Oluyemi Oluleke Osinbajo, Nigeria
summary_one_liner: AI's role in reshaping global diplomacy, geopolitics, and international partnerships
icebreaker: Ask African Union ambassador about South-South AI collaboration opportunities beyond Western frameworks.
networking_tip: Exchange notes with West African and El Salvadoran envoys on AI sovereignty initiatives.

title: Advancing LLM Training At Extreme Scale
description: As large language models (LLMs) push toward trillion-parameter frontiers, training at extreme scale demands unprecedented compute efficiency, resilience, and orchestration across thousands of GPUs. This NVIDIA session reveals how the NeMo Framework - leveraging Megatron-Core for tensor, pipeline, sequence, expert parallelism, FP8 precision, and multi-data center support - enables 96% scaling efficiency on 3,072+ H100/H200 GPUs, as demonstrated in Nemotron-4 340B training across distant sites. NVIDIA's Blackwell platform and GB200 NVL72 systems supercharge this with 30x faster real-time inference, disaggregated serving via Dynamo for prefill/decode optimization, and resilient features like auto-failover on DGX Cloud for <1% downtime at 10K-GPU scales. Attendees will gain actionable insights into post-training scaling laws, synthetic data generation, reinforcement learning, and JAX-based horizontal scaling to 10,000+ GPUs, powering next-gen AI from GTC 2025/2026 innovations.
speakers: Bernard Nguyen
summary_one_liner: NVIDIA's extreme-scale LLM training with NeMo and Blackwell platforms
icebreaker: Bernard, what's the biggest orchestration bottleneck you're seeing when scaling beyond 10K GPUs?
networking_tip: Target ML engineers during breaks—they'll want specifics on NeMo optimization patterns before leaving.

title: Keynote
speakers: Jay Chaudhry, Chief Executive Officer, Chairman and Founder, Zscaler, Inc.
summary_one_liner: Zscaler CEO on AI, cybersecurity, and enterprise transformation trends
icebreaker: Ask Jay Chaudhry about zero-trust AI architectures and his 2026 security predictions.
networking_tip: Follow up on Zscaler partnership programs; seek enterprise security AI vendor relationships.

title: Catalysing Inclusive AI-Enabled Science Through Global Collaboration
description: This session discusses the importance of inclusive and collaborative approaches to harnessing AI for Science and how global scientific ecosystems can be made more inclusive.
speakers: Shri. Abhay Karandikar, Chair; Canada, Co-Chair ; Singapore, Co-Chair
summary_one_liner: Global collaboration for inclusive, equitable AI-enabled science
icebreaker: How is Abhay Karandikar's leadership shaping inclusive AI science globally?
networking_tip: Connect with policy leaders from Canada and Singapore on cross-border AI collaboration frameworks.

title: Keynote
speakers: Sridhar Vembu, Co-founder and Chief Scientist, Zoho Corporation
summary_one_liner: Zoho founder on enterprise AI innovation and transformation
icebreaker: Ask Sridhar Vembu about Zoho's latest AI investments in the Global South.
networking_tip: Seek out enterprise CTOs in the plenary—they're likely evaluating AI vendors post-keynote.

title: Unlocking Insights for all with Data Commons
description: This session explores how Data Commons transforms static, siloed information into a dynamic, AI-ready resource for citizens, businesses, and policymakers. Through a technical demo of its natural language interface and "Bring Your Own Data" architecture, attendees will see how the platform democratizes evidence-based intelligence while maintaining strict security. The event concludes with an expert panel focused on utilizing these scalable insights to drive informed, real-world decision-making.
room: Hall No. 4 First Floor - Session Hall 2
speakers:
Sh. Gaurav Godhwani, Co-founder & Executive Director, CivicDataLab 

; Sh. Prem Ramaswami

; Smt. Aparajita Choudhury, Lead Data & AI Solution at People+ai, EkStep Foundation 
; Dr. Srinath Srinivasa, Dean (R&D) at the International Institute of Information Technology – Bangalore (IIITB)
; Sh. Rohit Bhardwaj, Deputy Director General, Data Informatics & Innovation Division (DIID) at NSO India
summary_one_liner: AI-powered Data Commons democratizing access for all stakeholders
icebreaker: Ask Gaurav Godhwani how CivicDataLab's 'Bring Your Own Data' architecture scales NLP access.
networking_tip: Connect with EkStep Foundation and People+ai teams to explore data partnerships.

title: Keynote for Research Symposium by Prof. Yoshua Bengio (Professor of Computer Science, Université de Montréal)
speakers: Prof Yoshua Bengio (Professor of Computer Science, Université de Montréal); Dr Kalika Bali (Moderator) (Senior Principal Researcher, Microsoft Research)
summary_one_liner: Deep Learning pioneer on AI's societal impact and research frontiers
icebreaker: What's Yoshua Bengio's latest thinking on safety in frontier AI systems?
networking_tip: Network with Microsoft Research and academic faculty—this attracts serious AI researchers.

title: Healthcare for All: Inclusive AI Solutions at Population Scale
description: This session examines scaling secure AI within national health frameworks. Panelists discuss how technologies like NVIDIA's NIM and NeMo enable real-time disease prediction and multilingual diagnostics in resource-constrained rural clinics. The discussion highlights how regional compute hubs reduce technological dependency while empowering locally-developed healthcare solutions. This operationalizes the People Sutra and Inclusion for Social Empowerment Chakra through environmentally sustainable, equitably accessible healthcare innovation with insights from leaders.
speakers: Prateek Sharma, Health AI; Raghav Mani, Nvidia; Sabine Kapasi, ENIRA Consulting; Shailendra Hegde, Gates Foundation; Siddharth Panwar, NeuroDX AI (Intellihealth); Sunil Kumar Barnwal,  National Health Authority, GoI
summary_one_liner: NVIDIA-powered AI enabling rural healthcare diagnostics at population scale
icebreaker: Raghav, what multilingual diagnostic challenges did you solve deploying NIM at population scale?
networking_tip: Clinical AI researchers and HealthTech founders mix here—demo your rural-focused solutions early.

title: AI for Resilience: Powering Innovation and Efficiency in the Energy Transition
description: As the energy transition accelerates, power systems are being reshaped by renewable integration, decentralised assets, and rising reliability expectations. This session explores how artificial intelligence can strengthen resilience, drive innovation, and improve efficiency across the energy value chain. Through real-world applications and policy perspectives, the discussion will examine AI-enabled forecasting, automation, and decision-making, alongside governance and workforce considerations, to support scalable, secure, and responsible deployment for a sustainable and future-ready energy ecosystem.
speakers: Mr. Abhishek Ranjan, BSES Rajdhani Power Limited (BRPL); Mr. Ashish Khanna, International Solar Alliance (ISA); Mr. Ashish Kumar Goyal, Uttar Pradesh Power Corporation Limited(UPPCL); Mr. Dwijadas Basak, Tata Power Delhi Distribution Ltd; Mr. Ghanshyam Prasad, Central Electricity Authority (CEA); Mr. Naveen Srivastava, Power Grid Corporation of India Limited (PGCIL); Mr. Prashant Dangash, Impresa.ai; Mr. Reji Kumar Pillai, India Smart Grid Forum (ISGF); Mr. Siddharth Arora, Energiva Ventures Pvt. Ltd.; Ms. Disha Khosla, India Smart Grid Forum (ISGF); Ms. Jaqueline Cochran, National Renewable Energy Laboratory (NREL); Ms. Reena Suri, India Smart Grid Forum (ISGF)
summary_one_liner: AI-driven forecasting and automation for resilient renewable energy grids
icebreaker: Reji Kumar Pillai and Siddharth Arora are tackling renewable AI at scale—how are you balancing grid resilience with decentralization?
networking_tip: High decision-maker density: utility CIOs lunch together. Invite yourself or position near the registration table during breaks.

title: From Access to Agency: The Charter for the Democratic Diffusion of AI
description: This session discusses practical pathways as well as role of international cooperation for enabling access and affordability of foundational AI resources, including compute, datasets, and models.
speakers: Shri. Saurabh Garg, Chair ; Egypt, Co-Chair ; Kenya, Co-Chair
summary_one_liner: Democratic access to AI compute, datasets, and models for Global South
icebreaker: How are Egypt and Kenya shaping affordable AI access under this charter with Saurabh Garg?
networking_tip: This attracts impact investors and multilateral development leaders—position early.

title: Open AI Platforms: Building India's Unified Public Goods
description: This session examines how open AI frameworks enable interoperability across digital public infrastructure in India and the Global South. The discussion explores how open standards and protocols allow nations to integrate AI capabilities without vendor lock-in. Panelists discuss federated analytics, cross-sector collaboration in healthcare and agriculture, and data sovereignty. This operationalizes the Democratizing AI Resources and Science Chakras, demonstrating impact through accelerated service delivery, reduced costs, and accessible tools empowering innovation.
speakers: Keyzom Ngodup Massally; Nabiha Syed; Pradeep Gupta; Tanvi Lall
summary_one_liner: Open AI standards enabling vendor-free digital public infrastructure at scale
icebreaker: Nabiha Syed focuses on data sovereignty—how are you thinking about API standardization for your platform?
networking_tip: Platform architects cluster together early; find Pradeep Gupta's breakout session for deep dives on federated analytics implementation.

title: AI for Energy Systems/Utilities
description: Amid rising energy demands from AI data centers, renewables, and electrification, utilities and energy firms grapple with grid stability, predictive maintenance, and subsurface uncertainties. This NVIDIA speaker session unveils accelerated AI platforms - like Jetson for edge AI, Omniverse digital twins, and Grace Hopper Superchips - that revolutionize power utilities and upstream exploration. Key highlights include generative AI for real-time grid management, EV integration, and battery optimization, alongside subsurface breakthroughs: NVIDIA-powered seismic processing for fault detection in 3D models, physics-informed neural networks (PhysicsNeMo) for reservoir simulations, NLP/LLMs integrating well logs/seismic data with partners like Shell and Saudi Aramco, and high-performance imaging via collaborations with SLB and Shearwater for CO2 storage and production forecasting. Attendees will explore the latest strides NVIDIA is making to improve energy efficiency (tokens per watt per dollar), accelerate simulations, reduce emissions, and optimize workflows from exploration to delivery - enabling a more resilient, low-carbon energy ecosystem.
speakers: Srikanth Kodali
summary_one_liner: NVIDIA's full AI stack revolutionizing energy exploration and grid management
icebreaker: Srikanth Kodali's covering NVIDIA Omniverse for digital twins—are you solving grid stability or predictive maintenance first?
networking_tip: Energy data scientists and geophysicists rarely meet; arrive 10min early to claim a front-row seat for technical Q&A access.

title: Unleashing Impact: Building the Purpose-Driven Data and AI Workforce
description: This panel session will reflect upon perspectives from members of a global ecosystem of over 100 partners and other leaders who are advancing interdisciplinary data and AI training across climate, health, and financial inclusion. This session will explore how this network is accelerating a workforce that will power an inclusive, resilient, and more prosperous future.
speakers: Bayo (Olubayo) Adekanmbi; Dr. Tavpritesh Sethi; Neha Malhotra Singh; Perry Hewitt; Pratibha Kurnool; Priyank Hirani; Tithee Mukhopadhyay; Uyi Stewart
summary_one_liner: Training an interdisciplinary AI workforce for climate, health, and inclusion
icebreaker: Dr. Tavpritesh Sethi's built AI training across climate and health—which sector's talent gap keeps you up at night?
networking_tip: 100+ global partners means siloed conversations; use the panel's interdisciplinary angle to connect EdTech with NGO leaders.

title: AI Impact Forum: Democratising AI Resources
description: Unlocking AI's full potential for all. Explore how to bridge gaps in skills, data access, tech infrastructure, and funding to drive innovation and inclusivity. Join industry leaders as they share insights on democratizing AI resources, shaping the future of technology and business.
speakers: Anne Neuberger; Anshu Sharma; Deepak Ajwani; Dr Vishal Sikka; Gokul Subramaniam; Hari Shetty; Kalyan Kumar; Mustafa Furniturewala; Sunil Gupta
summary_one_liner: Top industry leaders chart the path to democratizing AI globally
icebreaker: Dr. Vishal Sikka's bridging AI access gaps—what's your biggest bottleneck: data, infrastructure, or funding?
networking_tip: C-suite executives and Series A founders attend; skip the keynote line, network at sponsor booths where decision-makers linger.

title: From Evidence to Scale: Testing, Financing and Operationalizing Technology and AI for Development and Humanitarian Action.
description: AI is increasingly empowering agriculture, food security, rural development, and humanitarian response for those most in need. This session convenes international agencies and government partners to examine how field-tested AI solutions move from pilots to sustainable scale, benefiting both communities and internal processes. The discussion focuses on examples, evidence, governance safeguards, financing pathways, and digital public infrastructure, advancing the Summit's shift from dialogue to impact.
speakers: Brenda Gunde; Dr Venkatramanan Anantha Nageswaran; Indran Naidoo. Director; Magan Naidoo; Vaishnavi Pavithran; Vincent Martin
knowledge_partners: The International Fund for Agricultural Development (IFAD)
summary_one_liner: Scaling field-tested AI from humanitarian pilots to sustainable national impact
icebreaker: Indran Naidoo connects humanitarian AI to food security—are you scaling in agriculture or disaster response first?
networking_tip: Gov officials, impact investors, and AgriTech founders rarely overlap; volunteer for the panel's closing discussion to network intimately.

title: Democratizing Compute Through Regional Infrastructure
description: This session examines infrastructure for achieving gigawatt-scale compute capacity across emerging economies. As nations transition from data generation to domestic processing, the discussion explores building industrial-scale data centers. Panelists demonstrate how advanced GPU architectures and networking, such as NVIDIA's DGX SuperPOD and Grace CPU, enable self-reliant infrastructure across regional hubs. This operationalizes the Democratizing AI Resources Chakra, demonstrating impact through increased compute capacity, reduced latency, and accelerated transformation.
speakers: Anne Robinson; Durga Malladi; Ipsita Dasgupta; Magnus Ewerbring,; Neeraj Kumar; Roy George; Srikanth Cherukuri
summary_one_liner: Building gigawatt-scale regional compute hubs for emerging economies
icebreaker: Magnus Ewerbring and Neeraj Kumar are scaling gigawatt compute in emerging markets—where's your data center bottleneck?
networking_tip: Data center architects dominate; identify keynote speakers' companies beforehand and request 1-on-1s during the infrastructure deep-dive.

title: From Principles to Proof: Operationalizing Responsible AI for Global Impact
description: Responsible AI, particularly for the Global South, is both moral mandate and strategic lever. This session explores how safety-by-design catalyzes scale, addressing linguistic and cultural nuance. The discussion bridges technical guardrails like hardware-level privacy and confidential computing with societal needs for safe AI experiences. Panelists examine how inclusive systems empower the last mile and mitigate harm, operationalizing the People and Progress Sutras through the Safe and Trusted AI Chakra for equitable adoption.
speakers: Anand Kashyap; Balaraman Ravindran; Moderator: Tom David; Mohit Kapoor; Tarunima Prabhakar
summary_one_liner: Translating responsible AI principles into real-world technical safety guardrails
icebreaker: Tarunima Prabhakar's embedding AI safety by design—how are you handling linguistic nuance in your guardrails?
networking_tip: ML engineers and ethics officers have different concerns; attend both breakouts and join the moderator's follow-up coffee session.

title: AI for Weather and Climate Intelligence
description: Climate change requires scalable AI solutions for mitigation, adaptation, and resilience. GPU-accelerated computing and AI are transforming high-resolution modeling, predictive analytics, and decision support for weather & climate applications. This session highlights NVIDIA's Earth-2 and Omniverse. Earth-2 builds digital twins with observational and simulation data, open AI models, and a full software stack for forecasting, data assimilation, and informatics. Omniverse enables interactive visualization for scenario exploration. Applications span disaster preparedness, risk assessment, urban resilience, renewables, and sustainability -- delivering faster, cost-effective insights for real-world impact.
speakers: Karthik Kashinath
summary_one_liner: NVIDIA Earth-2 digital twins transforming climate prediction and disaster resilience
icebreaker: Karthik Kashinath's Earth-2 digital twins are reshaping climate modeling—how are you using GPU acceleration in your forecasting?
networking_tip: Climate scientists are research-focused; ask speakers about unpublished work and academic collaboration—they'll engage deeply.

title: AI for Everyone: Empowering People, Businesses, and Society
description: This session explores how responsible, inclusive, and people-centric adoption of AI by everyone can do global good. Anchored on the pillars of People, Planet, and Progress, it will examine how AI can accelerate innovation, enhance productivity, strengthen global partnerships, and reinforce India's leadership in the decade ahead. The discussion will also focus on aligning AI with societal priorities to build trust, enable sustainable development, and advance shared national progress.
speakers: Mr. Anshal Dwivedi; Mr. Deepit Purkayastha; Mr. Mahanaryaman Scindia; Mr. Pradeep Rao; Mr. Pulkit Swarup; Mr. Sanjay Varnwal; Shri K. Prathap Siva Kishore; Shri Lav Agarwal
summary_one_liner: People-centric AI adoption reinforcing India's global innovation leadership
icebreaker: Shri Lav Agarwal and Mr. Sanjay Varnwal are anchoring India's AI-for-all agenda—how are you embedding inclusive AI in your strategy?
networking_tip: Gov officials and business leaders separate naturally; position yourself at the crossover moment during the People/Planet/Progress panel pivot.

title: Powering the Public Good: Aligning Industry, Philanthropy, and Government from India to Africa
description:
Two powerhouses of technology and philanthropy will share their unique perspectives on how collaboration across the public and private sectors can advance national AI priorities, spur innovation, and deliver public value.
The conversation will continue with African government leaders in AI discussing pathways for global cooperation, pooled resources, and inclusive impact.
Bringing together leaders from industry, philanthropy, and government, the session aims to translate national AI visions into coordinated, real-world outcomes.
speakers: Cina Lawson; Diana Sang; Lacina Kone; Nandan Nilekani; Paula Ingabire; Priya Vora; Strive Masiyiwa
summary_one_liner: Tech titans and African ministers forge cross-continent AI cooperation pact
icebreaker: Nandan Nilekani's work on digital public goods—how do you see AI fitting into India's digital infrastructure?
networking_tip: Target Strive Masiyiwa and Paula Ingabire during breaks—Africa-focused investors seek India partnerships for cross-border AI solutions.

title: What if Fairness started at the Dataset Level? Need for a Fair Human-Centric Image Dataset for Ethical AI Benchmarking
description: The session explains why fairness must start at the dataset level and offers practical guidance for researchers, startups, and policymakers in India to adopt fairness-first AI evaluation practices. It would also delve into why a consent-driven, globally diverse, ethically sourced dataset for fairness and bias evaluation in human-centric computer vision is a necessity.
speakers: Sruti Nagpal
summary_one_liner: Why ethical AI benchmarking must begin with fair, diverse datasets
icebreaker: Sruti Nagpal on dataset fairness—what's the biggest bias you've caught in your own CV models?
networking_tip: Connect early with AI Ethics Officers and ML Engineers; technical depth invites deep shop talks on benchmarking methodologies.

title: Vision, Learnings, and Next Steps for Andhra Pradesh's AI-Powered Agriculture and Allied Sectors Transformation
description: This panel explores Andhra Pradesh's journey toward an AI-enabled agriculture and allied-sector intelligence system that strengthens advisory and proactive Rythu Seva Kendram (RSK) planning for smallholder and tenant farmers. The Special Chief Secretary will outline the state's vision and priorities, Interventionists will share the journey from AP-AIMS 1.0 to 2.0, discuss their AP-AIMS aligned work in horticulture, livestock, and aquaculture, alongside frontier-tech and AI solution piloting.
speakers: Ms Deepa Karthykeyan; Ms Srivalli Krishnan; Shri Budithi Rajshekar; Shri Nikhilesh Kumar; Shri Nitish Kumar
knowledge_partners: Department of Agriculture, Government of Andhra Pradesh
summary_one_liner: Andhra Pradesh's AI journey transforming agriculture for smallholder farmers
icebreaker: Ask Deepa Karthykeyan how RSK advisory systems handle farmer preferences across different crops—real deployment challenge.
networking_tip: Ag-tech founders: corner state officials before panel ends. High decision-maker density means budget holders are present.

title: Where AI Innovation meets Impact in Cancer Care—CATCH Grant Awards 2026
description: The IndiaAI–NCG CATCH Grant Ceremony at the IndiaAI Impact Summit recognises AI innovations in cancer care, highlighting solutions that are clinically relevant, evidence-driven, and deployment-ready. Alongside the awards, a multi-stakeholder dialogue will explore how AI can move from pilot initiatives to scalable and trusted healthcare systems. Bringing together stakeholders from government, clinical practice, industry, and international partners, the session will discuss pathways for responsible and impact-focused AI deployment in oncology.
speakers: Dr Harit Chaturvedi; Dr.  Alain Labrique; Dr. Anunaya Jain; Mr. Harish Iyer; Shri. Abhishek Singh
summary_one_liner: Recognizing breakthrough AI innovations transforming cancer care delivery
icebreaker: Dr. Harit Chaturvedi—beyond accuracy, what oncology AI challenges did top CATCH Grant winners actually solve?
networking_tip: Position yourself near award winners post-ceremony. Clinical validation stories attract health policy makers and impact investors.

title: Equipping the Judiciary to Harness the Power of AI
description: Artificial Intelligence (AI) is transforming justice delivery worldwide, bringing both extraordinary opportunities and complex risks for the rule of law and human rights. Courts and tribunals are increasingly leveraging AI to streamline operations, access legal knowledge, and enhance transparency.
speakers: Dr. Tawfik  Jelassi; Gilmar  Mendes; Ma'aly  Hazzaz; Ms. Jhalak  Kakkar; Ms. Lodovica  Raparelli; Prof.  Srikrishna  Deva Rao; Prof. Jon  Mark Truby; Utkarsh  Saxena
summary_one_liner: Global judiciary leaders explore AI's role in transforming justice delivery
icebreaker: Prof. Jon Mark Truby on AI risks in justice—how do courts balance due process with deployment speed?
networking_tip: Judicial officers rarely attend tech events. Introduce yourself early and frame your work around rule-of-law, not just tech.

title: Balancing Sovereignty and Collaboration: AI Frameworks for Nations
description: This session examines how nations, particularly across the Global South, harness AI for transformation while balancing sovereignty with cooperation. Panelists explore frameworks for responsible AI deployment addressing governance, security, cross-border data flows, and beneficial applications. The discussion tackles why shared development remains essential for transnational challenges like climate adaptation, even as nations build indigenous capabilities. This advances all three Sutras—People, Planet, and Progress—demonstrating impact through improved collaboration, strengthened capabilities, and equitable access.
speakers: Elizabeth Kelly; Shilpa Kolhatkar; Tulio Andrade
summary_one_liner: Frameworks for sovereign AI balanced with essential global cooperation
icebreaker: Elizabeth Kelly—what data sovereignty frameworks are actually working for Global South nations?
networking_tip: This high-level policy crowd favors 1-on-1 conversations. Grab coffee with diplomats and think tank leaders during breaks.

title: NVIDIA x Activate: Building AI Companies in India from Day Zero
description:
India has one of the world's deepest pools of AI and engineering talent, but many of its most promising AI companies struggle to form due to a lack of early technical, institutional, and ecosystem support at the idea stage.In this session, NVIDIA and Activate will formally announce their partnership to support AI founders at the inception stage - from idea to first product and company formation - through NVIDIA's global Inception program and Activate's inception investing model.

The session will unpack

● What it takes to build globally competitive AI companies from India
● Why the earliest stage ("day zero") is the highest-leverage point for founders
● How founders can access technical enablement, ecosystem support, and capital early

The session will conclude with an interactive discussion and founder Q&A.
speakers: Tobias Halloran
summary_one_liner: NVIDIA and Activate launch partnership backing India's earliest-stage AI founders
icebreaker: Tobias Halloran—beyond NVIDIA's support, what's the biggest gap between India's talent and what founders actually need?
networking_tip: NVIDIA brings institutional credibility. Investors attend here—demo your GTM, not just your model.

title: Empowering Billions: AI, Health Records, and the Future of People-Powered Care
description: This session examines how people-centred digital health infrastructure can enable trustworthy AI at population scale. It explores secure, portable health records, consent-based data sharing, and interoperability, and how national digital health programmes around the world can learn from each other and adapt global best practices. Drawing on national digital public systems and international best practices, the discussion addresses governance of agentic health tools, cross-border data mobility, and equitable, standards-based collaboration to advance people-powered care worldwide.
speakers: Dr. Anand Iyer; Dr. Rajendra Pratap Gupta; Dr. Sunil Kumar Barnwal, IAS; Mr. Aneesh Chopra; Mr. Maneesh Goyal; Ms. Mevish P. Vaishnav
summary_one_liner: Secure digital health records enabling trustworthy AI-powered care worldwide
icebreaker: Dr. Anand Iyer on consent-based health data—how do you scale trust when patients fear data leaks?
networking_tip: Hospital CIOs and health policy makers are decision-makers. Prepare use cases, not research papers.

title: Scaling Trusted AI for 8 Billion+
description: Leading US and Indian voices will explore AI collaboration under the TRUST initiative, exchanging perspectives on responsible AI and identifying opportunities to scale innovation, infrastructure, and impact across sectors fueling the global AI revolution. Leaders will inspire the next generation by showcasing bold "moonshot ideas" that could transform India and the world over the next 10-25 years, shaping an AI-led world order in education, healthcare, agriculture, national security, and beyond.
speakers: Aparna Bawa; Bipul Sinha; Brad Smith; Dr. Mukesh Aghi; Marya Shakil; Umesh Sachdev
summary_one_liner: Microsoft's Brad Smith and US-India leaders showcase AI moonshot ideas
icebreaker: Brad Smith on US-India AI collaboration—what TRUST initiative projects are actually moving capital?
networking_tip: Heavy hitter event with C-Suite attendance. Schedule 1-on-1s pre-event. Skip generic networking, aim for 10-minute power conversations.

title: Unlocking India's Demographic Dividend: Blue Dots^AI as Digital Rails
description: This session examines how India can unlock its demographic dividend by aligning education, skilling, and workforce systems with the demands of an AI-driven economy. Drawing from public digital infrastructure, employer-linked skilling models, and ecosystem partnerships, the discussion focuses on scalable pathways to prepare India's workforce for future jobs while ensuring inclusion and access at population scale.
speakers: Shri Gaurav Gupta; Shri. Abhinav Gopal; Shri. Madan Padaki; Shri. Virender Singh; Smt. Manmeet Kaur Nanda
summary_one_liner: Digital rails aligning education and skilling for India's AI workforce
icebreaker: Shri Madan Padaki on AI-driven skilling—how are you measuring workforce readiness post-training?
networking_tip: EdTech founders and CHROs here. Share skilling outcomes and labor data—they buy solutions, not pitches.

title: Safe and Trusted Agentic AI: Building Accountability and Inclusion for India and the Global South
description: This expert panel session will explore the frontier of Agentic AI—autonomous systems capable of goal-directed behavior with limited human oversight—and its implications for safety, governance, and inclusivity across India and the Global South. Primarily, the session will examine frameworks for ensuring localized safety norms, ethical design, and accountability tailored to the cultural, linguistic, and infrastructural realities of the Global South.
speakers: Dr. Abdulrahman Habib; Dr. Sivaramakrishnan R. Guruvayur; Gabriela Ramos; Prof. (Dr.) Krishnashree Achuthan; Prof. Ganesh Ramakrishnan
summary_one_liner: Governance frameworks for autonomous agentic AI in the Global South
icebreaker: Dr. Sivaramakrishnan, how should developing nations approach agentic AI governance differently than the West?
networking_tip: Target policy makers and safety researchers during breaks—they're decision-makers with direct influence on AI regulation.

title: France India AI Initiative: A Shared Path to Ethical, Inclusive and Strategic Innovation
description: Launched at the AI Action Summit in Paris in 2025, the France–India AI Initiative has, over the past year, brought together Young Leaders and experts through a series of meetings, discussions, and conferences. This work has culminated in a three-part white paper—covering health, automotive, and regulation—offering recommendations to strengthen Franco-Indian cooperation by amplifying civil society voices. The discussion will review key findings, recommendations, and the initiative's future direction
speakers: Aakrit Vaish; Ahmed Baladi; Alexandre Mirlesse; Antoine Tesnière; Arthur Barichard; Laurie-Anne Ancenys; Neha Arolkar; Payal S Kanwar; Pratyush Kumar; Rahul Gaurav
summary_one_liner: Franco-Indian AI white paper on health, automotive, and regulation launched
icebreaker: Which sector—health AI or automotive—do you think bilateral France-India cooperation will impact first?
networking_tip: Diplomats and trade leaders often network in small groups; position yourself near speakers during Q&A to join conversations.

title: Responsible Quantum and AI Security Frontiers
description:
This panel will examine how emerging responsible quantum frameworks can guide the secure, ethical, and trustworthy development of quantum technologies, drawing lessons from the evolution of responsible AI governance. The discussion will focus on translating high-level principles—such as safety, accountability, transparency, and risk awareness—into practical measures that can be adopted by governments, industry, and research institutions.
It will also explore post-quantum cryptography readiness, security implications, and the shared responsibilities in preparing for quantum-era risks.
speakers: Mr. Oliver B; Mr. Sachin Kakkar; Mr. Vinayak Godse; Prof. Manish Gangwar
knowledge_partners: Indian School of Business ISB Institute of Data Science
summary_one_liner: Post-quantum cryptography readiness meets responsible AI governance frameworks
icebreaker: Mr. Vinayak, what's the biggest quantum security gap AI teams should prepare for today?
networking_tip: CISOs and deep tech founders cluster around technical panels—arrive early to secure seats near the front for post-panel conversations.

title: Advancing Multilingual AI: Global South Governance of Non-English Model Development and Deployment
description: Global initiatives are bridging the linguistic divide in AI by developing multilingual resources. Key efforts include India's AI for Bharat, which builds corpora for 22 official languages, and partnerships to digitize library archives in underrepresented languages. Similarly, collaborative consortiums empower researchers in Africa and other regions to advance NLP for local languages. These technical and strategic collaborations, especially across the Global South, ensure AI systems are inclusive and accessible worldwide.
speakers: Aditya Vashistha; Aliya Bhatia; Chenai Chair; Dhanaraj Thakur
summary_one_liner: Bridging the linguistic AI divide for non-English speaking populations
icebreaker: Aditya, how does AI for Bharat's approach to 22-language NLP differ from mainstream multilingual models?
networking_tip: NLP researchers and policy makers have complementary interests—ask policy makers about language diversity funding during breaks.

title: AI for All: Role of Open Source Hardware and Software
description: The session will demonstrate how open-source hardware and software are democratising AI by making advanced technologies intuitive, affordable, and accessible to learners, educators, and industry professionals. Through strategic partnerships, such open source knowledge is enabling innovation at scale and empowering diverse communities to build real-world AI solutions.
speakers: Fabio Violante; Guneet Bedi; Julian Caro Linares; Nitish Kumar; Prashant Yadav
summary_one_liner: Open-source hardware and software making AI affordable and accessible globally
icebreaker: Prashant, which open-source projects are making edge AI accessible to students in underserved regions?
networking_tip: EdTech founders and hardware engineers often collaborate—find speakers' office hours to discuss partnership opportunities.

title: Implementing AI Standards for Global Prosperity in an Era of Agentic AI
description: Agentic AI is rapidly transforming industries and societies worldwide. Developing and adopting robust standards to manage these systems is essential for safe and trustworthy AI. Standards offer a shared foundation for implementation, benchmarking, and comparability; helping organizations and governments align responsible practices. This session brings together leading voices in AI governance and standardization from diverse regions and sectors. Panelists will explore how technical and professional standards are designed and deployed to guide responsible AI use
speakers: Ashley Casovan; Dr Rachel Adams; Emmanuel Kahembwe; John Dickerson
summary_one_liner: Setting global standards to govern the rapid rise of agentic AI
icebreaker: Ashley, which AI standards will have the biggest impact on agentic AI governance in 2025?
networking_tip: Standards body leaders and compliance officers need each other—sit with folks from different organizations to build coalition potential.

title: Safe AI: Building Shared Trust and Accountability Infrastructure
description: As AI systems are deployed at population scale, ensuring trust, safety, and accountability becomes critical. This session focuses on how AI safety principles can be translated into operational governance frameworks, institutional mechanisms, and shared infrastructure that enable responsible AI adoption while protecting users and communities.
speakers: Dr Akash Kapur; Dr Ponnurangam Kumaraguru; Mr Nitarshan Rajkumar; Ms Deepika Mogilishetty; Ms Urvashi Aneja
summary_one_liner: Operationalizing AI safety through governance frameworks and shared infrastructure
icebreaker: Dr. Akash, how do you translate safety principles into operational governance that regulators will actually enforce?
networking_tip: Policy makers and safety researchers drive decisions—schedule 1-on-1s with them via the event app before the session.

title:
Shaping Secure, Ethical and Accountable AI Systems for a Shared
Future
description:
The Global Dialogue on Safe & Trusted AI brings together senior policymakers, technology leaders, and industry experts to examine frameworks for building secure, ethical, transparent, and accountable AI systems. The session will explore governance models, risk mitigation, and public–private collaboration to
ensure responsible AI adoption across critical sectors, while balancing innovation, trust, and global interoperability in an increasingly AI-driven world.
speakers: Mr. Abinav Varma Kalidindi; Mr. Ajit Kumar; Mr. Alkesh K Sharma, IAS (Retd; Mr. C.P Gurnani; Ms. Charu Srinivasan
summary_one_liner: Senior leaders shape secure, ethical AI governance for critical sectors
icebreaker: How is India's national security approach to AI accountability shaping global governance frameworks?
networking_tip: C-suite executives dominate this event—approach them in dedicated networking sessions rather than during panels for unrushed conversations.

title: Demystifying Voice Stack - What Makes Voice AI Work at Scale
description: This session brings together practitioners building and operating Voice AI systems in real-world settings. The session follows an Ignite-style format with short, structured talks to enable clarity and comparison across layers of the stack. The focus is on what is working today, where constraints exist, and which decisions will matter over the next 12–18 months. The session concludes with a discussion that connects insights across the Voice AI stack for builders, adopters, and policymakers.
speakers: Ananth Nagaraj; Debdoot Mukherjee; Maitreya Wagh; Ramesh MC; Sunil Gupta
summary_one_liner: Practitioners reveal what makes Voice AI work at production scale
icebreaker: Ananth, what's the biggest scaling challenge you've hit building production-grade Voice AI systems?
networking_tip: This technical session has low decision-maker density—focus on engineers and product leads; exchange GitHub/project info directly.

title: Resilience and Customer Protection in the Age of AI
description:
AI is reshaping financial inclusion and increasing the scale, sophistication, risk, and diversity of fraud. This event convenes global and Indian experts in AI, financial services, and customer protection in a panel discussion to explore:

1. How AI has transformed financial inclusion and can yield immense benefits, but also amplifies fraud risks, consumer vulnerability, and gaps in real-time protection?

2. Where current interventions fall short?

3. Why behavioural approaches are essential for fraud resilience?
speakers: Nirat Bhatnagar; Pawan Bakhshi; Rahul Vatts; Shamina Singh
summary_one_liner: Combating AI-amplified financial fraud while preserving hard-won inclusion gains
icebreaker: Nirat, how is AI changing the fraud detection playbook for financial inclusion in emerging markets?
networking_tip: FinTech founders and regulators attend—book a 15-min chat with regulators early to understand compliance requirements firsthand.

title: Transforming Academia Through AI: Building Future‑Ready Learners and Institutions
description: Panel session on role of AI in academia. Panelists were suggested as Mr Deepak Bagla, Ms Aarti Rai, MSR, and Dr Preet Deep Singh as I remember
speakers: Dr. Pavan Duggal; Munish Sabharwal; Ravi Jain; Rohit Bansal
summary_one_liner: Reimagining higher education institutions with AI for future-ready graduates
icebreaker: Dr. Pavan Duggal mentioned AI curriculum redesign—what's your institution doing to future-proof your programs?
networking_tip: Approach EdTech founders during breaks; they're actively seeking academic partnerships for pilot programs.

title: Inaugural Session
summary_one_liner: Official high-profile inauguration of the IndiaAI Impact Summit 2026
icebreaker: What's your biggest takeaway from today's opening remarks on India's AI policy direction?
networking_tip: Inaugurals attract gov officials and diplomats—exchange contacts early, they set the policy landscape.

title: Keynote
speakers: Mukesh Dhirubhai Ambani, Chairman and Managing Director, Reliance
summary_one_liner: India's largest conglomerate on AI-driven business transformation
icebreaker: Reliance's AI strategy under Mukesh Ambani—how does it impact India's startup ecosystem?
networking_tip: Major wealth creators and institutional investors attend—position for serious conversations.

title: Keynote Session: Mukesh Dhirubhai Ambani, Chairman and Managing Director, Reliance
summary_one_liner: Reliance Chairman Mukesh Ambani shares his vision for AI-powered India
icebreaker: How does Reliance's AI vision align with your organization's digital transformation roadmap?
networking_tip: Post-keynote, approach C-suite executives near the exit—they're most receptive immediately after.

title: Fireside Conversation
speakers: Sunil Bharti Mittal, Founder and Chairman, Bharti Enterprises; Shantanu Narayen, Chairman and CEO, Adobe; Moderator: Haslinda Amin, Bloomberg
summary_one_liner: Tech titans on AI innovation, enterprise adoption, and digital transformation
icebreaker: Ask about Adobe and Bharti's synergies in AI-driven enterprise transformation.
networking_tip: Sunil Mittal and Shantanu Narayen control massive networks—network sideways with their execs.

title: Keynote
speakers: Vishal Sikka, Founder and CEO, Vianai
summary_one_liner: Vianai founder on AI innovation and enterprise applications
icebreaker: What's Vishal Sikka's vision for explainable AI in enterprise adoption?
networking_tip: Connect with enterprise leaders interested in AI explainability and responsible deployment.

title: Keynote Session: Vishal Sikka, Chief Executive Officer, Vianai
summary_one_liner: Ex-SAP/Infosys CEO shares vision for applied AI platforms
icebreaker: Vishal Sikka—what applied intelligence problems are enterprise teams struggling with most?
networking_tip: SaaS founders and Series B+ leaders cluster here; identify co-selling or partnership opportunities.

title: Keynote
speakers: Bill Gates, Chair, Gates Foundation
summary_one_liner: Global health and development priorities from Gates Foundation leadership
icebreaker: What does the Gates Foundation see as the most underinvested AI opportunity in global health?
networking_tip: Connect during coffee breaks—Gates Foundation leaders actively scout for global health AI initiatives.

title: Keynote Session: Bill Gates, Chair, Gates Foundation
summary_one_liner: Gates outlines AI's role in solving global development challenges
icebreaker: What's one AI application for global development that surprised you most?
networking_tip: Connect with social impact investors during breaks—they fund AI for good initiatives.

title: Fireside Chat
speakers: Nandan Nilekani, Co-founder and Chairman, Infosys; Dario Amodei, CEO, Anthropic; Rahul Matthan, Partner, Trilegal (Moderator)
summary_one_liner: Telecom and creative-tech titans discuss AI's business transformation
icebreaker: Ask Dario Amodei what keeps him up about AI's impact on the Global South.
networking_tip: After the chat, connect with Nandan Nilekani on long-term India-AI partnerships.

title: Fireside Conversation
speakers: Nandan Nilekani, Co-founder and Chairman, Infosys; Dario Amodei, CEO, Anthropic; Moderator: Rahul Matthan, Partner, Trilegal
summary_one_liner: India's AI infrastructure vision meets frontier AI innovation and governance
icebreaker: Nandan, what's one DPI principle Dario should know about building safer frontier models?
networking_tip: This conversation bridges tech titans and policy makers—position yourself on either governance or infrastructure side.

title: Keynote
speakers: Rishad Premji, Executive Chairman, Wipro
summary_one_liner: Enterprise AI strategy from India's IT services innovation leader
icebreaker: How is Wipro helping enterprises move from AI pilots to production at scale?
networking_tip: Wipro's exec attracts enterprise buyers—ideal if you're selling B2B AI solutions or hiring talent.

title: Keynote Session: Rishad Premji, Executive Chairman, Wipro
summary_one_liner: Wipro chairman on enterprise AI adoption at global scale
icebreaker: How is your organization rethinking workforce skills for enterprise AI adoption?
networking_tip: Target IT services executives for partnership and hiring opportunities in transformation roles.

title: Keynote
speakers: Sam Altman, CEO, OpenAI
summary_one_liner: OpenAI's vision for frontier AI and its global economic impact
icebreaker: Sam, what capability gap is holding back AI adoption in emerging markets?
networking_tip: OpenAI's CEO attracts top talent and capital—network with fellow founders and VCs in the crowd.

title: Keynote Session : Sam Altman, CEO, OpenAI
summary_one_liner: OpenAI CEO reveals next frontiers in generative AI development
icebreaker: Sam Altman just spoke—what's your take on the path to AGI timelines?
networking_tip: VCs flock to Sam's keynote. Position yourself as solving a frontier AI problem.

title: Fireside Chat
speakers: Yann LeCun, Executive Chairman, Advanced Machine Intelligence Labs; Maria Shakeel, Managing Editor, India Today
summary_one_liner: India's tech architect meets frontier AI safety pioneer Amodei
icebreaker: Ask Dario or Nandan: how do you balance AI safety with frontier model speed?
networking_tip: Sit near venture capitalists—they scout AI safety talent and digital infrastructure plays.

title: Keynote Session : Yann LeCun, Executive Chairman, Advanced Machine Intelligence Labs
summary_one_liner: LeCun challenges conventional thinking on path to machine intelligence
icebreaker: Yann LeCun on self-supervised learning—which research direction excites you most?
networking_tip: Connect with PhD students and researchers—they influence next-gen AI talent hiring.

title: Keynote Session : Brad Smith, Vice Chair and President, Microsoft
summary_one_liner: Microsoft president on responsible AI governance and global partnerships
icebreaker: Brad Smith on AI governance—how does your org balance innovation with responsibility?
networking_tip: Policy advisors and CIOs cluster here. Discuss compliance and enterprise AI strategy.

title: Keynote
speakers: Brad Smith, Vice Chair and President, Microsoft
summary_one_liner: Microsoft's enterprise AI strategy and responsible AI deployment framework

It delves into the technical and practical components of the BHASHINI stack—a suite of AI tools and models for Indian languages including translation, speech‑to‑text, and text‑to‑speech—aimed at breaking linguistic barriers and enabling multilingual digital services across government and enterprise. The masterclass covers how developers, organizations, and public systems can leverage this open, sovereign language AI infrastructure to build inclusive, scalable solutions that serve India's diverse language landscape.

title: Responsible AI for affordable & accessible technology adoption fostering Sustainable Cities

In partnership with KPMG, ARF applies AI deep-tech to urban challenges, delivering solutions in air quality, waste, flooding, energy, mobility, digital governance, and smart infrastructure across Indian cities.
