networking_tip: 10 speakers from BSA mean enterprise focus—target CIOs during networking sections, not speeches.

title: Keynote Session : Vinod Khosla, Founder, Khosla Ventures
summary_one_liner: Legendary VC Vinod Khosla shares his bold AI investment thesis
icebreaker: What's one deep tech problem Khosla Ventures is betting big on this year?
networking_tip: Connect with other founders in the keynote queue—VCs often meet deal flow through peer networks.

title: Keynote
speakers: Hemant Taneja, Chief Executive Officer, General Catalyst
summary_one_liner: General Catalyst CEO shares AI innovation and investment strategy insights
icebreaker: Hemant Taneja keynotes often focus on frontier AI—what sectors is General Catalyst backing now?
networking_tip: Position yourself strategically in the plenary hall—General Catalyst partners often network openly after keynotes.

title: Panel: AI and the Creative Economy
speakers: Nicolas Granatino, Executive Chairman, Tara Gaming; Kenichiro Natsume, Assistant Director General, WIPO; Anna Tumadóttir, Chief Executive Officer, Creative Commons; Moderator: Ameet Datta, Founder and Managing Counsel, ADP Law Offices
summary_one_liner: AI's impact on creative economy, copyright, and cultural IP rights
icebreaker: Anna Tumadóttir, how is Creative Commons approaching AI training with copyrighted content?
networking_tip: WIPO's Natsume has global influence—exchange contacts on IP-AI policy alignment.

title: Panel: AI First Education
speakers: Olayinka David-West, Dean and Professor of Information Systems, Lagos Business School; Theo Farrell, President and Deputy Vice-Chancellor, La Trobe University; Moderator: Jagdish Babu, Chief Operating Officer, EkStep Foundation
summary_one_liner: Reimagining higher education and AI-first learning at scale
icebreaker: Dean David-West, what AI literacy baseline are you establishing for Lagos Business School?
networking_tip: Connect university leadership—La Trobe and LBS likely partnering on EdTech solutions.

title: Keynote
speakers: Vinod Khosla, Founder, Khosla Ventures
summary_one_liner: Khosla Ventures founder on climate AI and deep tech innovation
icebreaker: Vinod Khosla has backed climate tech for 20 years—what's his latest conviction on AI+sustainability?
networking_tip: Khosla invests long-term; pitch climate AI solutions that scale over 10+ years.

title: STPI Startup ecosystem/Felicitation and MoU Exchange
description:
To recognize and encourage exemplary technology startups nurtured within the STPI ecosystem, Software Technology Parks of India (STPI) will felicitate select startups during the AI Impact Summit.

The felicitation for FY 2024-25 aims to acknowledge startups driving innovation through artificial intelligence led and advanced digital technologies, delivering scalable solutions and measurable business outcomes including revenue growth, alongside employment generation. It will also serve as a national platform to highlight India's emerging startup success stories, including those from Tier-II and Tier-III regions, and their contribution to the country's innovation-driven digital economy and the evolving IT and ITeS landscape.
room: Hall No. 5 First Floor - Session Hall 1
speakers:
Ms. Neerja Sekhar, IAS, DG, NPC
; Sh. Bala MS, GCC Leader & CEO Stratinfinity Inc
; Ms. Geetika Dayal, Director General, TiE
summary_one_liner: India's rising AI startups from Tier-II/III cities get national spotlight
icebreaker: Which STPI-backed startup are you most curious about at this summit?
networking_tip: Stick around after felicitations—recognized founders are most approachable in that moment.

title: Educating for Viksit Bharat: Why Creativity, Cognition & Culture Matter
room: Hall No. 4 First Floor - Session Hall 2
summary_one_liner: Education innovation through creativity, cognition, and cultural integration
icebreaker: How does culturally-grounded education design integrate AI tools in Indian classrooms?
networking_tip: Sessions on pedagogy attract EdTech entrepreneurs—identify potential co-founders or advisors.

title: Leveraging Language AI for Citizen-Centric Policing in India: A Model for the World
description: Leveraging Language AI for Citizen‑Centric Policing in India: A Model for the World" highlights how AI-especially multilingual and conversational technologies-can transform policing by making services more accessible, responsive, and inclusive. It focuses on practical AI applications like language‑enabled reporting tools and automated assistance that help citizens communicate with law enforcement in their own languages.
room: Hall No. 3 First Floor - Session Hall 4
speakers:
Sh. Amitabh Nag, CEO Digital India Bhashini Division,  
; Sh. Alok Jain, IPS, Director General, NCRB & National Police Academy
summary_one_liner: Multilingual AI for inclusive, citizen-responsive law enforcement in India
icebreaker: Amitabh Nag, how does Bhashini's multilingual engine improve police-citizen accessibility?
networking_tip: IPS and NCRB leaders present—critical connections for government AI policy implementation.

title: Panel Discussion
speakers: Kristalina Georgieva, Managing Director, International Monetary Fund; Doreen Bogdan-Martin, Secretary General, International Telecommunication Union; Johanna Hill, Deputy Director General, World Trade Organization; Mariano-Florentino Cuellar, President, Carnegie Endowment for International Peace
summary_one_liner: India's top entrepreneurs debate AI's impact on jobs and entrepreneurship
icebreaker: How are startups you work with preparing teams for AI-driven roles?
networking_tip: HR tech and talent leaders dominate—exchange contacts with those in the employment panel track.

title: Fireside Chat
speakers: Kristalina Georgieva, Managing Director, International Monetary Fund; Doreen Bogdan-Martin, Secretary General, International Telecommunication Union; Johanna Hill, Deputy Director General, World Trade Organization; Josephine Teo, Minister of Digital Development and Information, Singapore; Moderator: Mariano-Florentino Cuellar, President, Carnegie Endowment for International Peace
summary_one_liner: Global leaders on AI's role in IMF, telecom, and trade governance
icebreaker: Kristalina Georgieva, how does IMF see AI reshaping financial stability frameworks globally?
networking_tip: UN, ITU, and WTO leaders rarely convene—maximize this opportunity to discuss cross-border AI governance.

title: Smaller Footprint, Bigger Impact: Advancing Resilient and Efficient AI Models for a Sustainable Future
description: Generative AI now serves a large number of users daily but comes with significant energy costs, which may contribute to unequal access. Training and inference at scale consume substantial electricity, and research suggests that more efficient model design can reduce energy use significantly. This event highlights resilient, resource-efficient AI leveraging lightweight models, compression, and optimization to reduce energy demand, broaden access, address emerging energy bottlenecks, and support sustainable AI deployment worldwide.
speakers: Dr Tawfik Jelassi, UNESCO; Mr. Arthur Mensch, Republic of Kenya; Ms Anne BOUVEROT, Government of France; Ms Anne LE HENANF, Government of France
summary_one_liner: Mistral CEO and leaders tackle energy-efficient sustainable AI model design
icebreaker: Arthur Mensch built Mistral lean—how are you rethinking model efficiency in your stack?
networking_tip: ML researchers cluster together; position yourself near the technical Q&A to connect with infrastructure engineers.

title: Scaling AI Solutions Through South–South Collaboration
description:
Big challenges. Shared realities. Stronger solutions.
Across health, agriculture, and education, the Global South is already building AI that works in real conditions and at real scale. This fireside conversation examines what happens when Global South leaders collaborate, and how partnerships can turn AI potential into tangible development outcomes. Join the conversation on building AI solutions together at the India AI Impact Summit 2026.
speakers: Mr. Ankur Vora, Gates Foundation; Mr. Lacina Koné, Smart Africa; Mr. Sunil Wadhwani, Wadhwani AI; Ms. Shikoh Gitau, Qhala
summary_one_liner: Global South leaders forge AI partnerships for real development outcomes
icebreaker: Ankur Vora's seeing health, ag, education scale in the Global South—which sector's your bet?
networking_tip: Gates Foundation directors attend; ask about their portfolio gaps before the panel ends, they love founder conviction.

title: Connectivity and Inclusive AI for Global Growth
description: This session explores inclusive, edge-driven AI and next-generation connectivity, highlighting how on-device, hybrid, and agentic AI can enable global growth, human-centric experiences, and a scalable AI ecosystem.
speakers: Durga Malladi, EVP, GM, Technology Planning, Edge Solutions and Data Center
summary_one_liner: Qualcomm's vision for on-device and agentic AI powering global connectivity
icebreaker: Durga Malladi on edge AI—are you building on-device or hybrid, and why?
networking_tip: Qualcomm partners will dominate; catch them pre-session to discuss integration timelines.

title: AI for Inclusive Societal Development
description: Advancing AI systems that are inclusive by design, empowering diverse communities and ensuring equitable representation
speakers: Aditya Natraj, Piramal Foundation; Ms Arundhati Bhattacharya, Salesforce India and South Asia; Nikhil Kolur, Deloitte; NSN Murty, Deloitte; Romal Shetty, Deloitte South Asia; S. Anjani Kumar, Deloitte
summary_one_liner: Designing AI systems that empower diverse communities by default
icebreaker: How is Deloitte approaching inclusive AI design differently for different regions represented here?
networking_tip: Seek out the non-profit tech leads during breaks—they're your best bet for partnership conversations in this medium-sized crowd.

title: AI as a Topic and a Tool: The Future of Foreign Policy in an Age of Algorithms
description: AI is not just a technological frontier - it is a geopolitical one. The rapid development and deployment of artificial intelligence are reshaping global power dynamics, fueling competition among nations for economic advantage, technological supremacy, and strategic influence. The integration of artificial intelligence into diplomacy and foreign policy is fundamentally transforming how nations engage, negotiate, and collaborate on the global stage.
speakers: Gunda Ehmke, Data Innovation Lab; Hans-Christian Mangelsdorf, German Federal Foreign Office; Norman Schulz, German Federal Foreign Office; Sharinee Jagtiani, GMF
summary_one_liner: AI reshapes geopolitical power dynamics and diplomatic engagement globally
icebreaker: Ehmke, how is the German Federal Foreign Office incorporating AI strategy into diplomatic negotiations?
networking_tip: Diplomats and gov officials are relationship-first. Exchange cards early; follow up with a specific geopolitical insight from the discussion.

title: Trusted AI at Scale: A Global South Leadership Dialogue
description: This roundtable brings together senior ICT leaders from the global south to turn the Summit's "Safe & Trusted AI" Chakra into practical action. Focusing on embedding institutional safety into fast‑moving AI deployment, it bridges Global North–South governance gaps by translating policy into implementation. The dialogue blends private‑sector risk expertise with public‑sector scale, positioning New Delhi as a hub for inclusive, interoperable AI strategies
speakers: Deepali Khanna, The Rockefeller Foundation; Deepali Khanna, The Rockefeller Foundation; Eugenio V. Garcia, Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Brazil; Ima Abdulrahim, AI Safety Asia; Kip Wainscott, JPMC; Parag Khanna, AlphaGeo; Philip Thigo, Tech Ambassador, Kenya; Purushottam	Kaushik, World Economic Forum
summary_one_liner: Senior ICT leaders turn safe AI principles into Global South practice
icebreaker: What's your biggest blocker embedding AI safety into fast-moving gov systems?
networking_tip: ICT Ministers here = high-stakes buyers; come with one real governance problem, not a pitch.

title: Building Trustworthy AI: Foundations and Practical Pathways
description: Building Trustworthy AI is an impact-focused workshop examining how responsible and transparent AI systems can enable inclusive, ethical, and sustainable innovation in India. The session includes an interactive exploration of data consent and privacy in real-world AI deployments, the launch of the research paper ASTRA: AI Safety, Trust, & Risk Assessment, and a multi-stakeholder roundtable discussing practical pathways to advance trustworthy AI across policy, industry, and society.
speakers: Chanda Grover, Ashoka University; Dr. Aalok Thakkar, Ashoka University; Dr. Anirban Sen, Ashoka University; Dr. Debayan Gupta, Ashoka University
summary_one_liner: Ashoka University launches AI safety assessment framework with stakeholder workshop
icebreaker: Dr. Debayan Gupta on risk assessment—what's breaking your trust model in production?
networking_tip: Workshop format = deep dives; ask facilitators to intro you to researchers working your problem domain.

title: Payments to Commerce: From the lens of People, Planet, and Progress
description: Digital payments transformed economies by making transactions faster, safer, and more inclusive—with AI at their core. This panel brings together industry and academic leaders who helped shape that journey and now turn their lens from payments to commerce. As commerce enters its next evolution, the discussion explores implications for people, planet, and progress—from trust and inclusion to global trade and sustainability—and how enterprises, governments, and academia can prepare for an AI-native future.
speakers: Caroline Louveaux, Mastercard; Combiz Richard Abdolrahimi, Service Now; Janet George, Mastercard; Prof. Aparna Gupta, Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute; Surya Ganguli, Stanford
summary_one_liner: From digital payments to AI-native commerce: what's next for inclusion
icebreaker: Louveaux, how is Mastercard balancing AI-driven commerce growth with planet sustainability goals?
networking_tip: E-commerce and fintech leaders will cluster here—introduce yourself to payment architects during panel Q&A to signal expertise early.

title: Capacity Building in Digital Health
description: Artificial Intelligence has rapidly achieved technical maturity across its first two developmental levels, yet organizational maturity has not kept pace. This panel examines the critical gap between AI capability and institutional readiness. It will explore how targeted capacity building, across leadership, workforce, governance, and processes, can unlock AI's full value. The discussion focuses on activating impact from the bottom of the value chain, ensuring AI adoption translates into measurable outcomes rather than isolated technological success.
speakers: Col. (Dr.) Sarvjeet Kaur, Indian Nursing Council; Dr. Rajeev Singh Raghuvanshi, CDSCO, Govt. of India; Dr. Rajendra Pratap Gupta, Academy of Digital Health Sciences; Dr. Suresh Yadav, The Commonwealth; Mr. Aneesh Chopra, Government of the United States, under President Barack Obama; Mr. Zaw Ali Khan, Criterion Tech; Shri D. Sridhar Babu, Government of Telangana
summary_one_liner: Bridging AI capability and institutional readiness in healthcare organizations
icebreaker: Mr. Aneesh Chopra, how are hospitals bridging the gap between AI capability and organizational readiness?
networking_tip: Hospital CIOs control tech budgets—find them in smaller breakout discussions; they avoid main stage crowds.

title: Panel - From Pilots to Population: Scaling AI for Inclusive Impact
description: This session brings together examples of AI solutions that have scaled from pilots to population-level systems, yielding measurable gains in service delivery, productivity, and inclusion. It will surface the governance, infrastructure, and partnership models that enable sustainable scale.
speakers:
Dario Amodei
 
; Doreen Bogdan-Martin;  Nandan Nilekani;  Shankar Maruwada;  Trevor Munde
summary_one_liner: Anthropic CEO and Nandan Nilekani on scaling AI from pilots to billions
icebreaker: Nandan Nilekani's EkStep scaled to millions—what's your biggest bottleneck going from pilot to population?
networking_tip: These are decision-makers: find the gov leaders during breaks, they move slower but commit bigger.

title: India at the Centre of the Global AI and Semiconductor Power Shift
description: The session will have discussion around the convergence of artificial intelligence, semiconductors, and geopolitics, and its implications for global competitiveness, supply chain resilience, and technological trust. As AI becomes a strategic national asset, the session will explore how policy leadership, technological cooperation, and private-sector innovation must align to build secure, resilient, and inclusive AI ecosystems, while highlighting India's emerging role in the global AI and semiconductor value chain.
speakers: Dr Vivek Kumar Singh, NITI Aayog, GoI; Dr. Thomas Zacharia, AMD; Jaya Jagadish, Silicon Design Engineering, AMD; Rahul Garg, Moglix
summary_one_liner: India's strategic role in the global AI and semiconductor value chain
icebreaker: Garg, how are chip design and supply chain resilience reshaping India's AI hardware competitiveness vs. AMD?
networking_tip: Semiconductor execs and supply chain strategists are technical—reference specific bottlenecks you've observed to trigger deeper conversations.

title: AI Agents for a Better Tomorrow: Government Services, Climate Action, and Resilient Infrastructure
description: This panel will bring together industry and government stakeholders to explore the shift towards autonomous AI agents. The discussion will focus on the engineering architectures required to scale these systems for climate resilience and public services, alongside governance frameworks that support trust and accountability. Moving from theory to practice, the session will examine pathways for public–private collaboration to support secure and responsible AI deployment with tangible outcomes.
speakers: Lee Tiedrich, Pratt School of Engineering, Duke University; Mike Haley, Autodesk; Sridhar Babu, Information Technology, Electronics & Communications, Industries & Commerce and Legislative Affairs, Telangana; Srinivas Tallapragada, Salesforce; Victoria Espinel, Business Software Alliance
summary_one_liner: AI agents architecting climate resilience and government service delivery
icebreaker: Ask Lee Tiedrich about scaling autonomous agents for climate—Duke's perspective on real-world deployment challenges?
networking_tip: Connect with government IT officials present—they're evaluating agentic AI for public services right now.

title: AI for Economic Growth & Social Good: Industry Synergies for Inclusive Innovation
description: It is a high-level, solutions-oriented panel bringing together government, multilaterals, industry leaders, and innovation ecosystems to translate India's AI ambition into real-world impact. The session spotlights deployable AI use-cases across healthcare, agriculture, skilling, mobility, and financial inclusion, emphasizing responsible AI, blended finance, and cross-sector partnerships to scale beyond pilots toward measurable, population-level outcomes aligned with the IndiaAI Mission
speakers: Archana, Sunlit Path Consulting; Dr. Angela Lusigi, UNDP India; Rekha Srinivasan, United Way of Hyderabad; Yosuke Sato, JICA India
summary_one_liner: India's AI ambition into healthcare, ag, skilling, and financial inclusion
icebreaker: Dr. Angela Lusigi at UNDP—ask how multilateral orgs are prioritizing AI for development in emerging markets.
networking_tip: Government and UNDP reps here control deployment budgets—have concrete use-case ROI data ready.

title: Keynote
speakers: Prashant Warier, CEO, Qure AI
summary_one_liner: Qure AI CEO on healthcare AI's next frontier
icebreaker: Prashant Warier built Qure AI into a unicorn—ask him about scaling medical AI in emerging markets.
networking_tip: Keynotes attract investors and enterprise buyers—position yourself in plenary hall exits.

title: Keynote
speakers: Prashant Warier, CEO, Qure AI
summary_one_liner: Qure AI CEO on healthcare AI's next frontier
icebreaker: Prashant Warier built Qure AI into a unicorn—ask him about scaling medical AI in emerging markets.
networking_tip: Keynotes attract investors and enterprise buyers—position yourself in plenary hall exits.

title: Keynote
speakers: Naveen Tewari, Founder and CEO, inMobi
summary_one_liner: inMobi founder on mobile AI and global scale
icebreaker: Naveen Tewari scaled inMobi globally—ask how he applies AI to mobile-first markets.
networking_tip: Heavy hitter founders attract VCs and strategic acquirers—network aggressively post-keynote.

title: Payments to Commerce: From the lens of People, Planet, and Progress
description: Digital payments transformed economies by making transactions faster, safer, and more inclusive—with AI at their core. This panel brings together industry and academic leaders who helped shape that journey and now turn their lens from payments to commerce. As commerce enters its next evolution, the discussion explores implications for people, planet, and progress—from trust and inclusion to global trade and sustainability—and how enterprises, governments, and academia can prepare for an AI-native future.
speakers: Caroline Louveaux, Mastercard; Combiz Richard Abdolrahimi, Service Now; Janet George, Mastercard; Prof. Aparna Gupta, Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute; Surya Ganguli, Stanford
summary_one_liner: Fintech leaders evolving payments to commerce with AI
icebreaker: Caroline Louveaux and Janet George at Mastercard—ask how they're embedding AI into next-gen commerce.
networking_tip: Mastercard execs control major enterprise AI budgets—research their current priorities beforehand.

title: AI as a Topic and a Tool: The Future of Foreign Policy in an Age of Algorithms
description: AI is not just a technological frontier - it is a geopolitical one. The rapid development and deployment of artificial intelligence are reshaping global power dynamics, fueling competition among nations for economic advantage, technological supremacy, and strategic influence. The integration of artificial intelligence into diplomacy and foreign policy is fundamentally transforming how nations engage, negotiate, and collaborate on the global stage.
speakers: Gunda Ehmke, Data Innovation Lab; Hans-Christian Mangelsdorf, German Federal Foreign Office; Norman Schulz, German Federal Foreign Office; Sharinee Jagtiani, GMF
summary_one_liner: AI reshaping geopolitics and foreign policy strategy
icebreaker: Hans-Christian Mangelsdorf from German Foreign Office—ask how democracies should coordinate on AI policy.
networking_tip: Government officials here shape policy—understand their countries' strategic AI priorities.

title: Supercharging AI Adoption in the Global South: Opportunities and Lessons from the Financial Sector
description: As one of the most regulated sectors, financial services has emerged as a leader in responsible AI governance, prioritizing aspects such as security and data privacy for trusted deployment. This panel will highlight learnings from the sector's AI journey that can accelerate AI adoption in the Global South. It will distill key lessons from AI governance in finance to drive grassroots AI adoption among small business owners, farmers, public school educators, & local government officials.
speakers: Ashutosh Sharma; Harshil Mathur; Terah Lyons
summary_one_liner: Financial sector lessons to accelerate grassroots AI adoption in Global South
icebreaker: Mathur, what's the biggest barrier to grassroots AI adoption JPMorgan's seeing in Global South fintech?
networking_tip: Fintech founders and regulators have competing interests here—find the small business advocates; they bridge both worlds for partnership.

title: AI for Inclusive and Resilient Agricultural Food Systems
description: This session by the Ministry of the Netherlands will explore how artificial intelligence can enable more sustainable, resilient, and responsible agricultural supply chains. It will examine AI use in farm-level efficiency, risk management, sustainability reporting, and trusted data sharing. The discussion will emphasize inclusive approaches that support small farmers and SMEs in lower-income countries to meet sustainability requirements, protect data, and access global agricultural markets.
speakers: Dr. Arun Pratihast; Dr. Dejan Jakovljevic; H.E. Harry Verweij; H.E. Mathias Cormann; Mr. Nezar Patria; Ms. Audrey Plonk; Ms. Debjani Ghosh
summary_one_liner: Netherlands and OECD champion AI for sustainable smallholder agriculture globally
icebreaker: H.E. Verweij brought Netherlands agri-policy—how are smallholders actually adopting your AI tools?
networking_tip: OECD advisors and gov ministers here; corner them on pilot-to-scale timelines, they fund infrastructure.

title: Keynote
speakers: Thomas Scheider, Ambassador, Vice-Director and Co-Director of International Relations (OFCOM), Switzerland
summary_one_liner: Swiss Ambassador on international AI governance frameworks
icebreaker: Ambassador Scheider co-directs Switzerland's international AI relations—ask about cross-border governance models.
networking_tip: Ambassadors set global AI agendas—connect if your work touches international policy or standards.

title: Keynote
speakers: Vivek Mahajan, CTO, Fujitsu
summary_one_liner: Enterprise AI infrastructure vision from Fujitsu CTO
icebreaker: Ask Vivek Mahajan how Fujitsu is bridging cloud and edge AI deployment challenges.
networking_tip: Connect with enterprise tech leaders during keynote Q&A to discuss infrastructure partnerships.

title: Keynote Session: Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw, Chairperson, Biocon Group
summary_one_liner: Biocon pioneer Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw on AI transforming healthcare innovation
icebreaker: What's Biocon's next move in AI-driven drug discovery?
networking_tip: Biotech investors cluster here—position yourself near the biotech founder cohort.

title: Keynote
speakers: Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw, Chairperson, Biocon Group
summary_one_liner: Biotech powerhouse on AI-driven healthcare innovation
icebreaker: Ask Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw about Biocon's AI applications in precision medicine and drug discovery.
networking_tip: Position yourself for biotech healthcare conversations—this draws serious investors and acquirers.

title: Panel Discussion
speakers: Sanjeev Bikhchandani, Founder & Executive Vice Chairman, Info Edge (India); Ravi Venkatesan, Founder, Global Alliance for Mass Entrepreneurship; Deepak Bagla, Mission Director, Atal Innovation Mission ; Radhicka Kapoor, Senior Employment Specialist, Decent Work Team for South Asia, International Labour Organization; Shereen Bhan, Managing Editor, CNBC-TV18
summary_one_liner: India's top IT CEOs debate AI's enterprise transformation roadmap
icebreaker: Which company on this panel is hiring for AI transformation roles?
networking_tip: IT services leaders control massive budgets—connect with their AI/transformation practice leads.

title: Panel
speakers: Lakshmi Pratury, Founder and CEO, INK Global Foundation; Kirthiga Reddy, CEO, OptimizeGEO and Founder, AI Kiran; Neeru Khosla, Founder, CK12; Archana Vemulapalli, Corporate Vice President, AMD
summary_one_liner: Women leaders in AI and education transforming global access
icebreaker: Ask Neeru Khosla how CK12's AI platform democratizes STEM education globally.
networking_tip: Network with AMD's Archana Vemulapalli—major tech companies are investing heavily in inclusive AI education.

title: Fireside Chat
speakers: Srinivasan Iyengar, Senior Vice President - General Manager, Central Engineering Group,Intel; Sagar Sharma, Head, Business Intelligence and Strategic Affairs, Tata Electronics; Dr. Vivek Khaneja, Executive Director, CDAC; Moderator: Aman Khanna, Vice President, Asia Group
summary_one_liner: Intel, Tata Electronics on semiconductors and strategic AI infrastructure
icebreaker: Ask Srinivasan Iyengar about Intel's latest edge AI compute strategies and hardware roadmap.
networking_tip: Chat with Tata Electronics lead—Indian hardware expansion in AI is a major trend for partnerships.

title: Panel Discussion
description: AI is poised to  accelerate India's economic growth, positioning the country to become a trillion-dollar digital economy by 2030,  by preparing the next generation to contribute meaningfully to Viksit Bharat. This session aims to explore best practices and evolving models in AI and STEM education across curriculum design, pedagogy, teacher capacity, and infrastructure with ethical, and inclusive use of AI at its core.
speakers: Sanjeev Bikhchandani, Founder & Executive Vice Chairman, Info Edge (India); Deepak Bagla, Mission Director, Atal Innovation Mission; Radhicka Kapoor, Senior Employment Specialist, Decent Work Team for South Asia, International Labour Organization; Moderator: Sidharth Madaan, BCG
summary_one_liner: Redesigning India's STEM education for an AI-powered economy
icebreaker: Shri Narendra Bhooshan's Viksit Bharat vision—how are you embedding AI literacy into your institution's curriculum?
networking_tip: Education policy makers cluster here: connect with K-12 principals and edtech founders during breaks to discuss scaling.

title: Designing Health AI for Bharat - A Billion Clinical Realities
description: As AI is integrated more closely into indian health care, this discussion brings together pioneers across technology, public systems, and deep last-mile knowledge, public systems and last mile delivery. The session will study ground realities in the Health-AI space. Drawing on institutional memory and frontier innovation, the session explores how Artificial Intelligence must evolve with people, infrastructure and ecosystems to deliver resilient and inclusive health outcomes at population scale.
speakers: Karthik Adapa, WHO; Kiran Gopal Vaska, NHA; Ms. Aswathy S., IAS, Department of Health & Family Welfare; Prof. Rajendra Pratap Gupta, Parliament Health; Prof. Rajendra Pratap Gupta, Parliament Health; Shalini Kapoor, Ek Step Foundation
summary_one_liner: Ground-level AI healthcare solutions for India's billion citizens
icebreaker: Kiran Gopal Vaska's expertise in last-mile delivery—what's your biggest AI adoption barrier in Indian healthcare?
networking_tip: IAS officers and healthtech founders network here. Ask about pilot programs—many share funding and implementation insights.

title: Sovereign AI for India: Designing the Nation's Future Compute, Data and Innovation Ecosystem
description: This panel will explore how India can build sovereign AI capabilities across compute, data, models, and governance to reduce dependence on foreign systems while aligning AI development with national priorities and constitutional values. The discussion will examine the democratization of AI resources, trusted governance frameworks, affordable national compute infrastructure, India-centric datasets, responsible AI practices, and ways to strengthen India's voice in global AI standards and negotiations.
speakers: Ankit Bose, Nasscom AI; Bhaskar Gorti, Tata Communications; Breno Melo, Genspark; Kalyan Kumar, HCLSoftware; Prof. Ganesh Ramakrishnan, Bharat Gen; Sunil Gupta, Yotta
summary_one_liner: India's blueprint for self-reliant AI compute and data sovereignty
icebreaker: Prof. Ganesh Ramakrishnan on sovereign AI—how is your organization rethinking data or compute infrastructure independence?
networking_tip: Policy architects and infrastructure leaders here set national direction. Connect early; these decisions ripple across India's AI ecosystem.

title: Making AI for everyone: The case for personal, local, multilingual AI
description: This session will look at a collaborative build, i.e. a local AI device platform that empowers communities to create their own AI tools, in their own language, for their own needs, with complete privacy and control; and a video projection of the build in use. It will also include a fireside chat between AI leaders, and a high-level dialogue between senior delegation of French and Indian officials. Jointly these interventions will explore a multilingual, public-interest AI ecosystem.
speakers: Andrew Tergis, Current AI; Anne Bouverot, Government of France; Ayah Bdeir, Current AI; Martin Tisné, Current AI; Shailendra Pal Singh, Bhashini; Shri. Abhishek Singh, Meity, GoI; Shri. Amitabh Nag, Bhashini; Sushant Kumar, Kalpa Impact
summary_one_liner: Multilingual local AI devices empowering communities with complete privacy
icebreaker: Shailendra Pal Singh's local AI platform—what language or community problem would you build AI for first?
networking_tip: Multilingual researchers and edtech founders collaborate here. Stay through networking; side conversations surface partnership ideas.

title: Panel Discussion on Reimagining Responsible AI: Frameworks, Safeguards, and Standards for the Next Wave of AI Innovation
description: This panel will examine the next phase of Responsible AI frameworks, safeguards, and standards in the context of evolving AI technologies. It will feature a focused discussion to gather practical inputs on strengthening governance mechanisms, lifecycle oversight, risk assessment tools, and global standard setting, with emphasis on responsible innovation in emerging systems such as agentic AI.
speakers: Mr. Ashish Tewari, Infosys; Mr. Kamesh Shekar, The Dialogue; Mr. Syed Quiser Ahmed, Infosys; Ms. Arundhati Bhattacharya, Salesforce
knowledge_partners: Coalition for Responsible Evolution of AI (CoRE-AI)
summary_one_liner: Next-gen responsible AI frameworks for the agentic systems era
icebreaker: Ms. Arundhati Bhattacharya's framework—how is your organization operationalizing responsible AI safeguards today?
networking_tip: Ethics officers and compliance leaders gather here. Ask about emerging standards—they're finalizing guidance others will adopt.

title: International AI Safety Coordination: What Policymakers Need to Know
description: The race to AGI/ASI is getting more geopolitical and difficult to control and govern with profound consequences for our societies and civilisations. This session will aim to delineate an actionable governance agenda to address that situation, exploring advanced AI technical and governance needs .
speakers: Dr. Eileen Donahoe, Sympatico Ventures; H. E. Govind Singh Deo, Government of Malaysia; H.E. Josephine Teo, Singapore Government; H.E. Mathias Cormann, OECD; Mr. Cyrus Hodes, AI Safety Connect; Mr. Jann Tallinn, Future of Life Institute; Mr. Nicolas Miailhe, AI Safety Connect; Mr. Osama Manzar, Digital Empowerment Foundation; Mr. Sangbu Kim, The World Bank Group; Prof. Stuart Russell, The International Association for Safe and Ethical AI (IASEAI)
summary_one_liner: Top global leaders tackle AGI governance before it's too late
icebreaker: Prof. Stuart Russell and international experts here—what's your country's biggest AI safety coordination challenge?
networking_tip: Heads of state advisors and diplomats set global AI norms. Engage during breaks; these conversations shape international policy alignment.

title: Applying AI: How AI Innovators and Governments Reshape the Public Sector
description: This panel brings together global leaders and innovators to examine the transformative potential of AI within the public sector. The discussion will delve into the roles of AI developers and governmental bodies, focusing on how their collaboration can translate trustworthy AI principles into tangible public services and policy-making results. The event will spotlight actionable strategies, visionary ideas and ways to deploy AI systems that can deliver social and economic value.
speakers: Arthur Mensch, Mistral; Henna Virkkunen, European Commission; Jarek Kutylowski, DeepL; Lucilla Sioli, European Commission; Mateo Valero, BSC AI Factory; Roberto Viola, European Commission
summary_one_liner: EU and Mistral AI CEO forge AI-powered public sector transformation
icebreaker: Arthur Mensch and the panel are tackling gov sector transformation—are you building for public sector or selling to it?
networking_tip: GovTech founders cluster together. Position yourself near the stage post-panel to catch CIOs and policy makers before they leave.

title: Stakeholder Workshop (World Economic Forum): Advancing Safe, Secure and Trustworthy AI Governance
description: This semi-private stakeholder dialogue will convene senior public- and private-sector leaders for a focused discussion on advancing practical AI governance. Building on the principles of the Hiroshima AI Process and other global frameworks, the session will explore how shared commitments to safe, secure, and trustworthy AI can be translated into actionable, regionally relevant governance approaches that enable innovation and protect societal interests, as well as strategies for building resilient AI innovation ecosystems through regional collaboration.
speakers: Agustina Callegari, World Economic Forum; Cathy Li, World Economic Forum; Samira Gazzane, World Economic Forum
summary_one_liner: WEF convenes private workshop translating global AI principles into governance action
icebreaker: How is your organization applying the Hiroshima AI Process principles to your governance strategy?
networking_tip: Arrive early to connect with diplomats and policy leads before the formal dialogue begins—they shape future regulations.

title: Small AI for Big Impact
description: Small AI is essential for scaling solutions in the Global South via data-efficient computing, low-resource datasets, and localized edge inference. Grounded in responsible, local contexts, this session provides a roadmap for ML practitioners in India and beyond to achieve scale. Through a technical lens, we examine how affordable, scalable AI deployment can advance UN Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs), offering global leadership and technical insights into driving meaningful social impact through localized, accessible technology.
speakers: Aisha Walcott-Bryant, Google Research Africa; Alpan Raval, Wadhwani AI; Antoine Tesniere, PariSanté Campus; Illango Patchamuthu, Strategy and Operations (Digital & AI), World Bank Group; Wassim Hamidouche, Microsoft AI for Good Lab; Zameer Brey, Gates Foundation
summary_one_liner: Lightweight ML models offer scalable AI solutions for developing economies
icebreaker: Aisha Walcott-Bryant mentioned data-efficient computing—what's your biggest constraint deploying AI in resource-limited settings?
networking_tip: Catch speakers during breaks; ML engineers here are actively solving SDG problems and eager to share edge inference learnings.

title: The AI-Cyber Nexus: A Strategic Dialogue on Global Security, Trust, and Governance
description: This session, will apply the triad of Confidentiality, Integrity, and Availability (CIA) to the complex challenges posed by large language models (LLMs) and Agentic AI. It will present learnings from technology developers, civil society, policymakers, and diplomats that can provide an informed, fact-based approach to how cybersecurity policy and AI governance are interconnected.
speakers: Alejandro Mayoral Banos, Access Now; Brando Benifie, European Parliament; Maria Paz Canales, Global Partners Digital; Nirmal John, Economic Times; Raman Jit Singh Chima, Access Now; Sara Rendtorff-Smith, Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development (OECD); Udbhav Tiwari, Signal
summary_one_liner: Cybersecurity meets AI governance in a high-stakes policy dialogue
icebreaker: How do you see the CIA triad applying to your organization's LLM security strategy?
networking_tip: High-level diplomats and security advisors attend—position yourself during Q&A to ask about national implementation approaches.

title: Exploring a Regulatory Framework for Open Data
description: Open data is becoming a core pillar of the global AI ecosystem, enabling innovation, evidence-based policymaking, and improved public service delivery. While high-quality datasets are essential for advanced AI, their governance poses complex challenges. This panel examines the opportunities and challenges presented by executive and sector-specific measures, and statutory frameworks for open data. Bringing together policymakers, legal experts, and industry the discussion will explore balancing openness with safeguards, and innovation with accountability.
speakers: Arun Prabhu, Cyril Amarchand Mangaldas; Cyril Shroff, Cyril Amarchand Mangaldas; Dr Shashi Tharoor, Lok Sabha; Dr. Sasmit Patra, Rajya Sabha, India; Prof.  (Dr.) C. Raj Kumar, O.P. Jindal Global University; Rama Vedashree,
summary_one_liner: Legal luminaries debate regulatory frameworks for India's open data ecosystem
icebreaker: Dr Shashi Tharoor's here—ask about balancing open data innovation with India's regulatory framework needs.
networking_tip: This draws policy lawyers and gov officials. Sit near Cyril Shroff's firm representatives for deeper governance conversations.

title: Fireside Chat: From Cloud to Edge - Scaling AI Across Compute Layers
summary_one_liner: Scaling AI from cloud infrastructure to edge computing layers
icebreaker: Discuss with technical attendees the tradeoffs between latency and model complexity in edge deployment.
networking_tip: Meet infrastructure engineers here—they drive architectural decisions at major enterprises.

title: Keynote
speakers: Giordano Albertazzi, Chief Executive Officer, Vertiv
summary_one_liner: Vertiv CEO on mission-critical AI infrastructure and power solutions
icebreaker: Ask Giordano Albertazzi how Vertiv is solving thermal and power challenges for AI data centers.
networking_tip: Connect with enterprise infrastructure buyers—Vertiv's expertise drives real capital decisions.

title: Keynote
speakers: Sangita Reddy, Joint Managing Director, Apollo Hospitals
summary_one_liner: Apollo Hospitals on AI transformation in clinical care and diagnostics
icebreaker: Ask Sangita Reddy about Apollo's AI implementation roadmap and clinical outcomes data.
networking_tip: Healthcare AI is hot—position yourself with hospital systems and health-tech investors here.

title: Keynote
speakers: Sangita Reddy, Joint Managing Director, Apollo Hospitals
summary_one_liner: Apollo Hospitals on AI transformation in clinical care and diagnostics
icebreaker: Ask Sangita Reddy about Apollo's AI implementation roadmap and clinical outcomes data.
networking_tip: Healthcare AI is hot—position yourself with hospital systems and health-tech investors here.

title: Stakeholder Workshop (World Economic Forum): Advancing Safe, Secure and Trustworthy AI Governance
description: This semi-private stakeholder dialogue will convene senior public- and private-sector leaders for a focused discussion on advancing practical AI governance. Building on the principles of the Hiroshima AI Process and other global frameworks, the session will explore how shared commitments to safe, secure, and trustworthy AI can be translated into actionable, regionally relevant governance approaches that enable innovation and protect societal interests, as well as strategies for building resilient AI innovation ecosystems through regional collaboration.
speakers: Agustina Callegari, World Economic Forum; Cathy Li, World Economic Forum; Samira Gazzane, World Economic Forum
summary_one_liner: Senior leaders shape practical AI governance frameworks globally
icebreaker: Ask Cathy Li about WEF's Hiroshima AI Process implementation across regions
networking_tip: Semi-private format—arrive early, target 1-2 policy leaders for deeper 15-min conversations

title: Small AI for Big Impact
description: Small AI is essential for scaling solutions in the Global South via data-efficient computing, low-resource datasets, and localized edge inference. Grounded in responsible, local contexts, this session provides a roadmap for ML practitioners in India and beyond to achieve scale. Through a technical lens, we examine how affordable, scalable AI deployment can advance UN Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs), offering global leadership and technical insights into driving meaningful social impact through localized, accessible technology.
speakers: Aisha Walcott-Bryant, Google Research Africa; Alpan Raval, Wadhwani AI; Antoine Tesniere, PariSanté Campus; Illango Patchamuthu, Strategy and Operations (Digital & AI), World Bank Group; Wassim Hamidouche, Microsoft AI for Good Lab; Zameer Brey, Gates Foundation
summary_one_liner: Scaling efficient ML for Global South's resource-constrained realities
icebreaker: Ask Aisha Walcott-Bryant how Google Research Africa balances scale with data efficiency
networking_tip: World Bank attendee (Illango Patchamuthu) signals funding interest—lead with real-world impact metrics

title: The AI-Cyber Nexus: A Strategic Dialogue on Global Security, Trust, and Governance
description: This session, will apply the triad of Confidentiality, Integrity, and Availability (CIA) to the complex challenges posed by large language models (LLMs) and Agentic AI. It will present learnings from technology developers, civil society, policymakers, and diplomats that can provide an informed, fact-based approach to how cybersecurity policy and AI governance are interconnected.
speakers: Alejandro Mayoral Banos, Access Now; Brando Benifie, European Parliament; Maria Paz Canales, Global Partners Digital; Nirmal John, Economic Times; Raman Jit Singh Chima, Access Now; Sara Rendtorff-Smith, Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development (OECD); Udbhav Tiwari, Signal
summary_one_liner: Secure LLM governance through civil society, tech, and diplomatic coordination
icebreaker: Ask Raman Jit Singh Chima (Access Now) about civil society's role in LLM accountability frameworks
networking_tip: European Parliament speaker + diplomats present—position on cross-border AI trust standards

title: Designing Health AI for Bharat - A Billion Clinical Realities
description: As AI is integrated more closely into indian health care, this discussion brings together pioneers across technology, public systems, and deep last-mile knowledge, public systems and last mile delivery. The session will study ground realities in the Health-AI space. Drawing on institutional memory and frontier innovation, the session explores how Artificial Intelligence must evolve with people, infrastructure and ecosystems to deliver resilient and inclusive health outcomes at population scale.
speakers: Karthik Adapa, WHO; Kiran Gopal Vaska, NHA; Ms. Aswathy S., IAS, Department of Health & Family Welfare; Prof. Rajendra Pratap Gupta, Parliament Health; Prof. Rajendra Pratap Gupta, Parliament Health; Shalini Kapoor, Ek Step Foundation
summary_one_liner: Ground-truth health AI strategies for India's billion-scale clinical diversity
icebreaker: Ask Karthik Adapa (WHO) how last-mile clinical realities reshape AI deployment in India
networking_tip: IAS officer + NHA leadership = policy rollout potential—focus on implementation feasibility

title: From Research to Industry: Building Foundational Large Language Models for High-Stakes Uses in the Real World
description: This session will examine how robust and trustworthy artificial intelligence can be built for high-stakes professional use cases that support economic growth and social good. It will explore how domain-specific research, rigorous evaluation, and collaboration between industry and academia enable safe and scalable AI. The discussion will focus on moving from pilots to real-world deployment through strong governance, reliability, and inclusive design across sectors.
speakers: Eun Jae (Jessie) Baek; Jonathan Richard Schwarz; Zak Brown
summary_one_liner: Deploying trustworthy LLMs from lab to real-world high-stakes use
icebreaker: Jessie Baek's work on domain-specific LLMs—which high-stakes industry are you most focused on?
networking_tip: NLP researchers and AI product managers recruit here. Chat with enterprise AI leaders about production challenges and team expansion.

title: Democratizing AI Resources Bridging the Global Infrastructure Divide - Leadership Talk
description:
A high-level, solutions-focused dialogue connecting multilaterals, industry and 
innovation ecosystems to deploy responsible AI at scale for inclusive growth and 
measurable public benefit.
speakers: Dr. Angela Lusigi; Himanshu Nivsarkar; Janet Joseph; Priyanka Ravala; Takuro Takeuchi
summary_one_liner: Multilateral leaders unite to close the global AI infrastructure gap
icebreaker: Dr. Angela Lusigi's work on bridging infrastructure gaps—what's the biggest bottleneck you're seeing in your markets?
networking_tip: High decision-maker density means prioritize 1-on-1s over mingling. Identify multilateral officials pre-event and schedule 15min slots.

title: Humanity in the Loop- Balancing Innovation and Ethics in the Age of AI
description: "Humanity in the Loop" will explore how human rights, transparency, and ethics can drive responsible AI innovation. Bringing together leaders from governments, industry, academia, civil society, and multilateral bodies, the session will showcase practical approaches to embedding values-based governance in AI ecosystems. Discussions will center on trust-building, inclusion, and leadership in ethical innovation to ensure that AI advances serve humanity equitably and sustainably.
speakers: Brando Benifei; Debjani Ghosh; Dr Mariagrazia Squicciarini; Dr. Tawfik Jelassi; Justice Gilmar Mendes; Mr. Jitin Prasada; Paula Goldman; Professor Virginia Dignum
summary_one_liner: Global leaders embed human rights and ethics into AI governance
icebreaker: Justice Gilmar Mendes and Brando Benifei bring courts and EU Parliament perspectives—how are ethics frameworks shaping your product?
networking_tip: Ethics advocates and legal experts attend this—if you're building AI products, sit with them during Q&A to stress-test your approach.

title:
MedTech and AI Innovations
in Public Health Systems
description: This session showcases practical deployment experiences, highlighting how AI is transforming disease surveillance, diagnostics, and last-mile delivery in resource-limited settings. Through high-level keynotes, real-world case studies, and a panel discussion on "From Innovation to Institutionalisation," the session explores scalable implementation models, regulatory frameworks, and ethical data governance. By convening policymakers, industry innovators, and administrators, the session defines an actionable roadmap for scaling AI-driven solutions within government infrastructure, fostering high-impact partnerships to strengthen public-health delivery.
speakers: Dr. Rakesh Kalapala; Mr. Sanjay Seth; Mr. Shiv Kumar; Mr. Suhel Bidani; Ms. Saraswathi Padmanabhan; Shri Saurabh Gaur; Shri Saurabh Jain
summary_one_liner: AI-driven diagnostics and surveillance scaling across Indian public health
icebreaker: Dr. Rakesh Kalapala's work on diagnostics in resource-limited settings—what health data challenges are you solving?
networking_tip: MedTech founders and public health directors here—ask about last-mile deployment barriers. Specificity wins over generic pitches.

title: Harnessing AI to Manage Climate Extremes and Build Sustainable Systems
description: The panel discussion will convene leading researchers, technocrats, investors, and policymakers to explore "AI for Sustainability and Sustainable AI." It will examine how AI can accelerate India's transition toward climate resilience and sustainable growth, particularly in managing compounding extreme events at hyper-local scales and services for impacted sectors operations. Aligned with the summit's Planet focus, the panel will discuss science driven innovation, trusted systems, and pathways to translate ideas from lab to product ecosystems.
speakers: Dev Niyogi; Dr. Akshara Kaginalkar; Dr. Karthik Kashinath; Dr. M. Ravichandran; Dr. Praphul Chandra; Dr. Shivkumar Kalayanaraman,; Er. Manish Bhardwaj; Mr. Sandeep Singhal; Prof Amit Sheth
summary_one_liner: AI tackles climate extremes with hyper-local sustainability models
icebreaker: Dr. Karthik Kashinath's AI for extreme weather work—are you investing in or building climate tech solutions?
networking_tip: Researchers and investors mix here but investors drive deals. Find the sustainability fund managers in the audience—they move fast.

title: From Silicon to Society: Power Transitions in the AI Century
description: A public discussion on how power is evolving in the age of artificial intelligence, exploring shifts in economic value, institutional strength, and societal trust. It examines how influence may emerge through control of technical infrastructure, large-scale adoption, and the development of shared norms and rules. The conversation highlights changing centers of impact and responsibility as AI becomes more deeply integrated into society.
speakers: Brad Smith; Ebba Busch; Omar Al Olama; Paula Ingabire; Sameer Nigam; Sriram Krishnan
summary_one_liner: Microsoft president and global ministers debate AI's shifting power structures
icebreaker: Brad Smith and the panel on AI's geopolitical shift—how are your business strategies adapting to new power centers?
networking_tip: Heavy hitter alert: Brad Smith draws C-suite. Arrive 20min early for pre-panel networking. Ministers and execs cluster pre-keynote.

title: Keynote
speakers: Matthew Prince, Chief Executive Officer, Cloudflare
summary_one_liner: Cloudflare CEO on infrastructure, security, and AI-era digital resilience
icebreaker: Connect with Matthew Prince on how edge infrastructure powers secure AI applications
networking_tip: Keynote slot = high-profile audience—network in plenary lobby immediately after for visibility

title: Keynote Session: Matthew Prince, Chief Executive Officer, Cloudflare
summary_one_liner: Cloudflare CEO shares vision on internet infrastructure and AI
icebreaker: How's Cloudflare thinking about AI infrastructure for emerging markets?
networking_tip: Infrastructure buyers cluster here—identify SaaS founders building on Cloudflare's stack.

title: Panel: AI in Healthcare
speakers: John Halamka Mayo Clinic Platform; R S Sharma, Former Chief Executive Officer, NHA; L. Nneka Mobisson, Co-founder and Chief Executive Officer, mDoc; Chris Ciauri, Managing Director for International, Anthropic; Moderator: Rizwan Koita, Chairperson of the Board, National Accreditation Board for Hospitals & Healthcare, India
summary_one_liner: Mayo Clinic, India's NHA, and mDoc scale healthcare AI adoption
icebreaker: Ask R S Sharma (NHA) how India's public health AI strategy attracts global healthcare innovators
networking_tip: mDoc founder = health startup lens; Mayo Clinic = scaling playbook—ask both about expansion barriers

title: Keynote
speakers: Vijay Shekar Sharma, CeO, Paytm
summary_one_liner: Paytm CEO on fintech innovation, AI, and digital commerce transformation
icebreaker: Engage post-keynote on how Paytm integrates AI into 500M+ user financial ecosystem
networking_tip: Keynote draws VCs—position as fintech AI provider/investor; work plenary exits strategically

title: Keynote Session: Takahito Tokita, President and CEO Fujitsu
summary_one_liner: Fujitsu CEO outlines enterprise AI and digital transformation strategy
icebreaker: What's Fujitsu's view on making enterprise AI accessible to mid-market companies?
networking_tip: Japan-India tech partnerships are underexplored—seek CIOs exploring cross-region expansion.

title: Panel Discussion
speakers: Salil Parekh, CEO, Infosys; K. Krithivasan, CEO, Tata Consultancy Services; C Vijayakumar, CEO & MD, HCL Technologies; Arundhati Bhattacharya, Chairperson & CEO, Salesforce India; Anand Deshpande, Founder, Chairman, & MD, Persistent Systems; Amitabh Kant, Former CEO, NITI Aayog
summary_one_liner: India's IT giants and Salesforce lead enterprise AI transformation
icebreaker: Ask Salil Parekh (Infosys) how IT services are repositioning for AI-native enterprise solutions
networking_tip: 4 major IT CEOs + Salesforce = talent + partnerships + contracts; network by vertical interest

title: Keynote
speakers: Takahito Tokita, President and CEO Fujitsu
summary_one_liner: Fujitsu CEO on enterprise AI and digital transformation
icebreaker: Ask Takahito about Fujitsu's latest AI infrastructure investments
networking_tip: Connect with enterprise tech leaders during keynote Q&A for enterprise deals

title: AI Capacity Building - Scaling Knowledge, Driving Innovation
description: As AI rapidly reshapes education and research, academic institutions face growing challenges in integrating AI literacy, advanced skills, and ethical readiness into curricula and research programs. This workshop addresses these challenges by bringing together academic leaders, researchers, and standards bodies to explore scalable, interoperable frameworks for AI capacity building.
speakers: Dr. Mohammed Misbahuddin, C-DAC Bangalore; Dr. S D Sudarsan, C-DAC Bangalore; Mr. Ramesh Naidu Laveti, C-DAC Bangalore; Mr. Srikanth Chandrasekaran, IEEE
knowledge_partners: Indo-Pacific European Hub for Digital Partnerships (INPACE)
summary_one_liner: Academic leaders design scalable frameworks for AI skills integration
icebreaker: Dr. Sudarsan, what's the biggest gap between academic AI training and industry readiness?
networking_tip: University deans here control curriculum budgets—pitch interoperability solutions directly to them.

title: Towards a Safer South: Launch of the Global South Network on AI Safety and Evaluation
description: The session will launch the Global South Network on AI Safety & Evaluation — a global alliance of research and civil society organisations working to advance context-aware AI safety research and practice rooted in realities of the Global South. It will explore how AI safety priorities differ across Global South contexts, where South-South collaboration is most needed, and how evidence from deployment contexts across the Global South can strengthen global AI safety efforts.
speakers: Ambassador Philip Thigo, Government of Kenya; Dr Amandeep Singh Gill, United Nations; Dr Balaraman Ravindran, IIT Madras; Dr Fabro Steibel, ITS Rio; Dr Rachel Adams, Global Centre on AI Governance; Dr Rachel Sibande, Gates Foundation; Dr Trevor Mundel, Gates Foundation; Dr Urvashi Aneja, Digital Futures Lab; Mr Abhishek Singh, Ministry of Electronics & IT, GoI; Mr Amir Banafetmi, Cognizant; Mr Vilas Dhar, Patrick McGovern Foundation; Ms Chenai Chair, Masakhane African Languages Hub; Ms Natasha Crampton, Microsoft
summary_one_liner: Launching a Global South alliance for context-aware AI safety research
icebreaker: Dr. Amandeep, how does the Global South Network shift power dynamics in AI safety research?
networking_tip: This launches a network—exchange contact info with civil society directors building regional coalitions.

title: Artificial General Intelligence: A New Paradigm of Safety, Security, Privacy, Ethics, and Governance
description: Artificial general intelligence will intensify existing challenges around safety, security, privacy, ethics, and governance. This session will examine how current trajectories in advanced AI raise near-term governance questions, particularly for developing economies. It will explore institutional readiness, policy gaps, and risk pathways across data, compute, markets, and deployment contexts, and will surface practical considerations for anticipatory governance that can inform responsible decision-making before irreversible dependencies take hold.
speakers: Mr. Atul Kumar, Government Initiatives & Global Trade . DSCI; Mr. Avneesh Pandey, SEBI; Mr. Hendrikus G.J. (Harry) Verweij, Netherland; Mr. Kenny Kesar, Wipro; Mr. Simonas, INFOBALT; Mr. Vinayak Godse, Data Security Council of India; Ms. Alexandra Bech Gjørv, SINTEF; Ms. Aradhana Gupta, Data Security Council of India; Ms. Nicole Foster, Amazon
summary_one_liner: Preparing developing economies for AGI's governance and security challenges
icebreaker: Alexandra, which AGI governance gap concerns you most—safety, privacy, or accountability?
networking_tip: Security and ethics leaders here influence enterprise AI policies—ask about their biggest challenges.

title: AI for Impact: Skilling, Inspiring, and Empowering the Next Gen
description: This session brings together policymakers, academia, and industry leaders to discuss how AI skilling can prepare the workforce for the future AI-led economy. It will explore India's approaches to developing AI talent, strategies for scaling and replicating successful skilling programs across the Global South, and ways to inspire the next generation to create impactful AI solutions for society. This session will aid in gaining insights into building inclusive, scalable AI skilling initiatives that drive innovation and social progress.
speakers: Mr.  Pankaj Kumar Pandey, Principal Secretary to Government, Department of Personnel & Administrative Reforms (e-Governance) and Director, Sakala Mission, Karnataka Government Secretariat; Mr. Aman Jain, Meta; Mr. Buddha Chandrasekhar, Anuvadini AI ; CCO, AICTE; Mr. Darrin Farrant, United Nations Information Centre, India & Bhutan; Mr. Deepak Bagla, Atal Innovation Mission, NITI Aayog; Mr. Manav Subodh, 1M1B; Mr. Rishikesh Patankar, NSDC; Shri Jayant Chaudhary, Minister of Skill Development & Entrepreneurship and MOS,Education
summary_one_liner: Meta-backed dialogue on building inclusive AI talent across Global South
icebreaker: Buddha, how is Meta approaching AI talent development differently in emerging markets?
networking_tip: Workforce and edtech leaders are hiring—have your skilling solution ready for 1-on-1s.

title: Thriving with AI: Human Potential, Skills, and Opportunity
description: AI is rapidly reshaping economies and societies. This panel will examine AI's socio-economic impact on productivity, growth, and with a particular focus on economic opportunity and the evolving role of education and skills. By engaging candidly with both risks and opportunities, the discussion will consider how aligning technology, education, and policy can help shape an AI-driven economy that delivers resilient and sustainable solutions.
speakers: Chris Lehane, OpenAI; Iqbal Dhaliwal, J-PAL; Pragya Misra, OpenAI India; Ronnie Chatterji, OpenAI; Roopa Purushothaman, Tata Sons; Sanjiv Bikhchandani, Info Edge
summary_one_liner: OpenAI-led panel on AI's impact on jobs, skills, and economic opportunity
icebreaker: Sanjiv, how do you see AI reshaping opportunity in India's gig economy?
networking_tip: OpenAI ecosystem partners and HR leaders set vendor strategy—connect during the cocktail after.

title: Shaping the Semiconductor Workforce in the Age of AI
description: A discussion with senior Government officials, academia, and industry leadership on building scalable and holistic workforce frameworks to support the semiconductor industry and the next generation of AI-powered technologies.
speakers: David Fried, Lam Research; Mr Amitesh Sinha, India Semiconductor Mission; Mr Paul Triolo, DGA; Mr Rahul Pachori, GoI; Mr S Krishnan, GoI; Mr Saurabh Chandorkar, Centre for Nanoscience And Engineering, IISC; Rangesh Raghavan, Lam Research; Shri Ashwini Vaishnaw, GoI
summary_one_liner: India's IT Minister leads semiconductor workforce strategy for AI era
icebreaker: Minister Vaishnaw, what's India's biggest chip talent bottleneck—design, manufacturing, or both?
networking_tip: Semiconductor industry execs control hiring budgets—grab them before they leave; sessions end quick with ministers.

title: The Intelligent Image: How AI Is Transforming Filmmaking
description: A curated conversation bringing together filmmakers, creators, marketers, and tech leaders to explore how GenAI is reshaping storytelling, culture, and commerce. The session uses live case studies while examining how platforms, creators, and AI together are birthing the next generation of IP, franchises, and cultural movements.
speakers: Manu Anand, Visual Storyteller; Rahul Regulapati, Galleri5; Rajesh Mapuskar, Indian filmmaker; Sanjay Puran Singh Chauhan, Filmmaker; Vijay Subramaniam, Collective Artists Network
summary_one_liner: GenAI reshapes filmmaking, storytelling, and cultural IP creation
icebreaker: Manu Anand mentioned using GenAI for live case studies—what's the wildest creative experiment you've seen work?
networking_tip: Arrive early to chat with filmmakers during setup; they're more accessible before the formal conversation starts.

title: Embedded Governance for AI in Finance: An India-First, Risk-Based Policy Dialogue
description: This panel discussion will bring together regulators, financial institutions, and fintech stakeholders to examine how risk-based, embedded governance frameworks for artificial intelligence can be designed and operationalised within India's financial ecosystem. The discussion will focus on approaches to balancing innovation with trust, accountability, and supervisory oversight across emerging AI use cases in credit, payments, fraud detection, and compliance.
speakers: Kazim Rizvi, The Dialogue; Priyanka Jain, Fi Money; Vikram Kishore Bhattacharya, Amazon Web Services
summary_one_liner: Risk-based AI governance frameworks for India's financial ecosystem
icebreaker: With Kazim Rizvi leading this, curious—how does your fintech handle embedded governance frameworks today?
networking_tip: Regulators attend these; position yourself near the Q&A section to catch them before they leave.

title: Founders' Adda
description: The Adda is a forum for AI founders to move past polished narratives and into candid, practical exchange. It is designed to surface what is actually working, where real friction exists, and how the ground is shifting as teams build products, hire talent, navigate regulation, and scale. The focus is on lived operating experience shared honestly, peer to peer so founders leave with insight, not soundbites.
speakers: Archana Jahagirdar, Rukam Capital; Pradyum Gupta, Papli Labs; Ravinder Kumar, Tecnod8.AI; Rohan Chaudhary, Rumik.ai; Vaibhav Vats Shukla, Quansys AI
summary_one_liner: AI founders share raw truths on building, scaling, and surviving
icebreaker: Pradyum Gupta and the group on real scaling friction—what's the one thing VCs get wrong about your business model?
networking_tip: Founders focus on candid exchange, not pitching. Come with 2-3 specific problems to discuss. Investors vet founders who listen here.

title: AI for Democracy: Reimagining Governance in the Age of Intelligence
description: This session will examine the evolving role of AI in democratic systems. It will explore how AI can strengthen transparency, accountability, inclusion, and participatory decision-making while remaining grounded in constitutional values and human oversight. It will address applications in public administration and key risks, including bias, privacy, surveillance, and power imbalances, to advance responsible, trust-based AI adoption.
speakers: Dr. Chinmay Pandya, SAIPR, India; Kanishka Narayan MP, UK Department for Science, Innovation and Technology (DSIT); Mr. Lajos Oláh, Hungarian National Assembly; Mr. Martin Chungong, Inter-Parliamentary Union; Mr. Om Birla, Parliament of India; Ms. Jimena Sofía Viveros Álvarez, HumAIn Foundation
summary_one_liner: Parliament leaders explore AI's role in strengthening democratic governance
icebreaker: What's one way AI transparency could strengthen parliamentary accountability in your region, Om?
networking_tip: Arrive early to connect with parliamentarians before the session—they're key decision-makers with limited time.

title: Democratizing AI Requires a Free and Open Internet
description: As AI becomes deeply embedded in economies and societies, the key question is who has access and who benefits. This session brings thought leaders to discuss how true AI democratization depends on preserving the Internet as a global platform rather than fragmented walled gardens. It will explore how open-source ecosystems, data commons, and distributed compute powered by an open Internet can enable startups and developing nations, especially India, to realize inclusive "AI for All" ambitions.
speakers: Matthew Prince, Cloudflare; Rahul Matthan, Trilegal; Rajan Anandan, PeakXV Partners and Surge
summary_one_liner: Open internet as the foundation for truly democratized AI access
icebreaker: Matthew Prince, how does Cloudflare see the open internet as foundational to AI democratization?
networking_tip: Find open source champions in the crowd—they're building the next wave of accessible AI tools.

title: Trust and Safety as Engines for Growth and Innovation
description: Around the world governments and businesses agree: trust is the key for accelerating AI adoption. While research has extensively mapped why trust in AI matters, far less attention has been given to how trust will be implemented, including issues around the people, skills and systems required to operationalize trust and safety at scale.
speakers: Alexandra Reeve Givens, IAPP; Commissioner John Edwards, United Kingdom Government; Josephine Teo, Government of Singapore; Trevor Hughes, IAPP
summary_one_liner: Privacy leaders redefine trust and safety as AI growth accelerators
icebreaker: Commissioner Edwards, what's the most underrated trust mechanism for enterprise AI adoption?
networking_tip: Connect with privacy officers during breaks—they control vendor selection and have real budget authority.

title: Building Inclusive Futures through AI Literacy for India and the Global South
description: This session will examine how AI can be integrated into education in India and the Global South in a responsible, inclusive, and scalable way. It will address the need for foundational AI literacy, clarify what AI literacy means for students, teachers, and parents, and explore practical pathways from curriculum design to classroom implementation. The discussion will also focus on governance, ethics, data privacy, and system-level conditions for safe, large-scale innovation in schools.
speakers: Bhanu Potta, Central Square Foundation; Chitra Ravi, Chrysalis; Dr. Shabana KM, Wadhwani School of Data Science and AI, IIT Madras; Gouri Gupta, Central Square Foundation; Ramya Venkataraman, CENTA; Tanushree Narain Sharma, Transform Schools
summary_one_liner: Scaling AI literacy in schools across India and Global South
icebreaker: Chitra, how are you embedding AI literacy without widening the digital divide in your schools?
networking_tip: Chat with edtech founders about scaling—they're actively hiring for Global South expansion.

title: Keynote
speakers: Ranvir Sachdeva, TEDx speaker & ITU160 Ambassador
summary_one_liner: TEDx speaker explores innovation and emerging tech trends
icebreaker: Ask Ranvir about ITU160 initiatives driving AI adoption globally
networking_tip: Seek out fellow innovators interested in emerging tech trends

title: Panel
speakers: Salil Parekh, Chief Executive Officer, Infosys; K. Krithivasan, Chief Executive Officer, Tata Consultancy Services; C Vijayakumar, Chief Executive Officer & Managing Director, HCL Technologies; Arundhati Bhattacharya, Chairperson & Chief Executive Officer, Salesforce India; Moderator: Amitabh Kant, Former Chief Executive Officer, NITI Aayog
summary_one_liner: IT services CEOs discuss enterprise AI and digital strategy
icebreaker: Ask Salil Parekh about Infosys's AI-first transformation strategy
networking_tip: Network during panel with fellow enterprise leaders on AI adoption

title: Panel: Next Generation of Techies
speakers: Arvind Jain, Founder and Chief Executive Officer, Glean; Navrina Singh, Founder & Chief Executive Officer, Credo AI; Bipul Sinha, Chairman, Co-Founder & CEO, Rubrik; Malhar Bhide, Chief Technology Officer, Origin Bio; Deepak Pathak, Co-founder and Chief Executive Officer, Skild AI; Moderator: Anirudh Suri, Managing Partner, India Internet Fund
summary_one_liner: Next-gen tech founders on AI products and responsible innovation
icebreaker: Ask Navrina Singh how Credo AI approaches responsible AI governance
networking_tip: Connect with founders post-panel for potential collaboration on AI safety

title: Keynote Session: Upendra Dwivedi, Chief of the Army Staff, India
summary_one_liner: India's Army Chief addresses AI in national defense and security
icebreaker: How is the Indian Army thinking about human-AI collaboration in defense?
networking_tip: Defense tech is closed-knit—build credibility by asking substantive questions, then request intros.

title: Keynote
speakers: Lt Gen Vipul Shinghal, AVSM, SM Deputy Chief of the Army Staff (Information Systems & Training)
summary_one_liner: Defense AI and national security implications from Indian Army
icebreaker: Ask Lt Gen Shinghal about AI applications in defense modernization
networking_tip: Connect with policymakers on defense/security AI initiatives

title: Unpacking Openness and Trust in AI: Global Perspectives
description: This high-level panel explores a central tension in AI governance: openness can enable collaboration, innovation, and trust, yet may be constrained by commercial, state, and security considerations. The session examines how openness can function across the AI stack - compute, data, models, APIs, and applications and how to prevent misleading claims of openness. The panel also aims to highlight meaningful openness for emerging economies, balancing innovation, intellectual property, and national security.
speakers: Alondra Nelson, Princeton University; Amba Kak, AI Now; Anne Bouvert, Government of France; Astha Kapoor, Aapti Institute; Karen Hao, ; Ravneet Kaur, Competition Commission of India
summary_one_liner: Critical examination of openness claims across the AI technology stack
icebreaker: Alondra Nelson on openness vs. security trade-offs—where does your organization land on open-source AI?
networking_tip: Policy researchers and journalists here; share authentic perspectives on trust rather than corporate talking points.

title: Protecting Global Citizens by Securing Communications with AI
description: This session showcases the "Made in India" Wisely AI solution where the burden of fending off the fraudster is moved from the individual to the intelligent network core. This discussion will explore the regulatory, technical, and business dimensions of deploying AI-led security at a national scale.
speakers: Anshuman Kar, Tanla Platform Limited; Ratan Kumar Kesh, Bandhan Bank; Robert J. Ravi, BSNL; Sunil Bajpai, Tanla Platforms Limited; Sunil Kumar, Tanla Platforms Limited; Uday Reddy, Tanla Platforms Limited; Vikram Sinha, Indosat Ooredoo Hutchison
summary_one_liner: Made-in-India AI platform fights telecom fraud at national scale
icebreaker: The Wisely AI solution shifts fraud burden to the network—how is your telecom infrastructure adapting to this shift?
networking_tip: Technical session with high-level execs; focus on telecom and cybersecurity leaders during breaks for concrete partnerships.

title: Shaping the AI Narrative: Trust, Outcomes and Responsibility
description: As AI adoption accelerates, enterprises are assessing how the next wave of transformation differs from earlier expectations. This session brings together investors, founders, and transformation leaders to examine where enterprise AI can create value, where limitations remain, and how organisations can move from pilot initiatives to scaled deployment. The discussion will also consider how operating models may evolve in response to emerging AI-enabled workflows.
speakers: Divyesh Vithlani, First Abu Dhabi Bank (FAB); Erik Ekudden, Ericsson; Hari Shetty, Wipro; Hon. Dr. Andrew Charlton MP, Science, Technology and the Digital Economy Government of Australia; Jay Chaudhry, Zscaler; Mridu Bhandari, CNBC-TV18; Tanuj Kapilashrami, Standard Chartered
summary_one_liner: Global enterprise leaders turn AI promises into measurable real-world proof
icebreaker: Jay Chaudhry on turning AI promise into proof—what's your biggest blocker moving pilots to production?
networking_tip: C-suite heavy room; be ready with 1-2 concrete outcomes, not aspirations. CIOs prefer substance over pitch.

title: Enterprise-Grade Responsible AI for India and the Global South
description: For India and the Global South, as AI systems move from pilots to mission-critical deployment across enterprises and governments, this challenge is amplified by fragmented and heterogeneous data, legacy IT infrastructure, uneven regulatory maturity, multilingual and culturally diverse populations, and high-impact use cases in finance, healthcare, welfare delivery, and public services. This session will examine what enterprise-grade responsible AI looks like in such contexts, grounded in real deployments rather than abstract frameworks.
speakers: Anupam Chattopadhyay, College of Computing & Data Science, NTU Singapore; Babak Hodjat, Cognizant; Balaji Thiagarajan, Flipkart; Hari Menon, Gates Foundation; Mike Haley, Autodesk; Raju Vegesna, Sify Technologies Ltd; Shereen Bhan, CNBC-TV18
summary_one_liner: Real deployment lessons for responsible enterprise AI in emerging markets
icebreaker: Anupam Chattopadhyay on responsible AI for fragmented data—how's your Global South deployment handling heterogeneous systems?
networking_tip: Enterprise architects and CIOs from emerging markets—connect over shared infrastructure constraints, not solutions.

title: Leveraging AI4All: Pathways to Inclusion
description: This session brings together leaders from government, industry, the judiciary, and international institutions to showcase how India is deploying AI for population-scale, citizen-centric impact. The session examines real-world inclusion successes across accessibility, language, and service delivery, and explores how India's experience can inform global collaboration, capacity building, and inclusive AI adoption across the world.
speakers: Agustya Mehta, Meta; Archana Joshi, Xoriant; Arghya Bhattacharya, Adalat AI; Hoda Baraka, The Egyptian Minister of ICT for Technology Talents Development, Egypt; Rutuja Pol, Ikigai Law
summary_one_liner: India showcases population-scale inclusive AI across language and accessibility
icebreaker: Hoda Baraka, what's the biggest barrier you've seen to multilingual AI reaching rural India?
networking_tip: Connect with Accessibility Advocates early—they're decision-makers for inclusive tech pilots and rarely attend these sessions.

title: Harnessing the AI Revolution for Social Empowerment
description: This panel examines how the rapid scale and speed of artificial intelligence adoption is reshaping work, employment, and skill requirements, with a strong focus on inclusive and responsible AI. The discussion brings together diverse perspectives to explore what is required to ensure AI is developed and deployed in ways that minimise labour market disruptions, strengthen workforce resilience, and advance social empowerment - particularly for vulnerable and transitioning worker populations.
speakers: Mr. Anurag Behar, Azim Premji Foundation; Ms. Julie Delahanty, International Development Research Centre (IDRC), Canada; Ms. Sabina Dewan, JustJobs Network; Ms. Sandhya Ramachandran Arun, Wipro Limited
summary_one_liner: Ensuring AI-driven labor transitions protect vulnerable worker populations
icebreaker: Sabina Dewan's work on worker protection—how is your organization rethinking employment for the AI era?
networking_tip: This attracts policy makers and CHROs; connect over shared concerns about workforce transitions, not sales pitches.

title: Toward Collective Action: A Roundtable on Safe and Trusted AI
description: This roundtable brings together African policymakers, researchers, civil society, and innovation leaders to discuss safe and trusted AI governance.
