The focus will be on implementing commitments, enhancing coordination, and addressing underexplored risks, such as cyber, bio, and loss-of-control threats. The session will include opening reflections, a moderated panel, and an interactive Q&A to share insights and identify collaboration pathways, contributing to the India AI Impact Summit outcomes.
speakers: Chinasa T. Okolo, TechneCultura . United Nations office for digital and emerging technologies; Kola Ijasan, Research ICT Africa; Mark Gaffley, Global Centre on Governance; Mark Gaffley, Global Centre on Governance
summary_one_liner: African leaders craft collective AI safety governance for the continent
icebreaker: Chinasa Okolo's framing on African AI governance—what does safe AI look like in your context?
networking_tip: Global South focus means diverse perspectives; ask specific questions about local governance gaps to stand out.

title: Preparing to Monitor the Impacts of Agents: Closing the Global Assurance Divide for Safe and Trusted AI
description: This 60-minute panel session examines how real-time monitoring and threshold-based safety frameworks can be applied to govern AI agents at scale. It explores inclusive AI assurance approaches that support safe, trusted, and interoperable deployment across diverse global contexts.
speakers: Chris Meserole, Frontier Model Forum; Doreen Bogdan-Martin, International Telecommuni cation Union (ITU); Madhu Srikumar, Partnership on AI; Minister Josephine Teo, Singapore Government; Natasha Crampton, Microsoft; Owen Larter, Microsoft; Rebecca Finlay, Partnership on AI; Rumman Chowdhury, Humane Intelligence; Stephanie Ifayemi, Partnership on AI; Vukosi Marivate (confirmed), University of Pretoria
summary_one_liner: ITU chief and global leaders build safety frameworks for AI agents
icebreaker: Minister Josephine Teo and Rumman Chowdhury on real-time monitoring—how's your team preparing for agentic AI oversight?
networking_tip: High decision-maker density; this is small-room access to regulators and safety leaders—prep specific governance questions.

title: Keynote
speakers: Sara Hooker, Co-founder, Adaption Labs
summary_one_liner: Adaptation Labs co-founder on AI research and frontier challenges
icebreaker: Ask Sara Hooker about research gaps in frontier AI models
networking_tip: Engage with researchers on practical AI safety implementation

title: Keynote
speakers:
Dr Pramod Varma 
 Co-founder & Chief Architect, 
 Networks for Humanity (NFH)
summary_one_liner: Digital public infrastructure and AI for social impact
icebreaker: Ask Dr Pramod Varma about Networks for Humanity's AI infrastructure model
networking_tip: Connect with policymakers on digital public goods and AI

title: Democratisation of AI – Bharat Story
description: This session explores embedding AI into India's Digital Public Infrastructure (DPI) to make technology truly inclusive. Leveraging the foundation of the Bharat Stack, including Aadhaar, UPI, Bhashini, and ONDC, the panel discusses how state governments are scaling AI for citizen centric governance, widening access to shared infrastructure, improving benefits delivery, and enabling startups and MSMEs to adopt plug and play AI tools for population scale impact.
speakers: Dr. Manjula N, IAS; Mr. Bhaskar Katamneni, IAS; Mr. Sanjay Dubey, IAS; Mr. Sanjeev Kumar Gupta; Mr. Vishal Kumar Dev, IAS
summary_one_liner: India's DPI stack powers AI democratization for citizen-scale governance
icebreaker: Ask IAS officers how startups can leverage Bhashini to build on Bharat Stack—they fund pilots.
networking_tip: Seek out the State Gov Policy Makers during breaks—high decision-maker density means budget holders aren't in formal panels.

title: Panel: Powering AI
speakers: SGK Kishore, Executive officer and Chief Innovation Officer, GMR; Vineet Mittal, Chairman, Avaada Group; Natham Blom, Vice President, Cooling, Chemours; Moderator: Arunabha Ghosh, Chief Executive Officer, Council on Energy, Environment and Water
summary_one_liner: Energy, cooling, and AI infrastructure for sustainable computing
icebreaker: Ask SGK Kishore about GMR's approach to powering AI data centers
networking_tip: Network with energy and cooling experts on sustainable AI infrastructure

title: Panel: AI in DPI
speakers: Robert Opp, Chief Digital Officer, UNDP; Dr. Hans Wijayasuriya, Chief Advisor to President of Sri Lanka on Digital Economy, Sri Lanka; Saibal Chakraborty, Managing Director and Senior Partner, BCG; Sangbu Kim, Vice President for Digital, World Bank; Moderator: CV Madhukar, Chief Executive Officer, Co-Develop
summary_one_liner: Digital Public Infrastructure: Global leaders discuss AI's role in DPI
icebreaker: Ask Robert Opp how UNDP is operationalizing AI within DPI frameworks across developing nations.
networking_tip: Connect with the BCG partner to discuss DPI implementation strategies—they likely advise governments.
